Title: Enhancing Understanding Through Data Transparency

Description: As a data analyst, I want to access and view data from the Sync Matrix 1.0 and Exercise Management Tool 1.0 applications, so that I can analyze and derive insights transparently for informed decision-making.

Work: 
- Ensure data from both Sync Matrix 1.0 and Exercise Management Tool 1.0 can be accessed and displayed in a clear format.
- Implement clear labeling and documentation of the data source to ensure transparency.
- Provide users with explanations and context for the data displayed to enhance understandability.
- Verify and validate the data transformation process to maintain data integrity.
- Conduct user testing to confirm that the data is presented in an easily comprehensible manner.

text: The system shall link Events back to either the Sync Matrix 1.0 or the Exercise Managment Tool 1.0 applications for modifications.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Transparency

Title: Ensure Event Modification Transparency

Description: As an Event Coordinator, I want to link Events back to either the Sync Matrix 1.0 or the Exercise Management Tool 1.0 for modifications so that I can clearly understand and track any changes made to the events and ensure all stakeholders are aware of updates.

Work:
- Ensure system provides clear linking of events to either Sync Matrix 1.0 or Exercise Management Tool 1.0 for transparent modifications.
- Implement a logging mechanism for all changes made to events through these linked applications.
- Provide users with notifications or alerts when modifications are made.
- Enable a view where all modifications and their origins (Sync Matrix 1.0 or Exercise Management Tool 1.0) are easily viewable by authorized personnel.
- Ensure that the system documentation offers clear guidance on how the linking and modification process works.

text: The system shall allow modification of the display.
ethical_us:
Title: Customizable Display for User Autonomy

Description: As a user, I want to modify the system display so that I can personalize my experience and maintain control over my interaction with the technology.

Work: 
- The system shall provide users with options to customize the display, including font size, color scheme, and layout.
- Changes made by the user should be immediately reflected in the interface.
- Users will have an easy reset option to revert to default display settings if desired.
- The customization options should be intuitive and accessible to all users, regardless of their technical expertise.
- The system must include a help guide or tooltips to assist users in making display modifications.
- User preferences for display settings should be stored securely and respected by the system across sessions. 

Ethical Principle: Freedom and autonomy - This principle is related as it ensures that users have the freedom to control their interaction with the system, maintaining their autonomy by allowing them to personalize their experience.

text: The system shall filter data by: Venues and Key Events.
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent Data Filtering for Event Organizers

Description: As an event organizer, I want to filter data by venues and key events so that I can easily access and analyze relevant information, ensuring transparency and informed decision-making.

Work: 
- Acceptance criteria:

  1. Users can access a comprehensive list of venues and key events to filter data.
  2. The filtering system provides clear documentation on how data is filtered and any criteria applied.
  3. The interface displays filtered results in a transparent manner, showing the logic applied.
  4. Users are provided with guidance on interpreting the filtered data and any limitations associated with it.
  5. The system allows users to export or download the filtered data for further analysis.

text: The system shall allow a user to define the time segments
ethical_us:
**Title: User Control Over Time Segmentation**

**Description:** As a user, I want to define the time segments so that I can have autonomy over how my data and activities are structured and analyzed.

**Work:**

- The system must provide an intuitive interface for users to define custom time segments.
- Visual feedback must be given to users when they create or modify time segments.
- The system should save the user-defined time segments to be reused or adjusted in future sessions.
- Users should be able to easily delete or edit previously defined time segments.
- Thorough testing to ensure the feature functions as intended and does not cause errors or data loss.
- Incorporate a help section or guide to assist users in understanding how to utilize the time-segment feature effectively.

**Related Ethical Principle: Freedom and Autonomy**

This user story is aligned with the principle of Freedom and Autonomy, ensuring that users have control over how they interact with and structure their experience with the system.

text: The system shall display the local and exercise time in separate clocks
ethical_us:
### Title: Clear Time Differentiation for Enhanced User Understanding

#### Description:
As a **fitness enthusiast**, I want to view the local and exercise time on separate clocks so that I can accurately track my workout duration and local time without confusion, enhancing my overall exercise experience and schedule management.

#### Work:
- Display the local time on a clearly labeled digital clock on the user interface.
- Display the exercise start and ongoing time separately, clearly labeled, to indicate the workout duration.
- Ensure both clocks are easily readable and distinguishable from each other in terms of design and placement on the user interface.
- Provide a brief explanation or tooltip on what each clock represents, further contributing to user understanding and transparency.
- Conduct usability testing to verify that users can differentiate between the two clocks easily and understand their purpose without prior instruction.

text: The system shall offer the ability to pause and resume the refresh of data.
ethical_us:
Title: Enable Data Refresh Control for User Autonomy

Description: As a data analyst, I want to have the ability to pause and resume the data refresh process so that I can manage data flow according to my workflow needs and maintain control over my work environment.

Work:
- Implement a pause button in the data refresh interface.
- Implement a resume button that allows users to continue the data refresh process from where it was paused.
- Ensure the system saves the current state of the data before the refresh is paused.
- Provide a confirmation prompt when pausing and resuming to prevent accidental interruptions.
- Document the pause and resume functionality clearly in the user manual.
- Test the pause and resume features for seamless user experience and reliability. 

Ethical Principle: Freedom and autonomy

text: The system shall provide charts for the Activity or Event actual versus assumed time.
ethical_us:
**Title:** Transparent Analysis of Time Management

**Description:** As a project manager, I want to view charts comparing actual versus assumed time for activities or events so that I can evaluate project efficiency transparently and make informed decisions.

**Work:** 
- The system shall display clear and comprehensible charts that differentiate between actual and assumed time for each activity or event.
- The system shall allow users to filter charts by specific time periods or activity/event types to improve usability and understanding.
- The system shall include a tooltip or legend to explain the significance of chart data, enhancing transparency and understanding.
- The system shall ensure data accuracy and consistency in reported times to maintain trust and reliability.
- The system shall provide export functionality for these charts to facilitate transparent communication in reports or presentations.

text: The system shall provide a history report of changes made to the Activity or Event data
ethical_us:
Title: Activity Change History Report for Transparent Data Management

Description: As a system auditor, I want to access a history report of changes made to the Activity or Event data so that I can ensure transparency and accountability in data management processes.

Work: 
- The system must record every change made to the Activity or Event data, including the date, time, and user who made the change.
- A report generation feature should be implemented to produce a detailed history of changes within a specified date range.
- The report should be easily accessible and formatted for clarity, including filters and search capabilities to locate specific changes.
- User interface components should clearly differentiate between different types of changes (additions, deletions, modifications).
- Ensure that access to the history report is logged to maintain a record of who has viewed it to further ensure accountability.

text: The look and feel of the system shall conform to the user interface standards of the smart device.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Trust

Title: Consistent User Interface for Trust Building

Description: As a user of the smart device, I want the system to conform to the user interface standards of my device so that I can trust and efficiently navigate the application without confusion or error.

Work:
- Ensure the application interface matches the design and layout standards of the smart device platform it is deployed on (e.g., Android, iOS).
- Conduct usability testing with users familiar with the device's interface standards to confirm consistency and user comfort.
- Provide a feedback mechanism within the application for users to report inconsistencies or confusion related to the interface.
- Update and maintain adherence to interface standards with each device/platform update to ensure ongoing consistency and trustworthiness.

text: The user interface shall have standard menus buttons for navigation
ethical_us:
Title: Intuitive Navigation for Ethical User Experience

Description: As a general user, I want the user interface to have standard menu buttons for navigation so that I can easily and transparently navigate through the application without confusion or unnecessary learning curves.

Work:
- Ensure the user interface design follows established UX/UI standards for navigation.
- Implement standard menu buttons that are easily recognizable and accessible.
- Provide tooltips or brief descriptions for each menu button to enhance understanding.
- Conduct usability testing with diverse users to confirm the intuitive nature of the navigation.
- Regularly update navigation elements based on user feedback and evolving design standards.

text: The system shall have a professional appearance
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Professional System Appearance for Building Trust

Description: As a user, I want the system to have a professional appearance so that I can trust its credibility and reliability.

Work: 
- The user interface should be consistent in design and adhere to professional aesthetics guidelines.
- Typography, color schemes, and layout should reflect industry standards for professionalism.
- Regular feedback from users should be collected to ensure the appearance meets expectations.
- Design reviews should be conducted by a cross-functional team, including UX/UI designers, for maintaining consistency.
- Ensure that all system messages and communications are clear, concise, and respectful.
- Implement a process for updating and refreshing the design to keep it modern and professional.

Ethical Principle: Trust

text: The product shall have a consistent color scheme and fonts.
ethical_us:
Title: Consistent Design for Improved User Experience

Description: As a user, I want the product to have a consistent color scheme and fonts so that the interface is visually coherent and accessible, enhancing my ability to navigate and use the application effectively.

Work:
- Ensure the application’s color scheme is consistent across all pages and components.
- Verify that the same font style and size is used uniformly throughout the product.
- Conduct usability testing to confirm that the design elements do not distract or confuse users.
- Review accessibility guidelines to guarantee that the color contrast and font choices are friendly to all users, including those with visual impairments.
- Provide documentation that explains the design choices and their benefits to users for transparency and trust-building. 

This ethical user story aligns with the principle of Transparency, as it focuses on clear communication and understandability of the user interface, thereby enhancing user trust and satisfaction.

text: The system shall be used by realtors with no training.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Transparency

Title: Transparent Usage Training for Untrained Realtors

Description: As a realtor, I want to use the system without formal training so that I can efficiently perform my tasks and understand how the system supports my work.

Work: 
- Ensure the system interface is intuitive and user-friendly for realtors.
- Develop comprehensive and easy-to-understand in-system guides and tooltips.
- Implement a walkthrough feature that guides first-time users through the system’s key functions.
- Provide access to support channels, such as chat or call, within the system for realtors needing additional assistance.
- Gather feedback from new users to improve system understandability and ease of use.
- Conduct periodic reviews to ensure all features remain comprehensible to users without training.

text: The product shall be easy for a realtor to learn.
ethical_us:
**Title:** Easy-to-Learn Product for Realtors

**Description:** As a realtor, I want the product to be easy to learn so that I can effectively use it to serve my clients efficiently without unnecessary delays.

**Work:**
- Conduct a usability study to understand the learning curve challenges faced by realtors.
- Design an intuitive user interface tailored to the common workflows of realtors.
- Provide comprehensive onboarding tutorials and guides focused on realtors' tasks.
- Implement a user-friendly help system with accessible tips and FAQs.
- Gather feedback from realtors during the initial learning phase and make iterative improvements based on their inputs. 

**Ethical Principle:** Dignity. Ensuring that the product is easy for a realtor to learn respects their inherent worth by valuing their time and efforts, thereby allowing them to focus on their primary job - serving clients with efficiency and confidence.

text: The product shall produce search results in an acceptable time
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Trust

Title: Ensuring Timely Search Results for User Trust

Description: As a user, I want the product to produce search results in an acceptable time so that I can trust the efficiency and reliability of the application.

Work:
- Acceptance criteria:
  1. The search function should return relevant results within 2 seconds of the query being entered.
  2. Performance testing must be conducted to ensure search result times are maintained under varying server loads.
  3. If a search query cannot be fulfilled within the expected time, a message should inform the user and offer alternative actions.
  4. Implement a mechanism to log instances where search response times exceed 2 seconds for ongoing monitoring and improvement.
  5. Daily performance reports are reviewed to ensure consistent user experience and address any delays promptly.

text: The search results shall be returned no later 30 seconds  after the user has entered the search criteria
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Trust

Title: Reliable and Timely Search Results 

Description: As a user, I want the search results to be returned within 30 seconds after entering the search criteria so that I can rely on the system to provide timely and efficient information, enhancing my trust in the system's performance.

Work:
- Ensure the search algorithm is optimized to retrieve results within the specified timeframe.
- Implement monitoring tools to track search response times and identify any delays.
- Establish a protocol to alert the system administrator if search results exceed the 30-second threshold.
- Conduct regular performance testing to maintain the 30-second response time under various load conditions.
- Provide user feedback mechanisms to report any issues with search result delays.

text: The product shall generate a CMA report in an acceptable time.
ethical_us:
**Title:** Timely CMA Report Generation for Trustworthiness

**Description:** As a customer using the AI product, I want to receive a CMA report within an acceptable timeframe so that I can trust the reliability and efficiency of the service.

**Work:**  
- Ensure that the system processes and generates the CMA report within the industry-standard timeframe (e.g., under X minutes).  
- Conduct thorough performance testing to identify any bottlenecks in report generation.  
- Implement optimizations to improve the speed of data processing and report generation without sacrificing accuracy.  
- Monitor system performance continuously to ensure consistent and timely report delivery.  
- Provide notifications or status updates to users if a delay in report generation is anticipated.

text: The CMA report shall be returned no later 60 seconds after the user has entered the CMA report criteria.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Timely Access to Information

Description: As a data analyst, I want to receive the CMA report within 60 seconds after entering the report criteria so that I can efficiently perform my analysis and make timely decisions based on accurate data.

Work: 
- Verify that the system processes and generates the CMA report in under 60 seconds.
- Ensure that the server and database are optimized for quick retrieval of required data.
- Conduct load testing to confirm system performance under high demand.
- Establish monitoring alerts to detect any delays in report generation times.
- Implement user notifications to inform if reports might take longer than expected during peak times. 

The most relevant ethical principle here is Trust. Trust is built by ensuring systems work properly and efficiently, such as providing timely access to necessary information for decision-making.

text: The product shall synchronize contacts and appointments in an acceptable time.
ethical_us:
Title: Timely Synchronization of Contacts and Appointments  

Description: As a busy professional, I want the product to synchronize my contacts and appointments in an acceptable time so that I can efficiently manage my schedule without unnecessary delays.  

Work:  
- Ensure the synchronization process completes within a defined and acceptable time frame.  
- Test the synchronization feature under various network conditions to maintain performance.  
- Provide real-time feedback to users during the synchronization process to enhance transparency.  
- Confirm all synchronized data is accurate and up-to-date.  
- Include a user guide detailing the synchronization process and time expectations.  

(Note: This user story relates to the ethical principle of Transparency to ensure users are well-informed about the synchronization process and its timeline, enhancing user trust and satisfaction.)

text: The product shall synchronize with the office system every hour.
ethical_us:
Title: Timely Data Synchronization for Enhanced System Performance

Description: As an Office Administrator, I want the product to synchronize with the office system every hour so that our data remains up-to-date and any changes are accurately reflected in a timely manner, ensuring transparency in operations and decision-making.

Work:
- Ensure the synchronization process occurs automatically every hour without manual intervention.
- Confirm that the data being synchronized is accurate and complete.
- Provide clear logging of synchronization activities, including any errors or exceptions, to ensure transparency.
- Test the synchronization process to verify it does not negatively impact system performance or user experience.
- Create a communication protocol to notify administrators of synchronization status and outcomes.

text: The product shall be available for use 24 hours per day 365 days  per year
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Continuous Access for All Users

Description: As a conscientious technology user, I want to have access to the product 24 hours per day, 365 days per year so that I can rely on its availability for timely and continuous support in my activities.

Work: 
- Verify that the system architecture supports uninterrupted availability and can handle peak loads.
- Implement redundancy and failover strategies to minimize downtime.
- Conduct regular maintenance and updates during non-peak hours to ensure system stability.
- Set up monitoring and alert systems for real-time issue detection and response.
- Perform periodic load testing to ensure sustained performance under various conditions.
- Ensure support teams are available for timely resolution of any unforeseen system issues. 

Ethical Principle: Trust

By ensuring the product is available constantly, trust is built with users, who can rely on the system to perform as expected, fulfilling its promises and increasing end-user confidence in the technology's reliability and efficiency.

text: Out of 1000 accesses to the system the system is available 999 times.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Trust

Title: Ensure System Reliability and Trustworthiness

Description: As an end user, I want the system to be available consistently so that I can rely on it for critical tasks without disruptions.

Work: 
- Conduct thorough testing to identify potential downtime issues and implement fixes.
- Establish a robust monitoring system to detect and resolve availability anomalies in real-time.
- Schedule regular maintenance during non-peak hours to minimize impact on users.
- Implement redundant systems to ensure continued operation in case of failure.
- Provide transparent communication to users about any scheduled downtime or unexpected outages.

text: The product shall operate in offline mode whenever internet connection is unavailable.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Freedom and autonomy

Title: Ensure User Autonomy with Offline Mode Functionality

Description: As a conscious user, I want the product to operate in offline mode whenever the internet connection is unavailable so that I can maintain control over my activities and continue using the service without dependency on an active internet connection.

Work:
- Implement an offline mode feature that allows basic functionalities to operate without an internet connection.
- Ensure data entered or actions taken offline are queued for synchronization once the connection is restored.
- Maintain user privacy and security even when operating in offline mode.
- Clearly communicate to users when the application is switching between online and offline modes.
- Provide a notification or alert to users indicating when offline mode is engaged and when data has been successfully synced once connection resumes.

text: The product shall allow the user to view previously downloaded search results CMA reports  and appointments.
ethical_us:
Title: Transparency in Accessing Historical Data

Description: As a user, I want to view previously downloaded search results, CMA reports, and appointments so that I can have a clear understanding and review of the information I have accessed over time to make informed decisions.

Work:

- Ensure that the system provides an intuitive and easy-to-navigate interface for accessing historical data.
- Confirm that users can filter and sort previous search results, CMA reports, and appointments by date or category.
- Validate that previously downloaded data are displayed accurately and consistently in the user interface.
- Implement a feature that allows users to download or export their historical data for offline review.
- Ensure that any access to historical data is logged to maintain transparency in data access and usage.
- Provide clear explanation or documentation on how historical data can be accessed and interpreted within the platform.

text: The product shall retain user preferences in the event of a failure.
ethical_us:
**Title: Ensuring Consistent User Experience Through Preference Retention** 

**Description:** As a user, I want my preferences to be automatically saved and restored in the event of a system failure so that I can trust the platform to maintain my personalized settings and provide a seamless experience without repeated manual input.

**Work:**

- Implement automatic saving of user preferences at regular intervals to prevent loss during unexpected failures.
- Test the system's ability to accurately restore user preferences after simulating various failure scenarios.
- Ensure clear communication to users about how their preferences are saved and restored, including any limitations.
- Develop a recovery protocol that prioritizes user-specific settings during a system restart.
- Conduct user testing to validate that the system reliably provides the expected personalized experience post-recovery. 

The associated ethical principle here is **Trust**. Trust is crucial in ensuring users feel confident that their personalized experiences will not be disrupted even if failures occur, and that the system performs reliably.

text: 100% of saved user preferences shall be restored when system comes back online.
ethical_us:
**Title:** Ensuring User Trust by Restoring Preferences

**Description:** As a responsible user, I want my saved preferences to be fully restored when the system comes back online so that I can trust that my data and settings are secure and consistent.

**Work:**
- Verify that all user preferences are saved accurately before the system goes offline.
- Develop a robust mechanism to securely store user preferences during downtime.
- Ensure seamless restoration of 100% of user preferences when the system comes back online.
- Conduct thorough testing of the preference restoration process to guarantee no data is lost or corrupted.
- Confirm that users are informed about the restoration process and its success, building transparency and trust. 

This user story relates to the ethical principle of Trust, as it focuses on maintaining and enhancing the user's trust in the system through reliable management and restoration of their preferences.

text: The product shall be able to support multiple remote users
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Freedom and Autonomy

Title: Supporting Multiple Remote Users for Enhanced Autonomy

Description: As a remote worker, I want to access and use the product alongside other users from various locations so that we can collaborate effectively without constraints and maintain our autonomy in performing tasks remotely.

Work:
- Ensure the system can handle multiple concurrent user sessions without degradation in performance.
- Implement secure login processes to authenticate each remote user.
- Provide real-time data synchronization for all users to ensure consistency and collaboration.
- Allow customizable user settings to personalize the remote working environment for individual needs.
- Conduct load testing to confirm system reliability under expected user scenarios.
- Include user feedback loops to continuously improve the remote user experience.

text: The product shall be able support 1000 simultaneous users.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Scalability for Reliable Access

Description: As a system administrator, I want the product to support 1000 simultaneous users so that we can ensure reliable access and maintain trust in our service's performance.

Work:
- Conduct stress testing to verify the system can handle 1000 simultaneous users without degradation of performance.
- Monitor system resources to ensure scalability and efficient resource management.
- Implement load balancing mechanisms to distribute demand evenly across servers.
- Prepare a contingency plan for managing unexpected spikes in user demand.
- Document system load handling processes and ensure transparency of scalability features to stakeholders.

text: The product shall be capable of handling the existing 1000 users. This number is expected to grow 5 times within the next year.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Scalable and Responsible User Capacity

Description: As a system administrator, I want to ensure the AI product can handle the existing 1000 users and scale to accommodate a 5x increase within the next year so that users experience consistent and reliable service without disruption.

Work:
1. Conduct a load testing process to assess the current system performance with 1000 users.
2. Develop a scalable architecture capable of supporting 5000 concurrent users.
3. Implement monitoring tools to track application performance under varying loads.
4. Ensure that resource usage efficiency is optimized to prevent unnecessary cost increases or resource exhaustion.
5. Establish a contingency plan for any potential overload scenarios to maintain user trust and service reliability.
6. Regularly review and update the system to accommodate further growth and unexpected user spikes responsibly.

text: The product shall be installed by an untrained realtor without recourse to separately-printed instructions.
ethical_us:
Title: Accessible Installation for Realtors

Description: As an untrained realtor, I want to be able to install the product without needing separately-printed instructions so that I can quickly and easily set up and use the product without unnecessary complications or delays.

Work: 
- The product must provide intuitive, step-by-step digital instructions that guide the untrained realtor through the installation process.
- Ensure that all necessary tools and components are included with the product to avoid the need for additional materials.
- The installation process must be tested by individuals without prior training to ensure ease of understanding and usability.
- Provide support through a dedicated helpline or live chat for immediate assistance during installation.
- Include visual aids such as diagrams or videos to enhance understanding for visual learners.
- Gather and incorporate feedback from realtors who have installed the product to continuously improve the instructions and process.

Related Principle: Transparency

Rationale: This transformation focuses on transparency by ensuring the installation process is clear and understandable for users without specialized training. It addresses the need for explainability and effective communication of instructions to promote ease of use and installation.

text: 90% of untrained realtors shall be able to install the product on their device without printed instructions
ethical_us:
Title: Seamless Installation for Realtors

Description: As a realtor, I want to install the product on my device without needing printed instructions, so that I can quickly and efficiently set up the system and begin using it.

Work:
- Acceptance Criteria:
  1. Ensure the installation process is intuitive and requires minimal user input.
  2. Provide clear in-app guidance or digital instructions during installation.
  3. Test the installation process with a diverse group of untrained realtors to ensure at least 90% success rate.
  4. Gather and implement feedback from realtors to improve installation ease-of-use.
  5. Validate that all necessary permissions and system requirements are clearly communicated during installation. 

This user story aligns with the ethical principle of Transparency. By making the installation process clear and accessible, it ensures that realtors understand and feel confident in setting up the system without unnecessary obstacles or confusion, fostering transparency in usability and communication.

text: The product is expected to run on Windows CE and Palm operating systems.

Ethical Principle: Responsibility

- Test the product on devices running Windows CE and Palm OS to ensure consistent performance.

- Provide clear documentation and support for users operating on Windows CE and Palm OS to assist with setup and troubleshooting.
- Seek feedback from users on these platforms to enhance user experience and address any unmet needs.

text: The system shall allow a real estate agent to query MLS information
ethical_us:
Title: Fair Access to MLS Information for Real Estate Agents

Description: As a real estate agent, I want to query MLS (Multiple Listing Service) information so that I can accurately and fairly represent property listings to potential buyers and sellers.

Work:
- Ensure that the system provides equal access to MLS data for all registered real estate agents without any form of discrimination.
- Validate that the data retrieved from MLS is up-to-date and accurate, reflecting current market conditions.
- Implement user authentication to ensure that only legitimate real estate agents have access to MLS data.
- Provide clear guidelines and documentation on how to use the MLS query features to avoid misuse or misinterpretation of the data.
- Incorporate a feedback mechanism for real estate agents to report any discrepancies or issues with the MLS data accessed through the system.

text: The user shall be able to get driving directions to a selected property
ethical_us:
**Title:** Transparent Navigation Assistance for Property Directions

**Description:** As a navigator, I want to receive clear and understandable driving directions to a selected property so that I can reach my destination efficiently and safely.

**Work:**
- Ensure that the mapping interface provides clear, step-by-step directions that are easy to follow.
- Include an option for the user to select different routes, if available, with estimated travel times for each.
- Provide information about any potential obstacles on the road, such as construction, tolls, or heavy traffic areas, transparently.
- Implement real-time updates to driving directions in the event of changing conditions, such as road closures or traffic incidents.
- Offer an explainable rationale for suggested routes, empowering the user to make informed choices about their journey.

text: The user shall be able to download appointments and contact information for clients
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure User Access to Personal Data for Transparency and Autonomy

**Description**: As a client, I want to be able to download my appointment and contact information so that I can have autonomy over my personal data and ensure transparency in my interactions with the service provider.

- Provide a clear and user-friendly interface for downloading appointments and contact information.
- Ensure data is available in a common, easy-to-read format (e.g., CSV or PDF).
- Implement security measures to protect data during the download process.
- Offer clear instructions and support resources for clients on how to download their data.
- Ensure compliance with relevant data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR).

text: The system shall display clear property images in the search results
ethical_us:
Title: Ensure Transparent Property Imagery

- The system shall ensure images accurately represent the current state of the property.

- The system shall provide contact information for inquiries about discrepancies in property appearances.

text: The system shall update or create new property listings in the MLS
ethical_us:
**Title: Ensure Transparency in Property Listing Management**

**Description:** As a real estate agent, I want to update or create new property listings in the MLS with clear and accessible information so that potential buyers and other stakeholders can make informed decisions.

**Work:**
- Ensure that all property listings include comprehensive details that are easy to understand, such as property features, pricing, and location.

- Ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations for the information presented in the listings.

text: Realtor shall be able to generate a CMA report based on property criteria
ethical_us:
Title: Generating Transparent CMA Reports for Realtors

Description: As a realtor, I want to generate a Comparative Market Analysis (CMA) report based on property criteria so that I can provide clear and understandable property value insights to my clients, promoting transparency in the real estate process.

- Implement a mechanism for clients to access and understand the CMA report in a user-friendly format.
- Verify that all data used does not infringe on privacy and is ethically sourced.

text: The system shall be able to call the seller or buyer to schedule an appointment
ethical_us:
Title: "Transparent Communication for Scheduling Appointments"

Description: As a buyer or seller, I want the system to transparently call the other party on my behalf to schedule an appointment, so that I can ensure clear and efficient communication regarding my transactions without misunderstandings or miscommunications.

Work:

- The system must notify both the caller and recipient regarding the initiation and completion of the call.
- Provide a detailed explanation on how the scheduling feature works, including any automated processes involved.
- Log and provide access to call records, ensuring users can review what was communicated during scheduling.
- Ensure all communications are secure and private, maintaining users' information confidentiality.

text: The realtor shall be notified of new client appointments after automatic synchronization with office system
ethical_us:
**Title:** Transparent Notification for Realtor Appointments

**Description:** As a realtor, I want to be transparently notified of new client appointments after automatic synchronization with the office system so that I can manage my schedule effectively and build trust with my clients by being well-prepared.

**Work:**
- Ensure that synchronization with the office system occurs automatically and promptly when new appointments are made.
- Implement clear notification mechanisms to inform realtors of new appointments, including all relevant details (e.g., client name, time, location).

- Include a user-friendly interface that allows realtors to confirm receipt of notifications and access further details regarding the appointment.
- Ensure transparency in the notification process by making the synchronization process visible to the realtor, with options for feedback or reporting synchronization issues.

text: The realtor shall be able to retrieve a map showing property locations for a specified area
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Transparency

Title: Displaying Transparent Property Location Information

Description: As a realtor, I want to retrieve a map showing property locations for a specified area so that I can transparently provide accurate location information to potential buyers.

text: The system shall notify the realtor when a seller or buyer responds to an appointment request
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent Communication of Appointment Responses

text: The product shall allow the user to save the property search results.
ethical_us:
**Title: User-Controlled Data Storage for Property Searches**

**Description:** As a prospective homebuyer, I want to be able to save my property search results so that I can easily access and review them later without having to redo the search, thereby ensuring convenience and autonomy in managing my search process.

**Work:**
- Ensure users can create an account to save their search results securely.
- Allow users to view saved search results at any time from their dashboard.
- Provide options for users to delete saved searches when they are no longer needed.
- Implement a feature for users to export saved searches for offline use.
- Guarantee that the saved data is private and only accessible by the user. 

The ethical principle related to this user story is "Freedom and autonomy." It ensures that the user has control over their data and the ability to manage it according to their preferences, enhancing their decision-making freedom in the property search process.

text: The system shall be easy to use by the Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Transparency 

Title: User-Friendly System Interface for Nursing Staff

Work: 
- Conduct usability testing sessions with Nursing Staff Members to identify areas of confusion or difficulty.
- Design an intuitive and clear user interface that minimizes steps to complete common tasks.
- Provide comprehensive and easy-to-understand documentation or user guides.
- Implement a feedback mechanism for Nursing Staff Members to report usability issues and suggestions for improvement.
- Ensure that system updates include transparency about changes in functionality or interface layout.

text: All of the users shall be able to use the system after one day of training.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensure Usability for All Users

Description: As a user, I want to be able to use the system proficiently after just one day of training so that I can perform my tasks efficiently without significant delays.

Work: 
- Acceptance criteria:
  - Provide comprehensive and easy-to-understand training materials.
  - Ensure the system interface is intuitive and user-friendly.
  - Offer hands-on tutorials and practical examples during the training session.
  - Conduct a user feedback session post-training to identify any usability issues.
  - Implement improvements based on user feedback to enhance system accessibility.
  - Verify user proficiency through a short assessment or task performance evaluation. 

Ethical Principle: Freedom and Autonomy

Explanation: This user story aligns with the ethical principle of Freedom and Autonomy as it ensures that all users have the ability to freely and independently use the system without extensive or burdensome training requirements. By making the system easily accessible after a short training period, users can maintain their autonomy in utilizing the technology.

text: The system shall help the user avoid making mistakes while scheduling classes and clinicals for the nursing students.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Non-maleficence

Title: Error Prevention in Schedule Management for Nursing Students

Description: As a nursing program coordinator, I want to help users avoid making mistakes while scheduling classes and clinicals for the nursing students so that the students' educational experience is safe, efficient, and effective.

Work:
- The system shall validate scheduling inputs to prevent overlapping time slots for classes and clinicals.
- The system shall provide real-time feedback and alerts if scheduling conflicts arise or if the proposed schedule violates program requirements.
- The system shall offer suggestions or alternative scheduling options when conflicts are detected.
- The system shall allow users to view a summary of the schedule to review for potential errors before finalizing.
- The system shall log any changes made to schedules for auditing purposes to ensure that any issues can be traced and resolved.

text: The number of mistakes noted by the students shall be decreased by 50% in the first year.
ethical_us:
**Title: Reducing Student Errors in Learning Platforms**

**Description:** As an **educational technologist**, I want to **reduce the number of mistakes made by students by 50% in the first year** so that **students have a more effective learning experience and benefit from improved educational outcomes**.

**Work:**

1. Analyze the current error logs to identify the most common types of mistakes students make.
   
2. Implement user-friendly feedback mechanisms and error correction tips in the platform to guide students effectively.

3. Ensure that learning modules and problem sets clearly communicate objectives and provide adequate examples.

4. Conduct user testing sessions to gain insights into student challenges and iterate on solutions to address these challenges.

5. Deploy an updated version of the platform with improved instructions and feedback systems.

6. Monitor the number of errors continuously and make data-driven decisions to further enhance the learning experience.

7. Provide support and training for educators to help them assist students in utilizing the platform effectively.

text: 2 out of 3 Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall successfully be able to use the system to manage the scheduling of classes and clinicals.
ethical_us:
Title: Enable Efficient and Fair Scheduling Management

Description: As a Program Administrator, I want to ensure that the system allows me and my colleagues to manage the scheduling of classes and clinicals efficiently, so that we can maintain fairness and optimize educational resources for nursing staff and students.

Work:
- Verify that the system provides clear guidance and intuitive navigation for scheduling tasks.
- Ensure that the scheduling system accommodates diverse needs and preferences to prevent biases and promote fairness.
- Test the system's capability to provide adequate support and documentation for users unfamiliar with the interface.
- Confirm that any issues or errors encountered by at least 2 out of 3 users can be effectively resolved with available support channels.
- Validate that the system tracks and logs scheduling decisions to ensure accountability and transparency in resource allocation.

text: The system shall use symbols and words that are naturally understandable by the user community.
ethical_us:

Work: 
- Conduct research to identify commonly used symbols and words within the user community.
- Design the user interface using these identified symbols and words.
- Test the interface with a representative sample of users to ensure clarity and understanding.
- Collect and incorporate user feedback to improve the system's transparency and comprehensibility.
- Ensure that all communications from the system are reviewed and updated regularly to reflect any changes in community understanding.

text: The verbiage used within the system shall be consistent with Standard English and the terminology of the national Nursing Community.
ethical_us:

**Work:**

text: Staff members shall be able to complete a set of tasks in a timely manner.

- Design the interface to be intuitive and user-friendly to minimize the learning curve.

- Provide access to necessary resources and dependencies required to complete tasks on time.

Ethical Principle: Beneficence

text: The response time of general student management tasks shall take no longer than 5 seconds and the response time of schedule generation shall take no longer than 30 seconds.
ethical_us:
Title: Efficient Response Times for Student Management

Description: As a student using the management system, I want to experience quick response times for general tasks and schedule generation so that I can efficiently manage my academic activities without unnecessary delays.

- Conduct regular performance testing to maintain response time standards.
- Implement optimization techniques to improve system performance if needed.
- Provide users with clear feedback if response time thresholds are exceeded.

This ethical user story is most aligned with the principle of Trust, as maintaining efficient response times is crucial for assuring users that the system is reliable, effective, and trustworthy.

text: The system shall be available for use between the hours of 8am and 6pm.
ethical_us:
Title: Accessible System Availability

Work:

- Implement a notification system to alert users of any potential changes in availability.
- Provide alternative access methods for essential functions in case of unplanned outages within specified hours.

text: The system shall achieve 95% up time.
ethical_us:
**Title:** Ensuring System Reliability for User Trust

**Description:** As an end-user, I want the system to achieve 95% uptime so that I can rely on its availability and functionality whenever needed.

**Work:**

1. Implement robust server infrastructure and failover mechanisms to guarantee consistent system availability.
2. Set up a comprehensive monitoring system to detect and address potential downtimes proactively.
3. Conduct regular maintenance and updates to prevent unexpected system failures.
4. Provide transparent communication to users about any planned downtime or known issues.
5. Test the system under various conditions to ensure it meets the 95% uptime requirement.
6. Document and report uptime statistics regularly to build and maintain user trust.

text: system shall be able to handle all of the user requests/usage during business hours.
ethical_us:
Title: Reliable User Request Handling During Business Hours

Work:
- Ensure the system can handle peak loads and maintain performance standards.
- Implement load balancing to distribute user requests evenly across servers.
- Conduct regular stress testing to identify any weak points in the system under high usage.
- Monitor real-time server performance to quickly address any issues that arise.
- Provide user feedback mechanisms to report and respond to system overload or failures.
- Maintain transparent communication with users about expected downtimes or maintenance that could affect business operations.

text: The system shall cater to 10 simultaneous users from 9am to 5pm.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring System Reliabilty and Trust

Work:

- Implement monitoring tools to track user activity and system performance from 9am to 5pm.
- Set up alerts for potential issues, such as server overloads, and ensure that they are addressed promptly.
- Validate that system hardware and software can support the load, and upgrade if necessary.
- Document any incidents and remediation actions to maintain transparency and continuously improve system trustworthiness.

text: The system shall be capable of processing 100% of nursing students and their classes for the next 10 years.
ethical_us:
**Title: Ensuring Long-Term Fairness and Accessibility for Nursing Students**

**Description:** As a university administrator, I want to ensure that the system can process 100% of nursing students and their classes for the next 10 years so that all students have equal opportunities and uninterrupted access to their education resources.

**Work:**

1. Verify that the system can scale to accommodate 100% of projected nursing student enrollments over the next decade.
2. Ensure data processing capacity is regularly reviewed and updated to meet future demand without discrimination or exclusion.
3. Implement safeguards to prevent any classes or students from being unfairly excluded due to system limitations.
4. Test the system under simulated conditions to predict and address potential future capacity issues.
5. Maintain transparent communication with stakeholders on system capacity and planned upgrades.
6. Ensure compliance with any relevant regulations regarding equitable access to educational resources.

**Ethical Principle:** Justice and fairness

text: The system shall be expected to manage the nursing program curriculum and class/clinical scheduling for a minimum of 5 years.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensure Sustainable Management of Nursing Program Curriculum

- The system should offer reporting tools to track environmental and resource usage efficiencies.
- The system must archive past schedules and curriculum changes for auditing and future planning purposes.
- The system should have protocols for periodic review and updates to ensure alignment with evolving sustainability practices.

text: The system shall able to operate within a business office environment typical of the Nursing Department at DePaul University.
ethical_us:
Certainly! Based on the requirement provided, the most relevant ethical principle seems to be "Freedom and Autonomy," as it ensures that the AI system supports the functional independence of the Nursing Department staff at DePaul University. The system should not impose unnecessary restrictions on their day-to-day activities. Here's how the requirement can be translated into an ethical user story:

Title: Ensuring Autonomy in Nursing Department Operations

Description: As a Nursing Department staff member, I want the system to operate seamlessly within a business office environment specific to our needs, so that we can carry out our duties efficiently without disruption or constraints.

Work:
- Verify that the system is compatible with the existing infrastructure of the Nursing Department at DePaul University.
- Ensure that the system integrates with the departmental workflows and does not require staff to alter their usual processes.
- Conduct usability testing with Nursing Department staff to ensure the system supports their autonomy and daily operations.
- Provide training materials to healthcare staff that emphasize the system's supportive role in maintaining operational independence.
- Obtain feedback from staff on the system's performance and make necessary adjustments to enhance user autonomy and satisfaction.

text: The system shall be used within the specifications defined by the computers used by the Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Responsibility

Title: Ensuring System Compatibility for Medical Program Use

Work: 
- Validate that all hardware and software specifications align with system requirements.
- Ensure that system updates and patches are compatible with existing computer setups.
- Test the system in various computer environments used by Program Administrators and Nursing Staff to confirm functionality.
- Provide documentation and training for Nursing Staff to understand the technical requirements of the system.
- Implement a feedback mechanism for Nursing Staff to report any system compatibility issues.

text: The system shall operate within the Windows XP Professional operating system.
ethical_us:
Given the requirement "The system shall operate within the Windows XP Professional operating system," the related ethical principle could be "Sustainability." This principle is relevant because using an outdated operating system may raise concerns about energy efficiency and the environmental impact of maintaining legacy systems. Additionally, supporting an outdated OS can have implications for security and operational sustainability.

Title: Ensure Sustainable System Compatibility

Description: As a system administrator, I want the system to operate efficiently on Windows XP Professional so that we can maintain sustainable operations while transitioning to more modern and efficient systems over time.

Work:
- Validate that the system's energy consumption on Windows XP is monitored and minimized.
- Ensure regular security updates and best practices are applied to manage risks associated with using an older OS.
- Confirm compatibility with essential applications and tools required for ongoing operations.
- Develop a plan for transitioning to a more sustainable and modern operating system in the future.
- Review and document the system's performance and resource usage to identify any potential sustainability improvements.

text: The system shall interface with CampusConnect\92s central server

- Design an interface that informs users of data transmission processes and safeguards.

text: The system shall interface with the faculty central server.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Transparency

Title: Transparent Faculty Server Interface Integration

Description: As a faculty member, I want the system to interface with the faculty central server so that I can understand how data is being accessed and transferred, ensuring transparency in data management processes.

Work:

text: The system shall interface with the student master server.
ethical_us:
Principle: Privacy

Title: Secure and Private Interface with Student Master Server

Description: As a student data privacy officer, I want to ensure that the system interfaces with the student master server securely so that student data privacy is preserved and unauthorized access is prevented.

Work:
- Verify that the connection to the student master server is encrypted.
- Ensure that only authorized personnel can access data from the server.

- Conduct a security audit to identify potential vulnerabilities.
- Validate that the system complies with privacy regulations and standards.

text: We must be able to interface with any HTML browser.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Cross-Browser Compatibility for All Users

Description: As a website user, I want to be able to interface with any HTML browser so that I can access and utilize web content without restrictions or technical barriers.

Work: 
- Verify the HTML and CSS code to ensure it adheres to web standards for compatibility across different browsers.
- Test the website on multiple HTML browsers including Chrome, Firefox, Edge, Safari, and Opera.
- Ensure that all interactive elements are functional and display correctly on various browsers.
- Implement responsive design practices to support different screen sizes and resolutions.

Related Ethical Principle: This user story relates to the principle of Freedom and autonomy, as it ensures users are free to choose any web browser they prefer without being restricted in accessing web content.

text: Only authorized users shall have access to clinical site information.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Secure Access to Clinical Site Information

Description: As a data privacy officer, I want to ensure that only authorized users have access to clinical site information so that patient and research data privacy is protected and unauthorized disclosures are prevented.

Work: 
- Verify that user authentication and authorization processes are in compliance with privacy regulations.
- Implement role-based access controls to restrict data access based on user roles.
- Conduct regular audits to ensure compliance with access policies and regulations.
- Set up alerts and logs for unauthorized access attempts to monitor potential security breaches.
- Provide training to staff on data privacy and security awareness.

text: Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members are the only people who shall have access to clinical site details.
ethical_us:
Title: Restrict Access to Clinical Site Details

Description: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want to be the only individuals with access to clinical site details so that the privacy and confidentiality of sensitive information are maintained, ensuring ethical handling and minimizing potential data breaches or misuse.

Work:

- Ensure that attempts by unauthorized users to access clinical site details are logged and monitored.
- Provide training for Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members on the importance of maintaining privacy and confidentiality.
- Implement encryption for clinical site details to enhance security.

text: Dr Susan Poslusny and Dr Julie Donalek are the only people who shall have access to students\92 personal information.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Privacy

Title: Controlled Access to Students' Personal Information

Description: As a university administrator, I want only designated individuals, specifically Dr. Susan Poslusny and Dr. Julie Donalek, to have access to students' personal information so that we can ensure the privacy and confidentiality of the students' data is maintained.

Work:
- Verify the authentication and authorization process to ensure only Dr. Susan Poslusny and Dr. Julie Donalek have access credentials for the student information system.
- Implement access logs to track who accesses students' personal information and maintain a record of access times, duration, and accessed data.
- Ensure data encryption is employed both in transit and at rest to protect students' personal information from unauthorized access.
- Conduct regular audits and privacy compliance checks to ensure that access controls are functioning as intended and align with privacy regulations.
- Educate staff on privacy policies and protocols to reinforce the importance of respecting students' privacy rights.

text: Only authorized users shall have access to the portion of the system that interfaces with CampusConnect.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Privacy

Title: Ensure Privacy By Restricting Access to CampusConnect

Description: As an IT security officer, I want to ensure that only authorized users have access to the system's interface with CampusConnect so that the privacy of sensitive information is maintained and unauthorized access is prevented.

Work: 
- Verify that user roles and permissions are correctly defined and assigned.
- Implement authentication mechanisms to ensure only authorized users can access the system.
- Conduct regular audits and access reviews to detect and remove unauthorized access.
- Ensure access logs are maintained for monitoring and security purposes.
- Provide training to users on the importance of privacy and secure access practices.

text: Fit Criterion: Dr Susan Poslusny and Karen Sysol are the only people who shall have access to the final class section scheduling for the system that interfaces with CampusConnect.
ethical_us:
Title: Restricted Access to Class Section Scheduling

Description: As a privacy-conscious system administrator, I want to ensure that only Dr. Susan Poslusny and Karen Sysol can access the final class section scheduling for the system interfacing with CampusConnect so that the privacy of the scheduling information is maintained and unauthorized access is prevented.

Work:

1. Implement authentication mechanisms to verify the identities of Dr. Susan Poslusny and Karen Sysol before granting access.
2. Develop an access control list that specifies Dr. Susan Poslusny and Karen Sysol as the only users who can view and edit the final class section scheduling.
3. Ensure the system logs all access attempts to the final class section scheduling for security auditing and monitoring purposes.
4. Conduct regular security reviews to verify that no unauthorized personnel have gained access to the scheduling system.
5. Provide a mechanism to update access permissions should Dr. Susan Poslusny or Karen Sysol's access rights change in the future.

text: The system shall use the organization\92s standard virus protection software to help monitor threats to itself.
ethical_us:
Title: Implement Organization's Standard Virus Protection

Description: As a system administrator, I want to ensure the system uses the organization's standard virus protection software so that threats to the system are effectively monitored and mitigated.

Work:
- The system integrates seamlessly with the organization's existing virus protection software.
- Regular updates and patches are applied to the virus protection software to keep it current.
- Continuous monitoring tools are activated to detect and report any potential threats in real-time.
- Documentation and training materials are provided to relevant personnel on threat monitoring practices.
- Regular audits are conducted to assess the effectiveness of the virus protection measures in place.

text: A cohort shall be associated to one Program of Study offered by the department.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Fair Cohort Program Assignment

Description: As a Department Administrator, I want to associate each cohort with an appropriate Program of Study offered by the department, so that students receive a fair and consistent education experience aligned with their academic needs and rights.

Work:
- Verify that each cohort within the system is linked to one and only one Program of Study.
- Ensure that the assignment process adheres to departmental guidelines and standards.
- Confirm that students within a cohort have access to the program details and requirements transparently.
- Validate that program assignments are free from any form of discrimination or bias.
- Conduct a review process to ensure all cohort assignments are aligned with educational policies and students' rights to equitable education.

text: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a listing of students to a cohort.
ethical_us:
Title: Facilitate Cohort Enrollment for Program Administrators and Nursing Staff

Description: As a Program Administrator and Nursing Staff Member, I want to be able to add a listing of students to a cohort so that I can ensure accurate and organized enrollment of students, while maintaining transparency and ease of communication within the academic program.

Work:
- Verify that authorized users (Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members) have access to the student enrollment system.
- Ensure that the interface for adding a student listing is user-friendly and provides clear instructions.
- Implement confirmation messages to inform the user that the listing has been successfully added to the cohort.
- Provide an audit log feature allowing users to review changes made to cohort listings for accountability and transparency.
- Ensure that changes to cohort listings are communicated transparently across relevant departments and staff members.

text: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a single student to a cohort
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent Student Enrollment Process

Description: As a Program Administrator and Nursing Staff Member, I want to be able to add a single student to a cohort so that the process is clear, traceable, and fair for all students.

Work:
1. Display detailed guidelines for adding students to cohorts, ensuring visibility on criteria and decisions.
2. Provide an intuitive interface for administrators and nursing staff to enter required student information easily and accurately.
3. Log all cohort enrollment actions in the system, including timestamps and the responsible personnel, to maintain a transparent record.
4. Allow for periodic reviews of student additions to cohorts to identify and address any discrepancies.
5. Ensure that stakeholders have access to reports summarizing enrollment activities, enhancing overall transparency.

text: Students added to a cohort shall be eligible for the cohort\92s Program of Study.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Justice and fairness

Title: Ensure Fair Eligibility for Students in Cohort Programs

Description: As an educational administrator, I want to ensure that all students added to a cohort are eligible for the cohort's Program of Study so that each student receives equal opportunity and access to the resources and curriculum they are entitled to.

Work: 
- Verify that all students being added to the cohort meet the necessary prerequisites for the Program of Study.
- Implement checks to ensure that no student is unfairly excluded or included based on bias or discrimination.
- Ensure that any eligibility criteria for the Program of Study are clearly communicated and accessible to all students.
- Regularly review and update the eligibility criteria to maintain fairness and relevancy.

text: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to specify the preferred sequence of classes for a given cohort.
ethical_us:
**Title:** Class Sequence Specification for Cohort Management

**Description:** As a Program Administrator and Nursing Staff Member, I want to specify the preferred sequence of classes for a given cohort, so that the educational curriculum can be tailored to meet the needs and expectations of students while ensuring educational goals align with institutional standards.

**Work:**
- Ensure the system allows flexible input of class sequences by authorized Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members.
- Provide a user-friendly interface for specifying and visualizing the sequence of classes.
- Implement controls to prevent unauthorized access or modifications to the class sequence settings.
- Allow for adjustments and updates to the sequence based on feedback and evolving educational standards.
- Include a review process to ensure the specified sequence aligns with the curriculum guidelines and benefits student learning outcomes.

text: For each class within a sequence for a cohort  Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to specify which quarter that class will be offered.
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent Scheduling for Nursing Programs

Description: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want to specify which quarter a class will be offered so that there is clear and transparent communication of course availability for students and faculty.

Work:
- Ensure the system allows the selection of a specific quarter for each class within a sequence.
- Verify that the scheduling information is easily accessible and understandable to all relevant parties.
- Implement a notification system to alert relevant parties about scheduling changes or updates.
- Ensure that the scheduling options are visible to students during course registration periods.
- Provide a detailed guide or help section on how to use the scheduling feature effectively.

text: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add new classes to a sequence of classes
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Responsibility

Title: Enable Class Addition by Program Administrators and Nursing Staff

Description: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want to add new classes to a sequence of classes so that I can ensure the curriculum meets current educational and professional standards.

Work:
- Verify that Program Administrators and Nursing Staff have appropriate permissions to add new classes within the system.
- Ensure the system provides a user-friendly interface for adding classes, including fields for class name, description, schedule, and instructor details.
- Implement audit logging to track changes made to class sequences, ensuring accountability and traceability.
- Provide notifications to relevant stakeholders when a new class is added to a sequence.
- Test the functionality to ensure that additions do not disrupt existing class schedules or data integrity.
- Document the process and guidelines for adding classes to ensure consistent use and clarity for all stakeholders.

text: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add clinical classes or sections to a sequence of classes
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent Management of Clinical Class Sequences

Description: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want to add clinical classes or sections to a sequence of classes so that there is clarity and transparency in the schedule and curriculum for students and staff.

Work: 
- Ensure the addition of clinical classes is clearly logged and documented, including the sequence and timing.
- Provide visibility for all stakeholders into changes made to class sequences.
- Implement a confirmation process that verifies changes with affected users to ensure they are informed.
- Include a summary report of any changes made and accessible via the system dashboard.

text: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a new cohort to the system  identified by start month and year.
ethical_us:
Title: Cohort Addition for Accurate Data Management

Description: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want to add a new cohort to the system, identified by start month and year, so that we can maintain accurate and up-to-date records for educational and healthcare planning.

Work: 
- Ensure the system interface allows for easy input of a new cohort's start month and year.
- Validate inputs to prevent errors in cohort identification and data entry.
- Provide confirmation and feedback to users upon successful cohort addition.
- Implement logging mechanisms to track cohort additions for accountability and transparency.
- Ensure compliance with data management standards and policies to protect information integrity.

The ethical principle most relevant to this requirement is Transparency. By incorporating input validation, confirmation, and logging, the system ensures explainability, understandability, and accountability for its users, maintaining clarity and transparency in managing cohorts.

text: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add new classes for the nursing department into the system.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Responsibility

Title: Ensuring Accurate Course Management and Responsibility for Nursing Programs

Description: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want to add new classes for the nursing department into the system so that we ensure accurate course management, maintain program integrity, and efficiently allocate resources to meet educational standards.

Work:
- Verify that the user role is a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member before allowing access to add classes.
- Provide a user-friendly interface that guides users through the process of adding new classes, ensuring they input all necessary information (e.g., course title, description, schedule, instructor).
- Implement error-checking mechanisms to validate inputs and prevent incorrect data entry.
- Ensure confirmation and audit trail features are in place for tracking who added a class and when it was added.
- Conduct user testing to confirm that the new class addition process is intuitive and meets the needs of nursing department staff.
- Provide training and documentation to help staff understand how to use the new class addition feature responsibly.
- Ensure compliance with educational standards and regulatory requirements regarding course offering and data management.

text: A class shall be either a non-clinical class or a clinical class.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensure Clear Classification of Classes for Transparency

Description: As a medical data analyst, I want to accurately categorize data classes as either non-clinical or clinical so that I can ensure transparency in data handling and analysis.

Work: 
- Evaluate the criteria for determining whether a class is clinical or non-clinical.
- Document the classification process and make it accessible for review.
- Implement a mechanism in the system to label classes as clinical or non-clinical consistently.
- Validate the classification with stakeholder input to ensure accuracy and transparency.
- Provide a user guide explaining the classification system to all relevant team members.

text: A non-clinical class shall specify the course name  lecture room requirements  and instructor needs.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Transparency

Title: Transparent Communication of Non-Clinical Class Requirements

Description: As a course coordinator, I want to specify the course name, lecture room requirements, and instructor needs so that all stakeholders have a clear understanding of the resources and details involved in the course planning process.

Work: 
- Acceptance Criteria:
  1. The system shall allow the course coordinator to input and display the course name clearly.
  2. The system shall provide a section to outline the specific lecture room requirements, including size, equipment, and accessibility features.
  3. The system shall enable the course coordinator to specify instructor needs, such as teaching aids, administrative support, or any special requests.
  4. The system shall ensure that all entered details are easily accessible and understandable by relevant stakeholders, including instructors, administrators, and facility managers.
  5. The system shall include a notification feature to inform relevant parties when any changes to the course details are made.

text: A clinical class shall specify the course name  lecture room requirements  clinical site needs  lecture instructor needs  and clinical lab instructor needs.
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent Specification of Clinical Class Requirements

Description: As a curriculum planner, I want to clearly specify the course name, lecture room requirements, clinical site needs, lecture instructor needs, and clinical lab instructor needs so that all stakeholders have a clear understanding of logistical and resource requirements for each clinical class.

Work:
- Ensure that the course name is accurately listed and accessible to relevant stakeholders.
- Detail lecture room requirements, including size, technology needs, and seating arrangements.
- Clearly specify clinical site needs, including location, equipment, and staffing requirements.
- Document lecture instructor needs, such as availability, qualifications, and any special requirements.
- Outline clinical lab instructor needs, like skill sets, lab materials, and session timings.
- Provide a platform or document that is easily accessible and understandable by all parties involved to enhance transparency.
- Review and update the specifications regularly to reflect any changes or updates.

text: Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall be able to create a new Program of Study.
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent Program Creation for Nursing Education

Description: As a Program Administrator/Nursing Staff Member, I want to create a new Program of Study transparently, so that all stakeholders are informed and understand the program's objectives, structure, and requirements.

Work:
- Verify that the interface for creating a program clearly outlines each step of the setup process.
- Ensure that all information inputs are detailed, with explanations for fields and their purposes.
- Provide a summary view upon program creation that includes an outline of all entered details.
- Enable an option to communicate the new program details to stakeholders such as instructors, students, and administrative staff.
- Include audit logs and version history for any changes made to the program to ensure accountability and traceability.
- Validate that all program creation actions are compliant with institutional guidelines and regulations.

text: A Program of Study shall consist of a program name and listing of required classes (both clinical and non-clinical) that must be completed.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Transparency

Title: Transparent Program of Study Details

Description: As a prospective student, I want to have access to a clear and detailed listing of required classes, both clinical and non-clinical, for a Program of Study so that I can make informed decisions about my educational path and ensure it aligns with my career goals.

Work: 
- Ensure the program name is prominently displayed and easily accessible.
- Provide a detailed list of required classes, distinguishing between clinical and non-clinical courses.
- Include explanations or descriptions of the content and objectives of each required class for better understandability.
- Offer contact information or resources for further inquiries about the Program of Study.

text: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall have the ability to specify which classes are required for a Program of Study
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent Curriculum Management

Description: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want to specify which classes are required for a Program of Study so that the curriculum is clear and transparent to all students and faculty members.

Work: 
1. Ensure that the system allows Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members to securely log in and access curriculum management features.
2. Provide an intuitive user interface for adding, editing, and removing required classes for a specific Program of Study.
3. Implement a clear and understandable overview of required classes for Programs of Study that can be easily accessed by students and faculty.
