4. Ensure that any changes to the required classes are communicated promptly to all relevant stakeholders, including students and faculty members.
5. Verify that updates to the curriculum are documented and logged for auditing and accountability purposes.

text: The system shall be able to display a report of needed classes for a given quarter for all cohorts of all programs for Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members\92 planning purposes.
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent Display of Class Requirements for Program Planning

Description: As a Nursing Staff Member/Program Administrator, I want to access a comprehensive report of needed classes for a given quarter for all cohorts of all programs so that I can efficiently plan and allocate resources while ensuring transparency in the scheduling process.

Work:
- The system must generate a detailed report displaying required classes for each cohort per quarter.
- The report should be accessible to authorized Nursing Staff Members and Program Administrators.
- The system must provide an option to filter the report by specific programs or quarters for easier navigation.
- All data in the report should be up-to-date and reflect the current scheduling needs.
- Ensure that the report is presented in a clear, understandable format that facilitates decision-making.

text: The report of needed classes shall include (but not be limited to) classes to be offered  number of sections needed  number of labs needed  and room types needed.
ethical_us:
The ethical principle most related to the requirement is **Transparency**, as the requirement involves providing a report that details the various elements needed for class scheduling, ensuring that relevant information is clearly communicated.

Title: Transparent Class Scheduling Report

Description: As an educational administrator, I want to receive a detailed report of needed classes, including but not limited to the number of class sections, labs, and room types required, so that I can make informed decisions regarding resource allocation and scheduling.

Work:
- Acceptance Criteria:
  - The report must clearly list all classes to be offered.
  - The report must include the number of sections needed for each class.
  - The report must outline the number of labs required for classes that need them.
  - The report must specify the types of rooms needed for each class.
  - All information in the report must be accurate and up-to-date.
  - The report should be formatted in a user-friendly manner that is easy to understand.
  - The report must be generated and shared with stakeholders in a timely manner.

text: Classes for a given cohort shall not conflict with regards to the time and day that they are offered.
ethical_us:
**Title:** Schedule Conflict-Free Classes for Cohorts

**Description:** As a student, I want my classes to be scheduled at non-conflicting times so that I can attend all required courses without missing any.

**Work:**
- Verify that the scheduling system automatically checks for conflicts when assigning class times.
- Ensure that no two classes required for a given cohort are scheduled at overlapping times.
- Provide students with an accessible schedule that clearly shows non-conflicting class times.
- Test the system with multiple cohort scenarios to confirm conflict-free scheduling.
- Implement a notification system to alert students and administrators of potential schedule conflicts before finalizing the timetable.

text: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a new clinical site into the system.
ethical_us:
Title: Enabling Addition of Clinical Sites for Smooth Operation

Description: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want to be able to add a new clinical site into the system so that we can ensure updated and comprehensive healthcare service delivery without any interruption.

Work:
- Verify that the user has the appropriate permissions to add new clinical sites.
- Implement a user interface allowing easy input of details for the new clinical site, including location, site contact, and services offered.
- Ensure the system provides clear instructions and help resources for adding a new clinical site.
- Validate that the data entered conforms to the required format and completeness checks before submission.
- Test that the new clinical site appears in relevant system areas post-addition, such as service locations and scheduling.
- Ensure any sensitive information entered during the process is securely stored and complies with privacy policies. 

Ethical Principle: This user story aligns with the principle of Trust. Enabling Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members to add new clinical sites effectively reinforces trust in the operational integrity of the healthcare system, as well as ensuring accurate and secure access to the latest site information for patient care.

text: Clinical site information shall include (but not be limited to) the name of the site  contact person  and contact information.
ethical_us:
**Title:** Transparent Access to Clinical Site Information

**Description:** As a healthcare professional, I want to access detailed clinical site information, such as the name, contact person, and contact information, so that I can ensure effective communication and collaboration with the site.

**Work:**

- The system must display the name of the clinical site.
- The system must provide the full name and role of the contact person at the site.
- The system must include accurate contact information such as phone number and email address for the contact person.
- The information should be verified and updated regularly to ensure it is current and accurate.
- Ensure the interface presenting the information is clear and easy to navigate.
- Facilitate clear instructions on how to access and use the site information responsibly.

text: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a new clinical lab section for an existing clinical class into the System.
ethical_us:
Title: Allow Secure Addition of Clinical Lab Sections

Description: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want to securely add a new clinical lab section for an existing clinical class into the System so that I can ensure proper organization and scheduling of laboratory activities without compromising patient information privacy.

Work:
- Implementation of a secure login process with role-based access control for Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members accessing the system.
- Ensure data entry follows standardized formats to prevent human error and maintain data integrity.
- Implement encryption protocols to protect any personal or sensitive data being entered or stored during the process.
- Provide an audit trail feature that logs changes for accountability and transparency of actions performed within the system.
- Ensure compliance with institutional and governmental privacy regulations, like HIPAA, regarding patient and clinical information handling.
- Conduct user training on system security and data privacy best practices.

Related Ethical Principle: Privacy

Explanation: The ethical principle of Privacy is most related to this requirement, as it involves entering potentially sensitive clinical data into the system. The user story emphasizes secure handling of information, maintaining data integrity, and ensuring compliance with privacy regulations, making Privacy the primary concern.

text: A clinical lab section shall include the clinical site name  the class  instructor  day and time of the lab.
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent Representation of Clinical Lab Details

Description: As a clinical lab participant, I want a transparent overview of the clinical site name, class, instructor, day, and time of the lab so that I can make informed decisions about scheduling and participation.

Work: 
- Verify that the clinical site name is accurately displayed in the lab section.
- Ensure the class title and description are clearly presented alongside the site information.
- Confirm that the instructor's name and contact information is visible and correct.
- Display the day and time of the lab in an easy-to-understand format.
- Regularly update and validate the information to maintain accuracy and transparency.

text: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a student who has registered for a clinical class to a clinical lab section for that class.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Justice and Fairness

Title: Enable Equitable Enrollment for Clinical Lab Sections

Description: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want to add a student who has registered for a clinical class to a clinical lab section for that class so that all students have fair access and opportunities to complete their practical education requirements.

Work:
- Verify student registration status for the clinical class before adding them to a lab section.
- Ensure the process of assigning students to lab sections is unbiased and equitable.
- Confirm that each lab section does not exceed its maximum capacity to safeguard quality of education.
- Provide an option to notify students once they are successfully assigned to a lab section.
- Document and provide access to the criteria used for lab section assignments to maintain transparency.

text: The system shall allow a Program Administrator or Nursing staff member to remove a student from a clinical lab section.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Fair Removal Process from Clinical Lab Sections

Description: As a Program Administrator or Nursing staff member, I want to remove a student from a clinical lab section, so that the decision is fair, justified, and does not lead to any unjust discrimination or harm to the student's educational experience.

Work:
- Verify that reasons for removal are documented and reviewed for fairness.
- Ensure that removal procedures comply with institutional policies and non-discrimination laws.
- Provide a notification system that informs the student of the removal decision and the rationale behind it.
- Allow the student to have an opportunity to appeal the decision if they believe it is unjust.
- Maintain a log of removal actions and their justifications for transparency and accountability.

text: The system shall allow a Program Administrator/Nursing Staff Member to move a student from one clinical lab section to another clinical lab section corresponding to the same clinical class.
ethical_us:
Title: Efficient and Fair Student Reallocation in Clinical Lab Sections

Description: As a Program Administrator/Nursing Staff Member, I want to move a student from one clinical lab section to another corresponding to the same clinical class, so that student assignments are fair and responsive to individual needs while maintaining a balanced learning environment.

Work:
- Ensure that the system interface for moving students is clear and intuitive for efficient use by administrators.
- Verify that reallocation options only appear for sections within the same clinical class to avoid unintentional placement into incorrect classes.
- Implement permission settings to ensure that only authorized personnel can move students between sections.
- Maintain a transparent audit log of any changes made to student allocations to ensure accountability for such actions. 
- Ensure that student information, including reasons for relocation if personal, is handled with confidentiality and in accordance with data privacy policies.

text: Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall be able to cancel a clinical lab section only if there are no students registered for that clinical lab section.
ethical_us:
**Title:** Ensure Fair and Responsible Cancellation of Clinical Lab Sections

**Description:** As a Program Administrator/Nursing Staff Member, I want to cancel a clinical lab section only if there are no students registered for that section, so that we ensure fairness and avoid disrupting students' schedules or educational plans.

**Work:**

1. Verify that the cancellation feature is accessible only to authorized Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members.
2. Implement a system check to confirm no students are registered in a clinical lab section before allowing cancellation.
3. Provide clear communication to Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members regarding the necessity to check student registrations before cancelling a section.
4. Develop an alert or notification system to inform administrators if an attempt to cancel a section with registered students is made.
5. Test the system to ensure it accurately prevents the cancellation of sections with registered students.
6. Document the feature and provide training materials for Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members on the appropriate use of the cancellation function.

text: A Program Administrator/Nursing Staff Member shall be able to add a new nursing student to the system.
ethical_us:
Title: Add New Nursing Student Transparently

Description: As a Program Administrator/Nursing Staff Member, I want to add a new nursing student to the system so that the process is conducted transparently and ensures all necessary information is accurately recorded and shared appropriately.

Work: 
- Verify that all required fields for student information are present and clearly labeled.
- Ensure the system provides clear guidelines on what information is needed and why it is being collected.
- Implement confirmation messages after data entry to verify the accuracy of the information entered.
- Allow for review and editing of the entered information before final submission.
- Ensure the system records and provides a transparent log of who has entered and accessed the student information.

text: A staff member shall have the ability to manage the progress of a part time student  which includes modifying their sequence of classes and timeline of classes.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Responsibility

Title: Enable Responsible Management of Part-Time Student Progress

Description: As a staff member, I want to manage the progress of part-time students, including modifying their sequence of classes and timeline of classes, so that I can support their educational journey responsibly and ensure they meet their academic goals.

Work: 
- Verify staff member's authorization to access and modify student information.
- Ensure transparency of changes made to the student's course sequence and timeline in the system.
- Provide documentation or guidance to staff members on how to responsibly manage student progress while considering the institution's academic guidelines and policies.
- Implement a change log to track any modifications made to a student's class sequence or timeline.
- Ensure that modifications align with institutional policies and support the student's educational and career goals.
- Provide a mechanism for feedback from students to validate the impact of changes on their learning objectives.

text: The system shall be able to display a printable summary for individual cohorts  which will include the students enlisted  the Program of study  sequence of classes  cohort progress through the program  and timeline of completion.
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent Cohort Summary Generation

Description: As an academic advisor, I want to generate a printable summary for individual cohorts, including the students enlisted, program of study, sequence of classes, cohort progress, and timeline of completion, so that I can readily communicate clear and transparent information to students and stakeholders.

Work:
- Acceptance Criteria:
  1. The system must generate a printable summary that includes all students enlisted in the cohort.
  2. The summary must detail the program of study associated with the cohort.
  3. The summary should list the sequence of classes the cohort has completed and is yet to complete.
  4. The summary must represent the cohort's current progress through the program.
  5. The timeline of completion for the cohort must be clearly displayed.
  6. The system must ensure that all information is accurate and up-to-date to maintain transparency.
  7. Ensure that the generated summaries are easily accessible and printable for advisors.

text: The system shall be able to display a printable summary for individual clinical sites  which will include information on labs being held at that site for the given quarter (Clinical site  general information on labs held at that location  dates and times of all labs held there).
ethical_us:
**Title:** Clinical Site Lab Summary Transparency

**Description:** As a healthcare administrator, I want to access a printable summary for individual clinical sites' lab schedules for the given quarter, so that I can ensure transparent communication and effective coordination of lab activities.

**Work:**
- The system shall provide an option to generate a printable summary report for individual clinical sites.
- The summary shall include detailed information on labs held at each site, including dates and times.
- The summary shall also include general information about the clinical site.
- The summary report shall be displayed in a user-friendly and printable format.
- The system shall support transparency by providing accurate and up-to-date information for all clinical sites and labs scheduled.

text: The system shall be able to display a printable summary for individual clinical labs  which will include (but not be limited to) class name  class number  lab section  listing of students enrolled  instructor  day(s)  time  and location.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensure Transparent Access to Lab Information

Description: As an academic administrator, I want to display a printable summary for individual clinical labs, including details such as class name, class number, lab section, list of students enrolled, instructor, days, time, and location, so that there is transparency in lab schedules and assignments for easier coordination and management.

Work:
- Develop a user interface for generating and displaying a printable summary of clinical labs.
- Ensure the summary includes all specified details: class name, class number, lab section, student list, instructor, day(s), time, and location.
- Implement a secure access system to ensure that only authorized personnel can generate and view the lab summaries.
- Provide clear instructions for printing the summaries, enabling ease of use.
- Test the feature to ensure all information is displayed accurately and the system functions as intended.

text: The system shall be able to display a printable summary for individual nursing students  which will include (but not be limited to) student name  student ID  admission date  classes  credits  GPA  and the cohort that the student is enrolled in.
ethical_us:
Title: Printable Summary for Nursing Students - Ensuring Transparency

Description: As a nursing student, I want to access a printable summary of my academic information, including my name, student ID, admission date, classes, credits, GPA, and cohort, so that I can transparently review and ensure the accuracy of my educational record.

Work: 
- Acceptance Criteria:
  1. The system must generate a printable summary containing all required fields: student name, student ID, admission date, classes, credits, GPA, and cohort.
  2. The summary must be formatted clearly and concisely, ensuring that all information is easy to understand.
  3. The information displayed should be up-to-date and accurately reflect the student's academic status.
  4. Users should have the ability to download or print the summary directly from the platform.
  5. Ensure that all data is presented in a way that maintains the student's privacy and adheres to data protection regulations.
  6. Implement a user feedback mechanism to report inaccuracies or issues in the displayed summary.

text: The system shall be able to display a printable summary of the system log.
ethical_us:
Title: Printable System Log Summary for Transparent Operations

Description: As a system administrator, I want to be able to display and print a summary of the system log so that I can transparently communicate system activities and ensure accountability.

Work: 
- The system shall provide an option to generate a printable summary of the system log.
- The printable summary shall include essential log details such as timestamps, actions, and user IDs.
- The system shall ensure that the summary is easily accessible through the user interface with clear instructions.
- The summary format shall be adequately structured and readable to facilitate sharing and review.
- Testing shall be conducted to confirm that log summaries accurately reflect the activities logged by the system.

text: The system shall contain contact information (e-mail and phone number) for all people relevant to the system  including (but not limited to) staff members  students  lecture instructors  clinical lab instructors  and clinical site administrators.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Privacy

Title: Transparency of Contact Information while Respecting Privacy

Description: As a student, I want to access contact information for relevant system people such as staff members, students, lecture instructors, clinical lab instructors, and clinical site administrators so that I can efficiently communicate with them for educational and administrative matters.

Work: 
- Ensure contact information is accessible only to authorized users within the system.
- Implement a secure login mechanism to authenticate users accessing contact information.
- Inform individuals whose contact information is included about how their data will be used and visible.
- Provide an option for individuals to opt-in or opt-out of the visibility of their contact information within the system.
- Ensure that any stored contact information complies with relevant data protection and privacy regulations.
- Implement logging and monitoring to track access to contact information for accountability.

text: The system will use the stored e-mail addresses as a primary means of communicating information to affected parties.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensure Transparent Communication via E-mail

Description: As a stakeholder, I want to ensure transparent communication through stored e-mail addresses so that all affected parties are promptly and clearly informed about important information and updates.

Work: 
- Verify that all stored e-mail addresses are valid and up to date.
- Ensure that communication content is clear, concise, and understandable for non-technical individuals.
- Provide an option for recipients to request further explanation or clarification on the received information.
- Implement a mechanism for recipients to confirm receipt of communication.
- Ensure compliance with data protection regulations when using stored e-mail addresses.
- Track the effectiveness of e-mail communication and make improvements based on feedback.

text: The system will notify affected parties for routine communication purposes  including but not limited to informing students of upcoming offered classes (timeline) and what their schedule will be/shall be.
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent Communication for Scheduling Notifications

Description: As a student, I want to receive transparent and timely notifications about upcoming classes and schedule changes so that I can stay informed and plan effectively.

Work: 
- The system must send notifications to students at least two weeks in advance for scheduled classes.
- Notifications should clearly outline the class details, including time, date, and location.
- The system should provide options for students to acknowledge receipt or request additional information.
- Ensure that notification messages are concise and understandable, avoiding technical jargon.
- Include a mechanism for students to provide feedback on the clarity and usefulness of the notifications.
- Maintain a log of sent notifications for accountability and reference purposes.

text: The system will notify affected parties when changes occur affecting clinicals  including but not limited to clinical section capacity changes  and clinical section cancellations.
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent Notifications for Clinical Changes

Description: As a patient or healthcare provider, I want to be notified promptly when there are changes affecting clinicals, including capacity changes and cancellations, so that I can adjust my plans accordingly and maintain trust in the healthcare system.

Work: 
- The system must automatically send notifications via preferred communication channels (e.g., email, SMS) when there is a change in clinical capacity or a cancellation.
- Notifications should include detailed information about the change, such as the reason, new capacity, or alternative options available.
- Ensure that the notification process is documented and accessible for review by affected parties.
- Implement a feedback mechanism allowing users to express concerns or receive clarification on the changes.
- Regularly audit the notification process to ensure reliability and comprehensiveness.

text: The system will notify affected parties when changes occur affecting classes  including but not limited to class cancellations  class section detail changes  and changes to class offerings for a given quarter.
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent Notification for Class Changes

Description: As a student, I want to be notified promptly of any changes to my classes, including cancellations, detail changes, and offerings for a given quarter, so that I can adapt my schedule and make informed decisions about my education and time management.

Work:

- The system must automatically send notifications to students via their preferred communication method (email, SMS, app notification) whenever a change occurs.
- Notifications must clearly outline the nature of the change (e.g., cancellation, time change, location change).
- Notifications should provide information on alternative options if a class is canceled or changed.
- Students should have access to a historical record of all notifications received for future reference.
- Notifications should be sent within 24 hours of the change being implemented in the system.
- A mechanism must be in place for students to confirm receipt of the notification.
- The system must have a failsafe procedure to ensure students receive notifications even in the event of a system failure or error.

text: The system will notify affected parties when changes occur affecting cohorts  including but not limited to changes to the sequence for a cohort\92s program of study and changes to a given week\92s schedule (lab cancelled this week due to instructor illness).
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent Notifications for Program Changes

Description: As a student, I want to receive notifications about any changes affecting my program's study sequence or weekly schedule so that I am informed and can adjust my plans accordingly.

Work:
- Ensure the notification system automatically sends out alerts to all affected students when any changes are made to their program's study sequence.
- Implement a feature to notify students about schedule changes, such as cancellations or instructor unavailability, as soon as they are confirmed.
- Provide a clear and understandable explanation of the changes in the notifications sent to the students.
- Verify that notifications are sent through multiple channels (e.g., email, SMS, mobile app) to ensure receipt.
- Allow students to access a history of notifications for reference and transparency.
- Conduct user testing to ensure all notifications are clear, timely, and accurately reflect program or schedule changes.

text: The system will notify affected parties when changes occur affecting specific students  including but not limited to changing a student\92s status from full time to part time and moving a student to a different clinical section.
ethical_us:
Title: Notification System for Changes in Student Status

Description: As an Academic Administrator, I want to ensure that affected parties are notified when changes occur affecting specific students, such as altering a student's status from full-time to part-time or moving a student to a different clinical section, so that all involved parties are informed in a timely manner and can take necessary actions.

Work: 
- The system will automatically generate notifications when a student's status changes from full-time to part-time.
- The system will automatically generate notifications when a student is moved to a different clinical section.
- Notifications will be sent to all relevant stakeholders, including students, faculty members, and administrative staff.
- Notifications will include detailed information about the change and its implications.
- Acknowledgement receipt feature for notifications to ensure all parties have received and understood the changes.
- Ensure data privacy and security measures are in place when sending notifications.
- Provide a log of sent notifications for auditing and tracking purposes.

text: Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall have the ability to modify information relating to cohorts including cohort identifier  program of study  preferred sequence of classes and quarters that a cohort will be taking specific classes.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Responsibility

Title: Responsible Modification of Cohort Information

Description: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want to have the ability to modify information relating to cohorts, including cohort identifiers, programs of study, and preferred sequences of classes and quarters that a cohort will be taking specific classes, so that I can ensure the data is accurate, up-to-date, and reflective of the cohort's current educational needs and pathways in a responsible manner.

Work:
- Acceptance Criteria:
  1. Administrators and Nursing Staff Members must be verified before accessing the cohort modification feature.
  2. The system should log all changes made to cohort information, including date, time, and user details, for accountability purposes.
  3. A change confirmation process must be in place requiring staff to review and confirm changes before they are saved.
  4. Notifications must be sent to relevant stakeholders when cohort information is modified.
  5. Ensure that modifications adhere to institutional guidelines and do not negatively impact students' educational experiences.
  6. Provide a detailed audit trail accessible to authorized personnel to quickly identify and address any issues following modifications.

text: Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall have the ability to modify information relating to a Program of Study within the Nursing Department including the Program of study name  and required classes for that Program of Study.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Responsibility

Title: Ensure Accurate and Up-to-Date Program Information

Description: As a Program Administrator, I want to modify information relating to a Program of Study within the Nursing Department, including the Program of Study name and required classes, so that the information remains accurate, reliable, and up-to-date for students and staff.

Work:
- Verify user access rights to ensure only authorized Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can make modifications.
- Implement an audit trail that records what changes were made, by whom, and when.
- Ensure modifications are communicated to all stakeholders, including students and faculty, in a timely manner.
- Provide a user-friendly interface for updating program details that maintains data integrity.
- Validate the changes for accuracy and adherence to department policies before finalizing updates.
- Allow for a rollback option in case of erroneous modifications to restore previous program data.

text: Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall have the ability to modify information relating to a Clinical Site  including the clinical site name  site contact person  contact information  and address.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Responsibility

Title: Ensuring Accurate and Responsible Management of Clinical Site Information

Description: As a Nursing Staff Member, I want to modify information related to a Clinical Site, including the site name, contact person, contact information, and address, so that I can ensure the data is accurate and up-to-date, fostering transparency and accountability in our records.

Work: 
- Display current clinical site information to the user
- Provide an interface for authorized users to edit clinical site details
- Validate modifications to ensure they are accurate and comply with relevant data policies
- Log changes made to clinical site records, noting who made the changes and when
- Facilitate approval process for changes that require additional oversight or validation
- Notify appropriate stakeholders of changes made for further transparency and accountability

text: Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall have the ability to modify information relating to a Clinical Lab Section  including the clinical site name the department/section for the lab  the class instructor day and time of lab and contact information.
ethical_us:
Title: Modify Clinical Lab Information with Transparency

Description: As a Program Administrator/Nursing Staff Member, I want to transparently modify information relating to a Clinical Lab Section, including the clinical site name, the department/section for the lab, the class instructor, day and time of lab, and contact information, so that all stakeholders can clearly understand and trust the changes made.

Work: 
- Ensure that the interface used to modify lab information provides a clear and easy-to-understand process for making changes.
- Include an audit trail feature that logs all changes made to the clinical lab information, detailing who made the change and when.
- Implement notifications for relevant stakeholders whenever modifications are made to lab details, ensuring transparency.
- Provide a help section or tooltips that explain the modification process for clarity and trust.
- Test the system to confirm that all changes reflect accurately and are communicated transparently to stakeholders.

text: Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall have the ability to modify information relating to a Nursing Student  including student ID  student name phone number e-mail status (full time or part time) and program of study.
ethical_us:
Based on the requirement for modifying information related to a nursing student, the ethical principle most related to this requirement is Privacy. This principle focuses on ensuring that personal data is handled appropriately and that individuals' privacy is respected and safeguarded.

Title: Secure Management of Nursing Student Information

Description: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want to securely modify information relating to a Nursing Student, including student ID, student name, phone number, email, status (full time or part time), and program of study, so that I can ensure accurate and up-to-date records without compromising the student's privacy.

Work:

- Verify that access is restricted to authorized personnel only.
- Implement role-based access controls to limit the modification abilities to respective roles.
- Ensure encrypted storage and transmission of student data to maintain confidentiality.
- Incorporate audit logs to monitor all changes made to student information.
- Provide regular privacy training to staff members handling sensitive data.
- Implement a user verification process before allowing modifications to ensure accountability.

text: The Disputes application shall comply with the corporate standards for user interface creation for internally and externally used applications.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring a Transparent and Consistent User Interface for Disputes Application

Description: As a UI/UX Designer, I want the Disputes application to comply with corporate standards for user interface creation for both internally and externally used applications so that the design and functionality are transparent and consistent across all platforms.

Work: 
- Review and understand the corporate standards for user interface design.
- Conduct stakeholder interviews to understand their needs and expectations regarding transparency and usability.
- Design the user interface in accordance with corporate standards, ensuring it is intuitive and transparent for users.
- Create a documentation that explains the design choices and functionality to ensure understandability and consistency.
- Conduct user testing sessions to gather feedback on the transparency and usability of the interface.
- Iterate on the design based on user feedback and ensure it aligns with the original corporate standards for consistency.
- Ensure that the final UI design is approved by the stakeholders.
- Prepare training materials or guides if necessary to help users understand the interface.

text: All screens created as part of the Disputes application must comply with corporate standards for interface creation.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Interface Consistency for Transparency

Description: As a Corporate Compliance Officer, I want all screens created as part of the Disputes application to comply with corporate standards for interface creation so that users can have a consistent and transparent experience when interacting with the application.

Work:
- Verify that all screen designs match the corporate style guide, including colors, fonts, and layout.
- Ensure that interface elements, such as buttons and form fields, are used consistently across all screens.
- Conduct user testing to confirm that users find the interface intuitive and easy to understand.
- Document any deviations from the corporate standards and provide justification for them.
- Obtain sign-off from the UI/UX team leader that the screens meet corporate standards for transparency and usability.

text: The list of dispute cases that are displayed after a search is performed must be color coded for easy identification of dispute cases based upon the dispute case status.
ethical_us:
Title: Visibility and Clarity in Dispute Case Status Display

Description: As a user performing searches for dispute cases, I want the list of dispute cases to be color coded for easy identification based on the dispute case status, so that I can quickly and accurately discern the status of each case without ambiguity.

Work: 
- Implement a color-coding system that distinctly represents each dispute case status.
- Ensure the color coding is intuitive and accommodates accessibility standards for color blindness.
- Provide a legend or tooltip for users to understand the meaning of each color code.
- Validate that the color coding updates dynamically as the status of dispute cases change.
- Test the design with users to ensure that it enhances clarity and understanding without causing confusion. 

Ethical Principle: Justice and Fairness

The requirement aligns with the principle of Justice and Fairness, ensuring that information about dispute cases is presented transparently and accessibly, allowing all users to fairly and promptly understand the status of each case. By implementing an intuitive color-coding system, the system can help prevent misunderstandings and promote equitable access to information.

text: 100% of the cardmember and merchant services representatives shall use the Disputes application regularly after a 2-day training course.
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent Training and Usage of Disputes Application

Description: As a cardmember and merchant services representative, I want to fully understand how to use the Disputes application effectively after a 2-day training course so that I can handle disputes transparently and efficiently, ensuring clear communication with clients and maintaining their trust.

Work: 
- Conduct a comprehensive 2-day training course that covers all functionalities of the Disputes application.
- Ensure training materials are transparent, easily understandable, and accessible to all participants.
- Provide hands-on practice sessions with real-life scenarios to build confidence in using the application.
- Facilitate a question-and-answer session to clarify any doubts or confusion.
- Offer continuous support and guidance post-training to ensure representatives use the application effectively.
- Collect feedback from participants on the training to improve future sessions.

text: 100% of cardmember services representatives shall be able to successfully create a dispute case on the first encounter after completing the training course.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensure Reliable Dispute Case Creation by Trained Representatives

Description: As a cardmember services representative, I want to successfully create a dispute case on the first encounter after completing the training course so that I can provide efficient and effective service to our customers, maintaining their trust in our services.

Work: 
- Verify that the training course covers all necessary steps and scenarios for creating a dispute case.
- Ensure representatives have access to a clear and concise reference guide for dispute case creation.
- Implement a system for immediate feedback and assistance if a representative encounters difficulties during their first case creation.
- Conduct tests and simulations to confirm that all representatives can create a dispute case on their first attempt post-training.
- Gather feedback from representatives on their first encounter experiences to continuously improve the training materials and processes.

Ethical Principle: Trust 

This user story aligns with the ethical principle of trust, as ensuring representatives are well-trained and capable of handling customers' dispute cases fosters reliability and trustworthiness in the service provided.

text: 100% of merchant services representatives shall be able to successfully perform a follow up action on a dispute case on the first encounter after completing the training course.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Competence in Follow-Up Actions on Dispute Cases

Description: As a merchant service representative, I want to successfully perform follow-up actions on dispute cases on the first encounter after completing the training course so that I can ensure a fair and efficient resolution process for customers.

Work:
- All representatives must complete a comprehensive training course focused on dispute case management.
- Representatives must achieve a passing score on a final assessment that includes scenarios involving follow-up actions.
- Implement a mentorship program where experienced representatives guide new representatives through initial cases.
- Create a feedback mechanism for representatives to report challenges or improvements in the process.
- Develop a performance tracking system to ensure representatives can successfully perform follow-up actions on their first encounter and identify areas needing further support. 

This user story is based on the ethical principle of Justice and Fairness, ensuring that dispute processes are handled consistently and effectively, minimizing potential unfair treatment due to representative errors or lack of knowledge.

text: The maximum wait time for a user navigating from one screen to another within the Disputes application shall be no more than 5 seconds.
ethical_us:
Title: Responsive and Efficient User Navigation

Description: As a user, I want to navigate between screens within the Disputes application in less than 5 seconds so that I can have a seamless and efficient user experience without unnecessary delays.

Work:
- Ensure the application infrastructure supports swift transitions between screens.
- Optimize application code to reduce processing time during screen navigation.
- Conduct usability testing to measure and verify the average transition time between screens does not exceed 5 seconds.
- Implement feedback mechanisms to monitor and address any deviations in navigation speed post-deployment.

Related Ethical Principle: Trust. Ensuring the application provides a reliable and efficient experience builds trust with users, as they can depend on the system to perform tasks in a timely manner.

text: The Disputes application shall support 350 concurrent users without any degradation of performance in the application.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Performance Stability for High Concurrent Usage

**Description**: As an IT administrator, I want the Disputes application to support 350 concurrent users without any degradation of performance so that users can rely on the application to function smoothly and maintain trust in the system.

**Work**: 
- Conduct load testing to ensure the application can handle 350 concurrent users without performance issues.
- Optimize backend processes to manage high user traffic efficiently.
- Monitor system performance metrics in real time to identify and address potential performance bottlenecks.
- Implement a scalable architecture that allows for future growth in the number of concurrent users.
- Document performance testing processes and results to maintain transparency with stakeholders. 

This user story is related to the ethical principle of **Trust**, as ensuring the application performance remains stable and reliable under high usage conditions is crucial for maintaining user trust in the system.

text: The Disputes application shall be available 24x7x365  with the exception of the following scheduled maintenance windows.  Monday \96 Saturday 3:00am to 4:00am EST Sunday 1:00amd to 5:00am EST
ethical_us:
**Title: Ensure Availability with Responsible Downtime**

**Description:** As a user, I want the Disputes application to be available 24x7x365 with transparent scheduling of maintenance windows so that I can plan around these times and trust the system’s reliability.

**Work:**
- Clearly communicate upcoming maintenance schedules to all users at least one week in advance.
- Ensure the application is fully operational outside the scheduled maintenance windows.
- Provide a notification system to alert users before, during, and after maintenance periods.
- Minimize maintenance duration and impact through efficient planning and execution.
- Document any unscheduled downtimes and perform post-mortem analysis to prevent recurrence.
- Offer alternative support options for users affected by scheduled maintenance.

text: The Disputes application shall interface with the Statement Database. The Statement Database provides the transaction details to the Disputes System. All transaction details must be obtained from the Statement Database
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Transparent Interface with the Statement Database

**Description**: As a compliance officer, I want the Disputes application to interface transparently with the Statement Database so that I can ensure that all transaction details are accurately and clearly obtained for auditing and verification purposes.

**Work**:
- Verify that the interface provides clear logs of data retrieval from the Statement Database.
- Ensure that all transaction data obtained is complete and unaltered.
- Implement mechanisms for auditing the data flow between the Disputes application and the Statement Database.
- Provide documentation that explains the data retrieval process and the integrity checks in place.
- Test the interface to confirm accurate and transparent data exchange under various conditions.

text: The Disputes application shall interface with the Cardmember Information Database. The Cardmember Information Database provides detailed information with regard to a cardmember. All cardmember detail information must be obtained from the Cardmember Information Database.
ethical_us:
Title: Safeguarding Cardmember Privacy in Disputes Application

Description: As a Cardmember, I want my detailed information to be accessed and used responsibly by the Disputes application from the Cardmember Information Database so that my privacy is protected and sensitive data is not mishandled.

Work:
1. Ensure that only authorized personnel have access to the Cardmember Information Database within the Disputes application.
2. Implement data encryption for all cardmember information accessed or transferred from the Cardmember Information Database.
3. Establish clear data access logs to monitor who accessed cardmember details and when.
4. Provide training for staff on data privacy best practices and legal obligations.
5. Ensure compliance with relevant privacy regulations, such as GDPR, when handling cardmember information.
6. Develop and distribute privacy notices to cardmembers explaining how their data is used in the Disputes application.

text: The Disputes applications shall interface with the Merchant Information Database. The Merchant Information Database provides detailed information with regard to the merchant. All merchant detail information shall be obtained from the Merchant Information Database.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Responsible Access and Use of Merchant Information

Description: As a disputes resolution officer, I want to access detailed merchant information securely and ethically from the Merchant Information Database so that I can handle disputes accurately while respecting privacy and maintaining trust.

Work:
- Verify that access to the Merchant Information Database is restricted to authorized personnel only.
- Implement robust authentication and authorization protocols before accessing merchant data.
- Ensure that all data access is logged and monitored to maintain an audit trail.
- Conduct regular audits of data access logs to detect and prevent unauthorized usage.
- Provide training for personnel on responsible handling of merchant information and data privacy principles.
- Establish clear policies and procedures for accessing and using the Merchant Information Database in a manner compliant with privacy laws and organizational ethics.

text: The Disputes application shall interface with the Letters application.  This will allow the Disputes application to request letters as part of the dispute initiation and dispute follow up process. All letter requests must be sent to the Print Letter Utility application.
ethical_us:
The ethical principle most related to this requirement is **Transparency**, as it involves ensuring clear communication and seamless integration between different applications to facilitate the dispute process efficiently.

Title: Enhance Transparency in Dispute Processing through System Integration

Description: As a Dispute Manager, I want the Disputes application to interface seamlessly with the Letters application, so that the process of initiating and following up on disputes is transparent and efficient by automating letter requests.

Work: 
- Verify secure and accurate data transmission between the Disputes and Letters applications.
- Ensure clarity in the communication channel used for letter requests to the Print Letter Utility application.
- Document how data flows between the systems and provide an explanation of the integration process.
- Conduct regular audits to confirm that the integration complies with organizational transparency policies.
- Provide user training on the new integrated process, emphasizing how transparency and clarity are maintained.

text: The Disputes application shall interface with the Cardmember Posting and Billing System.  This will allow the Disputes application to request adjustments to cardmember and merchant\92s accounts. All adjustment requests must be sent to the Cardmember Posting and Billing System.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Fairness in Account Adjustments

Description: As a cardholder, I want the Disputes application to interface with the Cardmember Posting and Billing System ethically so that all adjustment requests to my account, as well as merchant accounts, are processed justly and without bias.

Work:
1. Ensure that the Disputes application only interfaces with the Cardmember Posting and Billing System through secure and verified channels.
2. Implement checks ensuring that all adjustment requests are processed for fairness without any biases.
3. Provide a clear log of all adjustment requests made, including the rationale for each to promote transparency.
4. Allow cardholders and merchants to review the adjustment requests and outcomes for accuracy and fairness.
5. Maintain compliance with all relevant regulations governing financial adjustments to uphold accountability and justice.
6. Conduct regular audits of the adjustment processes to ensure ongoing fairness and address any discrepancies proactively.

text: The Disputes application shall ensure that only users with the appropriate access level are allowed to initiate dispute requests.
ethical_us:
Title: Access Control for Dispute Initiation

Description: As a system administrator, I want to ensure that only users with the appropriate access level can initiate dispute requests so that users' sensitive information and system integrity are protected.

Work:
- Verify that access control mechanisms are in place to authenticate and authorize users.
- Ensure that users without the required access level receive an appropriate error message when attempting to initiate a dispute.
- Implement a logging system to track attempts to initiate disputes without the necessary access level.
- Regularly review and update access level requirements to align with changes in user roles and responsibilities.

text: Only users with Update access must be able to initiate dispute requests.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensure Access Control for Dispute Request Initiation

Description: As a system administrator, I want to ensure that only users with Update access can initiate dispute requests so that user permissions are respected, and organizational data integrity and security are maintained.

Work:
- Verify that the access control mechanism correctly identifies users with Update access before allowing dispute request initiation.
- Implement a validation process to audibly log attempts to initiate dispute requests by users without Update access.
- Provide clear communication and error messages to users without the necessary permissions when they attempt to initiate a dispute request.
- Regularly review and update user roles and permissions to maintain accurate access controls.
- Conduct periodic audits to ensure the access control mechanisms align with organizational security and data integrity policies. 

Ethical Principle: Responsibility—ensuring that the system respects user permissions, data integrity, and aligns with organizational policies, thereby holding developers and stakeholders accountable for access control and security measures.

text: The Disputes application shall ensure that only authorized users are allowed to logon to the application.
ethical_us:
Title: Secure Access for Authorized Users

Description: As an application system administrator, I want to ensure that only authorized users are allowed to log on to the Disputes application so that sensitive information and functionalities are protected from unauthorized access and misuse.

Work:
- Verify the implementation of authentication mechanisms tailored for user roles to prevent unauthorized access.
- Ensure that the system maintains a robust user database with role-specific access privileges.
- Conduct regular audits to check the effectiveness of the authentication process and update security measures as necessary.
- Provide a process for authorized users to reset their access credentials securely and efficiently.
- Implement and test logging mechanisms to record and alert on unauthorized access attempts.
- Ensure compliance with relevant security standards and regulations related to user access control.

text: All authorized users  once authenticated must be able to logon to the Disputes System
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Authorized Access to the Disputes System

Description: As an authorized user, I want to securely log on to the Disputes System so that I can access the necessary resources and perform my tasks efficiently and without unauthorized access.

Work: 
- Verify that the authentication process for accessing the Disputes System is robust and secure.
- Ensure that once authenticated, authorized users can seamlessly log on to the system without experiencing delays or errors.
- Implement measures to regularly audit and update the list of authorized users for accuracy.
- Provide clear communication to users about login procedures and security measures.
- Offer support and assistance for any login issues experienced by authorized users. 

Related Ethical Principle: Trust

The user story is based on the ethical principle of trust, which is essential to ensuring that systems work properly, protect data responsibly, and that users can rely on secure and effective access to the services they need.

text: The Disputes System shall generate a User Report that details any new users that have been added and any changes to an existing user\92s access level. The report will be reviewed for auditing purposes.
ethical_us:
Title: User Access Audit Transparency Report

Description: As an auditor, I want to generate a User Report detailing any new users and changes to existing users' access levels so that I can ensure transparency and compliance in access management for the Disputes System.

Work: 
- Acceptance Criteria:
  1. The system must automatically generate a User Report weekly.
  2. The report should include details of newly added users, including their roles and permissions.
  3. The report must highlight any modifications in existing users' access levels.
  4. The system should provide an easy-to-understand format for auditors to review user access changes.
  5. The report must be stored securely and be easy to retrieve for future audits.
  6. Audit logs should be maintained to track who accessed the report and any changes made to it.

text: All additions of new users and modifications to user\92s access shall be recorded on the User Report.
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent User Access Logging

Description: As a compliance officer, I want to ensure that all additions of new users and modifications to users' access are recorded in the User Report so that accountability and transparency are maintained in the system.

Work: 
- Verify that every user addition is logged with a timestamp and details in the User Report.
- Confirm that all modifications to user access are documented, including the nature of the changes and the individual who made them.
- Ensure that the User Report is easily accessible to authorized personnel for auditing purposes.
- Test the system to validate that no changes occur without being recorded in the User Report.
- Review and update the User Report format regularly to maintain clarity and ease of understanding.

text: If a user account is revoked  it can only be re-instantiated by the System Administrator.
ethical_us:
Title: Secure Account Reinstatement Procedure

Description: As a System Administrator, I want to manage the reinstatement of user accounts so that account recoveries are handled securely and responsibly, ensuring system integrity and user trust.

Work:
- Verify the identity of the user requesting account reinstatement.
- Review the reason for the original account revocation.
- Ensure that proper protocols and guidelines for account reinstatement are in place and followed.
- Document the process and decision regarding account reinstatement for auditing and accountability.
- Notify the user of the reinstatement decision and provide guidance on maintaining account security and compliance with system policies.

text: Only the System Administrator shall be able to reset a revoked user logon account
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Responsible Account Management

Description: As a System Administrator, I want to be the sole person authorized to reset revoked user logon accounts so that the security and privacy of user accounts are maintained responsibly, preventing unauthorized access and misuse.

Work: 
- Verify that only System Administrators have access rights to reset user logon accounts.
- Implement authentication procedures for System Administrators to confirm identity before resetting any account.
- Log all account reset actions with details of the administrator performing the reset and the reason for the reset.
- Provide training for System Administrators on responsible account management and privacy protection.
- Conduct regular audits to ensure compliance with the system's access control policies.

text: The Disputes application shall manipulate and view business data. Users will not have direct access to data files or databases.
ethical_us:
**Title: Data Access Control for User Privacy**

**Description:** As a data privacy-focused end user, I want to ensure that the Disputes application manipulates and views business data without granting direct access to data files or databases so that my personal and sensitive information remains protected and secure.

**Work:**
1. Verify that users cannot access data files or databases directly.
2. Ensure the application uses secure methods to manipulate and view data.
3. Implement logging mechanisms to monitor and track data manipulation activities.
4. Conduct security audits to confirm data access is appropriately restricted.
5. Guarantee adherence to data privacy regulations and best practices.

text: All updates to data files or database must be initiated from the Disputes System.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Transparent Data Updates

Description: As a system auditor, I want all updates to data files or databases to be initiated exclusively from the Disputes System so that I can ensure transparency and traceability in data modification processes.

Work:
- Verify that all data updates are logged with timestamps and user identification.
- Ensure that only authorized personnel can initiate updates through the Disputes System.
- Confirm that an audit trail of all data update activities is maintained.
- Validate that the Disputes System has mechanisms to prevent unauthorized data modifications.
- Test that notifications are automatically generated for each data update, alerting relevant stakeholders.

text: The Disputes application must conform to the legal requirements as specified by the Merchant Operating Regulations.
ethical_us:
**Title:** Ensure Legal Compliance in Dispute Applications

**Description:** As a compliance officer, I want the Disputes application to conform to the legal requirements specified by the Merchant Operating Regulations so that our organization can act responsibly and maintain accountability to legal standards.

**Work:**
- Verify that all features of the Disputes application align with current Merchant Operating Regulations.
- Collaborate with legal experts to review and update compliance documentation regularly.
- Implement automated checks to alert for any discrepancies between the application and legal requirements.
- Train staff on legal obligations and application updates to promote awareness of compliance.
- Conduct periodic audits to ensure continuous adherence to applicable regulations.

text: All business rules specified in the Disputes System shall be in compliance with the Merchant Operating Regulations.
ethical_us:
Title: Compliance with Merchant Operating Regulations

Description: As a compliance officer, I want all business rules in the Disputes System to align with the Merchant Operating Regulations so that our operations are ethically accountable and legally sound.

Work:
1. Review the current business rules against the Merchant Operating Regulations to identify any discrepancies.
2. Update the business rules where necessary to ensure full compliance with the Merchant Operating Regulations.
3. Develop a validation process to ensure all future changes to business rules adhere to the Merchant Operating Regulations.
4. Document the compliance process and make it accessible to all relevant stakeholders.
5. Conduct training sessions for team members on the importance of compliance with the Merchant Operating Regulations.

text: The Disputes application must conform to the legal requirements as specified by Regulation E and Regulation Z that govern credit card disputes processing.
ethical_us:
**Title: Compliance with Credit Card Disputes Regulations**

**Description:** As a **financial regulator**, I want to **ensure the Disputes application conforms to legal requirements as specified by Regulation E and Regulation Z** so that **credit card disputes are processed lawfully and consumers' rights are protected**.

**Work:**

1. Validate that the application incorporates all necessary legal stipulations of Regulation E and Regulation Z.
2. Develop automated checks within the application to ensure ongoing compliance with these regulations.
3. Conduct a thorough legal review of the application’s disputes processing feature to confirm adherence to regulations.
4. Implement regular audits and updates processes to accommodate changes in legal requirements.
5. Provide comprehensive training for users on regulatory compliance features and their implementation in credit card disputes processing.
6. Establish a reporting system for any discrepancies or violations in the application's compliance.

text: All business rules specified in the Disputes System shall be in compliance to the guidelines of Regulation E and Regulation Z.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensure Compliance with Financial Regulations in Dispute System

Description: As a compliance officer, I want to ensure that all business rules in the Disputes System adhere to the guidelines of Regulation E and Regulation Z so that we maintain transparency and adhere to legal standards.

Work:
- Review and document the specific requirements outlined in Regulation E and Regulation Z.
- Develop a comprehensive list of business rules that must be adhered to in the Dispute System.
- Implement a system to regularly update these rules as regulations change.
- Conduct regular audits of the Dispute System to ensure compliance with Regulation E and Regulation Z.
- Provide training for all relevant personnel on the importance of these regulations and how they impact business rules.
- Create clear documentation and reporting mechanisms for any discrepancies or breaches in compliance.

text: The Disputes application must maintain a detailed history of every action that a user takes on a dispute case.  This ensures a complete audit trail if questions arise later on with regard to a particular dispute case.
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent Audit Trail for Dispute Cases

Description: As a dispute resolution officer, I want to ensure every action taken on a dispute case is documented thoroughly so that a transparent and complete audit trail can be maintained, enabling accountability and clarity if questions arise later.

Work: 
- Ensure that every user's action on a dispute case is logged with a timestamp and user identification.
- Maintain a secure and accessible history of all actions taken on each dispute case.
- Implement an easy-to-use interface for viewing the history of actions on a dispute case.
- Verify that the audit trail data can be filtered and searched by date, user, and action type.
- Ensure that the audit trail is protected against tampering and unauthorized access.

text: All actions that modify an existing dispute case must be recorded in the case history.
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent Case Modification Tracking

Description: As a judicial oversight officer, I want to ensure that all actions that modify an existing dispute case are recorded in the case history so that the process remains transparent and accountable to all parties involved.

Work: 
- Ensure a logging system is implemented that records every action taken on a dispute case.
- Each log entry should include the timestamp, the user who made the change, and a brief description of the modification.
- The case history should be accessible to authorized personnel for review.
- Implement user notifications when changes are recorded in a case they are involved in.
- Develop an audit feature that can generate reports of modifications for specific time frames or cases.

text: The Disputes System must be accessible by both internal and external users.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Equitable Access to the Disputes System

Description: As a system user (both internal and external), I want to access the Disputes System, so that I can review, submit, and manage disputes efficiently and fairly, regardless of my role or location.

Work: 
- Provide a user-friendly login interface accessible to both internal staff and external users.
- Ensure the system's UI is intuitive and functions across different browsers and devices.
- Conduct accessibility testing to confirm compliance with accessibility standards (e.g., WCAG).
- Implement authentication measures appropriate for different types of users while maintaining security.
- Validate that external users have the same capabilities to access and manage their disputes as internal users.
- Provide user training materials and support channels available to all users.

text: The Disputes System must prevent users from accessing any dispute cases that do not belong to their cardholder base.
ethical_us:
Title: Restrict Access to Unauthorized Dispute Cases

Description: As a cardholder support agent, I want to ensure that I can only access dispute cases that belong to my assigned cardholder base so that the privacy of dispute information is upheld and unauthorized access is prevented.

Work: 
- Verify that access permissions are set up correctly based on cardholder base assignments.
- Implement authentication checks to validate user credentials against dispute case access rights.
- Conduct tests to ensure that unauthorized users are unable to access dispute cases that are not part of their assigned cardholder base.
- Audit and log access attempts to dispute cases, highlighting any unauthorized access attempts.
- Provide training for support agents on the importance of maintaining privacy and abiding by access protocols.

text: The Disputes System will facilitate direct data entry of a dispute case via a user interface that supports real time responses to the users.
ethical_us:
Title: Facilitating Transparent and Real-time Dispute Resolution

Description: As a user who is involved in a dispute, I want to enter my dispute case data directly via an intuitive user interface and receive real-time responses so that I can understand the process, track the status, and resolve the dispute efficiently.

Work:
- The user interface must allow users to submit their dispute case data in a clear and structured manner.
- The system must provide real-time updates and notifications to the user about their case status.
- The user interface should display clear instructions and explanations for each step to enhance user understanding.
- Ensure mechanisms are in place for confirming the data submission has been successfully registered.
- The system must log all interactions and updates to ensure an audit trail can be followed.
- The interface design should prioritize ease of use and accessibility for all users.

text: The Disputes System must provide different levels of access with regard to disputes case initiation and follow-up actions.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Fair Access Levels in Disputes System

Description: As a system administrator, I want to implement different levels of access for disputes case initiation and follow-up actions so that the system respects privacy and ensures fairness in handling disputes.

Work:
- Verify that access levels are correctly defined for each user role, ensuring only authorized personnel can initiate or follow-up on dispute cases.
- Ensure that personal data protection policies are adhered to in all levels of access configurations.
- Test the system to confirm that unauthorized users cannot access sensitive case information or perform follow-up actions.
- Document the access level configurations and audit results to ensure transparency and accountability.
- Provide training for users on how to handle disputes in accordance with their access level to maintain system fairness and privacy respect.

text: The Disputes System shall provide view access capability for authorized users of the application.
ethical_us:
Title: Enhanced Transparency for Authorized Users

Description: As an authorized user of the Disputes System, I want to have view access capability so that I can ensure transparency in the resolution process and verify the accuracy and fairness of disputes.

Work:
- Verify that access is limited to authorized users based on predefined roles and permissions.
- Ensure that the view access provides comprehensive and clear information relevant to the disputes.
- Validate that the information displayed is accurate, up-to-date, and easy to understand.
- Confirm that the system logs access events to maintain an audit trail for accountability.
- Test that view access functionality complies with legal and organizational transparency requirements.

text: The Disputes System shall provide update access capability for authorized users of the application.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Transparency

Title: Authorized Access for Transparent Dispute Updates

Description: As an authorized user, I want to access and update dispute information so that I can ensure transparency and keep all relevant stakeholders informed with accurate and current data.

Work:
- Verify that only authorized users have update access to the application.
- Ensure the system logs all updates made by authorized users for audit purposes.
- Provide clear guidelines and user interface instructions for updating dispute information.
- Implement validation to prevent unauthorized changes to dispute data.
- Allow users to view a history of updates to track changes over time.

text: The Disputes System must allow the users to select disputable transactions (based on the age of the transaction) from a user interface and initiate a dispute (ticket retrieval request or chargeback notification) on the selected transaction.
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent Transaction Dispute Process

Description: As a user, I want to be able to select disputable transactions based on the age of the transaction from a user interface and initiate a dispute, so that I can transparently resolve any transaction issues and ensure my transaction history is accurate.

Work:
- The system must provide a clear and user-friendly interface for viewing the list of disputable transactions, along with their ages.
- Users must be able to select transactions they wish to dispute directly from the list.
- The system should offer clear instructions on how to initiate a dispute, whether it's a ticket retrieval request or a chargeback notification.
- The user should receive immediate confirmation once a dispute is initiated, detailing the next steps and any additional information required.
- The dispute process must keep users informed of the status of their dispute at each stage.
- Users should have access to an explanation of the criteria that determine a transaction's disputability to ensure transparency in the process.

text: The Disputes System must provide the user the ability to initiate a single dispute case on multiple transactions that belong to a single merchant.
ethical_us:
Title: Unified Dispute Resolution for Transparency in Transactions

Description: As a customer, I want to initiate a single dispute case on multiple transactions that belong to a single merchant so that I can transparently manage my claims and understand the issue comprehensively.

Work:
- Acceptance Criteria:
  1. Ensure that the dispute system allows users to select multiple transactions from the same merchant.
  2. Provide clear instructions and explanations for users to understand how to bundle disputes.
  3. Implement a straightforward process that captures all necessary information related to each transaction accurately.
  4. Allow users to view a consolidated summary of the disputed transactions within a single case file.
  5. Ensure that users receive confirmation and status updates for the dispute case, enhancing transparency throughout the resolution process.

text: The Disputes System will provide the user the ability to create or initiate a ticket retrieval request.   As part of ticket retrieval creation process the system must prompt the user to enter all the required information to create the ticket retrieval request.  The ticket retrieval request is a document that is sent to merchant inquiring the validity of a transaction.
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent Ticket Retrieval Request Creation

Description: As a disputing customer, I want to initiate a transparent ticket retrieval request so that I can verify the validity of a transaction with the merchant effectively.

Work:
- The system prompts the user to enter all required information for the ticket retrieval request.
- The system clearly explains to the user what information is needed and why it is necessary.
- The system confirms with the user once all required fields are filled before allowing the request to be submitted.
- The system provides a summary of the details entered before the user submits the request.
- The system sends a confirmation to the user once the ticket retrieval request is successfully created and sent to the merchant.
- The system allows the user to track the status of the ticket retrieval request.

text: The Disputes System must allow the user to create three unique types of ticket retrieval requests.  The three types of ticket retrieval requests are (1) Request for original receipt (2) Request for a copy of the receipt or (3) Request for a portfolio. A portfolio consists of documentation that would provide proof of a purchase such as the documentation that is received from a car rental agency that is more than a sales receipt.
ethical_us:
**Title: Support Transparency in Ticket Retrieval Requests**

**Description:** As an **end user**, I want to create three unique types of ticket retrieval requests so that I can accurately and transparently access documentation relevant to my transactions for resolution and accountability.

**Work:**

1. Ensure that the disputes system provides options for three distinct ticket retrieval request types: original receipt, copy of the receipt, and portfolio.
2. Verify that users can differentiate clearly between the request for an original receipt and a copy of the receipt.
3. Provide a detailed explanation for what constitutes a portfolio and the type of documents included.
4. Ensure that users have clear guidance on how to use the retrieval system effectively and understand the purpose of each request type.
5. Test that each request option retrieves information accurately and promptly from the system.

text: The Disputes System must prevent external users from requesting original receipts. Requests for original receipts are restricted to internal users.
ethical_us:
Title: Restriction of Access to Original Receipts for Data Privacy

Description: As a Data Privacy Officer, I want to ensure that external users are restricted from accessing original receipts so that the privacy of sensitive information is protected and potentially harmful data breaches are prevented.

Work: 
- Verify that the system restricts access to original receipts only to internal users.
