- Ensure that external users attempting to access original receipts are blocked with an appropriate notification.
- Test the system to confirm that no external user is able to request or view original receipts under any circumstances.
- Review access logs regularly to ensure compliance with the access restriction policy.
- Implement periodic audits to assess the effectiveness of the access restrictions.

text: The Disputes System must provide a confirmation to the user upon the creation of ticket retrieval request that contains the following information
ethical_us:
Title: User Confirmation for Ticket Retrieval Requests

Description: As a user, I want to receive a confirmation upon creating a ticket retrieval request so that I am informed and assured about the status and details of my request.

Work:
- The system should send an automated email confirmation to the user immediately after a ticket retrieval request is created.
- The confirmation must include the ticket retrieval request ID, submission date and time, and expected resolution timeframe.
- The confirmation message must detail any next steps or actions required by the user.
- Ensure the information in the confirmation is concise, accurate, and understandable to all users.
- Test the confirmation process to verify that it triggers correctly in every case of ticket retrieval request creation.

Ethical Principle: Transparency - This requirement focuses on ensuring transparency in the process by providing users with explicit confirmation and details regarding their ticket retrieval requests, enhancing their understanding and trust in the system.

text: The Disputes System shall allow the user to create or initiate a chargeback request.  The system must prompt the user to enter the required information to initiate a chargeback request. The chargeback request results in a printed chargeback notification that is sent to merchant indicating that their account will be charged back if no proof is provided that the disputed transaction is valid.
ethical_us:
The ethical principle most related to this requirement is **Justice and Fairness**. The chargeback process ensures that users have a fair means to dispute transactions, and encourages transparency and accountability from merchants in proving the validity of charges.

Title: Fair Chargeback Process for Disputed Transactions

Description: As a consumer, I want to initiate a chargeback request so that I can fairly dispute a transaction and ensure that the merchant provides proof of its validity.

Work:
- The system must allow users to initiate a chargeback request through an intuitive interface.
- The system must prompt users to input all necessary information required to process the chargeback request.
- Upon submission, the system should generate a printed chargeback notification for the merchant.
- The notification must clearly state the reason for the chargeback and the requirement for the merchant to provide proof of the transaction's validity.
- Ensure that the chargeback process is transparent and provides clear guidelines to both users and merchants on their rights and responsibilities.
- Test the system to ensure it accurately processes chargeback requests and mounts proper notifications.

text: The Disputes System must provide a confirmation to the user upon the creation of a chargeback request. The confirmation must contain the following information
ethical_us:
**Ethical Principle: Transparency**

**Title: Confirmation Notification for Chargeback Request Creation**

**Description:** As a customer who has initiated a chargeback request, I want to receive a confirmation notification with detailed information so that I am informed that my request has been successfully submitted and understand the next steps in the dispute process.

**Work:**

- The system must send an immediate notification to the user upon submitting a chargeback request.
- The notification must include a unique reference number for the chargeback request.
- The notification must detail the next steps in the process, including timelines and expected actions from the user or the system.
- The notification should offer a contact method for users to request further assistance or clarification.
- Verify that the notification is sent in the preferred language and communication channel (email, SMS, or in-app message) selected by the user.

text: The Disputes System shall prevent the creation of duplicate dispute requests 100% of the time.
ethical_us:
Title: Prevention of Duplicate Dispute Requests for Fairness

Description: As a system administrator, I want to ensure that the disputes system prevents the creation of duplicate dispute requests so that all users receive fair and equal treatment without unnecessary complications or unfair delays.

Work: 
- Implement a mechanism to identify and flag potential duplicate dispute requests in the system.
- Develop an automated check to compare new dispute requests against existing ones.
- Provide real-time feedback to users attempting to submit a duplicate dispute.
- Ensure the system logs instances of prevented duplicate requests for auditing and transparency purposes.
- Test the system thoroughly to ensure it prevents duplicate dispute requests in 100% of cases.

text: The Disputes System shall accurately provide a list of possible reason codes for a given transaction.  The list of possible reason codes must be derived based on the type of transaction and the industry that the merchant belongs to  according to the business rules defined for the Disputes System.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Justice and fairness

Title: Ensure Fair and Accurate Dispute Reason Codes

Description: As a financial auditor, I want the Disputes System to accurately provide a list of possible reason codes for a given transaction based on the type of transaction and the merchant's industry, so that all transactions are evaluated fairly and consistently according to predefined business rules.

Work:
- Verify that the Disputes System retrieves the correct business rules relevant to the type of transaction.
- Ensure that the business rules accurately reflect the industry standards for reason codes.
- Test the system to confirm it provides an accurate list of reason codes for a variety of transaction types and merchant industries.
- Validate that the system updates reason codes in response to changes in business rules or industry standards.
- Confirm that the reason codes provided prevent any form of bias or unfair treatment towards specific transactions or merchants.

text: The Disputes System must provide the ability to view existing dispute cases.
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent Access to Dispute Cases 

Description: As a concerned citizen, I want to view existing dispute cases so that I can ensure transparency and understand how similar disputes are being resolved.

Work: 
- Ensure the Disputes System interface allows users to search and view dispute cases.
- Provide clear and understandable presentation of each case's details, including involved parties, resolution process, and outcomes.
- Implement necessary data privacy measures to protect sensitive information while maintaining transparency.
- Include guidance or FAQs to help users navigate and comprehend the information presented.
- Ensure the system logs user access to dispute cases to maintain accountability and monitor usage.

text: The Disputes System must provide Search functionality.  The search method must include the ability to search by (1) the dispute case number  (2) the merchant account number  (3) the cardmember account number and (4) the issuer number.  In addition to the above criteria  the search functionality must further allow the user to limit the results of the search by a date range  the type of dispute (ticket retrieval request or chargeback notification)  the case status (open  closed or all) and the dispute reason code.
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent Dispute Search Functionality

Description: As a dispute system user, I want to have a comprehensive search functionality that allows me to find specific dispute cases by various criteria, so that I can efficiently access and review case details while maintaining transparency and accountability in the dispute resolution process.

Work: 
- The search functionality must allow searching by dispute case number.
- The search functionality must allow searching by merchant account number.
- The search functionality must allow searching by cardmember account number.
- The search functionality must allow searching by issuer number.
- The search functionality must provide an option to limit search results by date range.
- The search functionality must provide an option to filter search results by the type of dispute, including ticket retrieval requests or chargeback notifications.
- The search functionality must provide an option to filter search results by case status, including open, closed, or all.
- The search functionality must provide an option to filter search results by dispute reason code.
- Ensure the search interface is intuitive and information is presented in a clear and understandable manner.
- Ensure the system logs and records search queries to maintain a transparent audit trail.

text: A list of all disputes cases that meet the entered search criteria must be provided to the user.  The list of cases must differentiate the type and/or status of the case by color -coding the line item in the list.  For example all open cases will be yellow and all closed cases will be gray.
ethical_us:
**Title:** Dispute Cases with Color-Coded Status for Clarity  

**Description:** As a legal analyst, I want to view a list of all dispute cases that meet my search criteria with color-coded indicators for case status so that I can quickly understand the current status and prevent any oversight while reviewing cases.

**Work:**  
- Acceptance criteria:  
  - The list of dispute cases displays all cases that meet the entered search criteria.
  - Each line item in the list is color-coded according to its status.  
  - Open cases are highlighted in yellow.  
  - Closed cases are highlighted in gray.  
  - Test for color-blind accessibility to ensure the color-coding is distinguishable for all users, maintaining user experience fairness.
  
The most related ethical principle in this context is **Justice and Fairness,** as it ensures discrimination-free accessibility and gives a clear, immediate understanding for every legal analyst, thus ensuring fair processing of each case regardless of status.

text: The Disputes System shall provide the users the ability to view the history of all activities that have occurred on the dispute case.
ethical_us:
Title: View Dispute Case Activity History for Transparency

Description: As a system user, I want to view the history of all activities that have occurred on my dispute case so that I can have a transparent overview of the case proceedings and ensure all actions are tracked and accountable.

Work:
- The system shall log all activity related to each dispute case, including timestamps and descriptions of actions taken.
- Users must be able to access a chronological history of activities for their specific dispute case.
- The activity history should be presented in a user-friendly and understandable format.
- A search functionality must be provided to allow users to find specific actions within the activity history.
- Ensure the privacy and security of the information contained in the activity history is safeguarded.

text: The Dispute System shall provide the users with the ability to follow up on a dispute case via follow-up actions.  The list of available follow up actions for a given dispute case must be filtered by the status of the case and the access level of the user.
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent Access to Dispute Follow-Up Actions

Description: As a user, I want to see only the follow-up actions available to me for a dispute case based on its status and my access level so that I understand my options clearly and can act accordingly.

Work:
- Ensure that the system displays a list of follow-up actions that corresponds to the current status of the dispute case.
- Implement a filtering mechanism that limits visible follow-up actions based on the user's access level.
- Provide a clear explanation or help tool for users to understand why certain actions are available or not available to them.
- Test the system to confirm that only appropriate follow-up actions are shown according to the case status and user role.
- Create documentation and support guides for users to assist in understanding their follow-up options and procedures.

text: The Disputes System shall record the name of the user and the date for any activity that creates or modifies the disputes case in the system.  A detailed history of the actions taken on the case  including the date and the user that performed the action must be maintained for auditing purposes.
ethical_us:
**Title: Audit Trail for Accountability in Disputes**

**Description:** As an auditor, I want to ensure that all activities related to disputes are recorded, including the name of the user and the date for any creation or modification, so that the system maintains transparency and credibility in handling disputes.

**Work:**

- Record and store the name of the user whenever a dispute case is created or modified.
- Capture and maintain the date and time for each action taken on a dispute case.
- Develop a comprehensive history log of all actions performed on a case for future auditing.
- Ensure that the audit trail is accessible and understandable by authorized personnel.
- Implement measures to protect the integrity and accuracy of the audit log data.

text: For any systematic (non-user initiated) action that occurs on a case such as the disputes aging process  a case activity will be generated.  Upon the next logon the user that initiated the dispute case must be notified that a systematic action has occurred on the dispute case.
ethical_us:
Title: Notification of Systematic Actions in Dispute Cases

Description: As a user who has initiated a dispute case, I want to be notified upon my next logon when any systematic actions have occurred on the dispute case so that I am kept informed and can take any necessary follow-up actions if needed.

Work:
1. Implement a system to generate a case activity log for each systematic (non-user initiated) action that occurs on a dispute case.
2. Develop functionality to automatically notify the user who initiated the dispute case upon their next logon.
3. Ensure the notification includes details about the systematic action that took place.
4. Test the notification system to confirm it works correctly and reliably notifies the appropriate user.
5. Provide an option for users to access and review the history of systematic actions on their dispute cases for transparency.

text: All letter requests must be formatted according to guidelines specified by the Print Letter Utility system.
ethical_us:
**Title:** Ensure Standardized Formatting for Letter Requests

**Description:** As a system auditor, I want all letter requests to be formatted according to guidelines specified by the Print Letter Utility system so that there is consistency and clarity in official communication, which upholds the principle of transparency.

**Work:**
- All letter requests should be processed through the Print Letter Utility system to ensure correct formatting.
- The Print Letter Utility system guidelines must be clearly documented and accessible to all users.
- The system should provide a validation step to check that letter requests meet the specified formatting guidelines before finalizing.
- Users must be notified with an error message if their letter requests deviate from the established formatting guidelines, along with corrective suggestions.
- Regular audits should be performed to ensure compliance with the formatting standards and system guidelines.
- A feedback mechanism should be available for users to report any difficulties they encounter while complying with the guidelines.

text: Any disputes cases that have been closed for over 6 months must be purged from the online disputes database.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Privacy Through Data Purging

Description: As a user of the online disputes database, I want to ensure that closed dispute cases are purged after 6 months so that individuals' privacy is protected and not unnecessarily exposed.

Work:
- Verify that all dispute cases closed for over 6 months are identified by the system.
- Ensure automated processes are in place to securely delete these identified cases from the database.
- Perform regular audits to confirm no "closed for over 6 months" cases remain in the database.
- Ensure compliance with data protection and privacy regulations related to data retention and deletion.

text: The product must support Internet Explorer 5.5 and above.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Compatibility with Older Browsers

Description: As an IT Manager, I want the product to support Internet Explorer 5.5 and above so that users with older systems or constraints can access and benefit from our services without being excluded.

Work:
- Verify that all essential features of the product perform correctly on Internet Explorer 5.5 and newer versions.
- Conduct usability testing on Internet Explorer 5.5 to identify any compatibility issues.
- Ensure that any discovered bugs specific to Internet Explorer 5.5 are documented and addressed.
- Update support documentation to clearly indicate the compatibility with Internet Explorer 5.5 and newer versions.
- Gather user feedback from those using older browser versions to ensure ongoing compatibility and access.

text: The product must support Mozilla Firefox 1.0 and above.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Justice and Fairness

Title: Ensuring Equal Access for Firefox Users

Description: As an ethical developer, I want to ensure the product supports Mozilla Firefox 1.0 and above so that all users, regardless of their browser choice, experience equal access and functionality.

Work:
- Verify compatibility of all product features with Mozilla Firefox 1.0 and above.
- Conduct cross-browser testing to ensure consistent user experience across Firefox versions.
- Fix any identified compatibility issues specific to Firefox.
- Maintain documentation of all tests conducted and issues resolved to ensure transparency and accountability.
- Regularly update compatibility checks with future Firefox updates to ensure ongoing fairness and access.

text: The product shall interface with the Choice Parts System.  This provides the feed of recycled parts data.
ethical_us:
**Title:** Integration with Choice Parts System for Sustainable Practices

**Description:** As an eco-conscious product manager, I want to interface with the Choice Parts System to receive a feed of recycled parts data so that our product can make informed decisions that support sustainability efforts.

**Work:**

Work: 
- Acceptance Criteria:
  1. Allow the adjuster to view all available repair facilities in the system.
  2. Provide a reason input field for overriding the preferred facility.
  3. Ensure that the system logs the override action and reason for transparency and accountability.
  4. Notify the policyholder of the change in the assigned repair facility with an explanation.
  5. Develop a review feature for overrides to ensure they are in line with justice and fairness standards.

text: The preferred repair facility shall be returned to the user.
ethical_us:
Title: Empowering Users with Preferred Repair Facility Choices

Description: As a vehicle owner, I want to have my preferred repair facility automatically returned to me so that I can make informed decisions and maintain autonomy over my vehicle repair preferences.

Work:
- Ensure the system accurately records and stores the user’s preferred repair facility.
- Develop a mechanism to retrieve and display the preferred repair facility when required.
- Validate that the preferred repair facility reflects user updates and modifications promptly.
- Provide a user interface that allows users to review and confirm their preferred repair facility.

text: The system shall return a list of repair facilities within the radius if the preferred repair facility cannot be determined.
ethical_us:
Title: Flexibility in Repair Facility Options

Description: As a vehicle owner, I want access to a list of repair facilities within a reasonable radius if my preferred repair facility cannot be determined, so that I can ensure timely and effective maintenance or repair of my vehicle without significant inconvenience.

Work:
- Ensure the system accurately identifies when a preferred repair facility cannot be determined.
- Implement a feature that searches for alternative repair facilities within a specified radius.
- Display a clear, user-friendly list of alternative repair facilities, including essential details such as contact information, distance, and available services.
- Provide an option for the user to select an alternative facility from the list.
- Test the functionality to ensure prompt and accurate delivery of information to the user.

text: The estimator shall search for available recycled parts using damaged vehicle parts information.
ethical_us:
Title: Promoting Sustainability through Recycled Parts Identification

Description: As an environmentally conscious insurance assessor, I want to search for available recycled vehicle parts using damaged vehicle parts information so that I can reduce waste and promote sustainability in the automotive repair process.

Work: 
- Ensure the estimator system can accurately identify and categorize damaged vehicle parts.
- Develop an integration with databases of recycled parts suppliers.
- Implement an algorithm to match damaged parts with available recycled parts.
- Display options for recycled parts to the user, emphasizing the environmental benefits.
- Verify that recycled parts information is updated regularly for accurate search results.
- Provide a user-friendly interface to streamline the decision-making process for using recycled parts.

text: The estimator shall search for available recycled parts using a list of preferred parts suppliers.
ethical_us:
Title: Sourcing Sustainable Recycled Parts 

Description: As an environmentally conscious estimator, I want to search for available recycled parts using a list of preferred parts suppliers so that I can contribute to sustainability and reduce the environmental impact of our products.

Work: 
- The system shall provide a searchable and up-to-date list of preferred suppliers who offer recycled parts.
- The system shall allow for filtering of suppliers based on geographical proximity to minimize transportation emissions.
- The system shall automatically prioritize recycled parts in search results when available to encourage sustainable choices.
- The system shall provide information about the environmental benefits of selecting recycled parts for informed decision-making.  
- The estimator shall receive periodic updates on new recycled parts and suppliers to stay informed on sustainable sourcing options.

text: The system shall search for available recycled parts for the supplied vehicle parts and suppliers.
ethical_us:
Title: Promote Sustainable Vehicle Repair

Description: As a sustainability-conscious vehicle owner, I want the system to search for available recycled parts for the supplied vehicle parts and suppliers so that I can reduce my environmental impact and promote sustainable practices in vehicle repair.

Work:
- The system should connect to multiple databases and suppliers to gather information on available recycled parts.
- The system should prioritize displaying recycled parts over new parts when both are available.
- The system should provide pricing and availability information for the recycled parts.
- The system should include a feature for users to easily select and order recycled parts.
- The system should track the number of recycled parts used and report on the environmental impact, promoting a sense of accomplishment for sustainability efforts.

text: The estimator shall search by zipcode with a radius of 30 miles if no parts are found for the preferred parts suppliers
ethical_us:
Title: Enhancing Parts Availability with Equitable Access

Description: As an estimator, I want to search for parts by zipcode with a radius of 30 miles if no parts are found from preferred suppliers, so that I can efficiently provide fair and reliable service to all customers regardless of location.

Work:
- Ensure the search algorithm includes a function to expand the search radius to 30 miles when no parts are available from preferred suppliers.
- Test the search algorithm for accuracy and efficiency to confirm parts can be located within the designated radius.
- Implement measures to ensure the extended search process remains unbiased and fair for all suppliers.
- Design the user interface to clearly communicate when a search has expanded beyond preferred suppliers.
- Verify that search results are updated promptly and accurately, maintaining current inventory data from local suppliers.
- Test the overall system to ensure it aligns with Fairness Guidelines, ensuring equitable access to parts for customers across different regions. 

Ethical principle: Justice and Fairness

text: The system shall retain the available recycled parts and suppliers returned from the search.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Sustainability

Title: Retention of Recycled Parts and Supplier Information for Sustainable Practices

Description: As a procurement manager, I want to retain the available recycled parts and supplier information returned from the search so that we can support sustainable supply chain practices and make environmentally friendly purchasing decisions.

Work:
- Ensure the system automatically saves search results containing recycled parts and supplier information for future reference.
- Implement a user-friendly interface that clearly displays retained recycled parts and supplier information.
- Validate that the saved information is easily accessible for sustainability audits and reports.
- Verify the accuracy and up-to-dateness of the retained data is maintained.
- Provide a mechanism for users to update or remove outdated supplier information to avoid database clutter.

text: The available recycled parts information and their suppliers shall be returned to the user.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Sustainability

Title: Access to Transparent Information on Recycled Parts

Description: As an environmentally-conscious consumer, I want to access information about available recycled parts and their suppliers so that I can make informed purchasing decisions that support sustainability.

Work:
- Display a comprehensive list of available recycled parts, including their descriptions and specifications.
- Provide clear information about each part's supplier, including the supplier's sustainability practices.
- Ensure the information is regularly updated to reflect current stock and newly available recycled parts.
- Allow users to filter and sort the parts based on their preferences, such as supplier ratings or specific sustainability criteria.
- Ensure the user interface is easy to navigate and information is presented in a clear, understandable manner.

text: The estimator shall apply selected recycled parts to the collision estimate.
ethical_us:
Title: Sustainable Collision Estimation

Description: As an environmental-conscious insurance agent, I want to apply selected recycled parts to the collision estimate so that we minimize environmental impact and promote sustainability in repairs.

Work:
- Evaluate the quality and safety of available recycled parts for collision repairs.
- Ensure the estimator algorithm prioritizes recycled parts in its calculations.
- Provide clear guidelines and documentation for customers on the benefits of using recycled parts.
- Ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations when selecting recycled parts.
- Implement a feedback loop to continuously improve the selection process for recycled parts based on environmental impact and customer satisfaction.

text: The estimator shall not apply recycled parts to the collision estimate if no available parts are returned.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Fair Estimates in Auto Parts Selection

Description: As a vehicle owner, I want the estimator not to apply recycled parts to the collision estimate if no available parts are returned, so that the repair assessment stays accurate and reflects the actual availability of parts, ensuring fairness and transparency in the repair process.

Work: 
- Verify the system can differentiate between recycled and new parts availability when generating estimates.
- Ensure the estimator algorithm checks for part availability in real-time before recommending recycled parts.
- Implement logging to track when recycled parts are recommended in estimates and whether those parts were returned.
- Provide repair technicians with clear guidelines on how and when recycled parts should be applied to estimates, especially in scenarios where availability may be uncertain.
- Conduct regular audits of the estimator system to ensure compliance with the transparency requirement. 

The selected principle for this user story is Justice and fairness, as it highlights the need to ensure that estimates do not unfairly assess costs based on unavailable recycled parts, thereby ensuring a fair and just repair process for vehicle owners.

text: The adjuster shall review the collision estimate.
ethical_us:
**Title:** Ensuring Fair Collision Estimate Reviews

**Description:** As an insurance adjuster, I want to review collision estimates thoroughly and impartially so that claimants receive a just and fair settlement.

**Work:**

- Verify the accuracy of the collision estimate data against the incident report.
- Ensure all vehicle damages are documented and assessed without bias.
- Cross-check estimates with similar past claims to ensure consistent evaluation standards.
- Confirm compliance with the company's fairness and integrity policies during the review process.
- Provide feedback or request revisions if discrepancies or unfair evaluations are identified. 

The selected ethical principle for this requirement is "Justice and Fairness," as it emphasizes reviewing the collision estimates impartially to ensure fairness for all parties involved.

text: The adjuster shall request a recycled parts audit of the collision estimate.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Sustainable Collision Repairs

Description: As an insurance adjuster, I want to request a recycled parts audit of the collision estimate so that we can promote sustainable practices and minimize environmental impact in auto repairs.

Work:
- Verify that the collision estimate includes an option to select recycled parts for the repair.
- Ensure the audit process accurately checks for the availability and feasibility of using recycled parts.
- Confirm that recycled parts meet the quality and safety standards required for repairs.
- Document the results of the recycled parts audit for transparency and accountability.
- Provide feedback to repair shops or clients about the benefits of using recycled parts.

text: The recycled parts search results provided to the estimator shall be retrieved by the system.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensure Fair Sourcing for Estimator's Recycled Parts Search

Description: As an estimator, I want the system to retrieve accurate and unbiased recycled parts search results so that I can make informed, fair decisions and contribute to sustainable practices.

Work: 
- Verify that the search algorithm retrieves recycled parts without discrimination based on supplier location, size, or reputation.
- Ensure that the system includes diverse and smaller suppliers in the search results to promote fairness.
- Implement checks to confirm that search results are derived from a balanced and comprehensive dataset.
- Validate that the search results are ranked fairly, based on objective criteria like compatibility and condition, not extraneous biases.
- Develop a mechanism for user feedback to continuously enhance and supervise fairness in search results.

text: The system shall generate an audit report based on the available recycled parts and the collision estimate.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Transparency

Title: Generate Detailed Audit Reports for Clear Understanding

Description: As a compliance officer, I want to generate an audit report based on the available recycled parts and the collision estimate so that I can ensure transparency and maintain clear records for stakeholders regarding material usage and cost estimations.

Work: 
- Acceptance Criteria:
  1. The system must accurately compile available data on recycled parts into the audit report.
  2. The audit report should include detailed sections clearly explaining the methodology used to derive the collision estimate.
  3. The report should be generated in a format that is easily understandable by non-technical stakeholders.
  4. The system should provide a summary page in the report highlighting key findings and insights.
  5. Any discrepancies or anomalies in the data should be clearly highlighted and explained in the report.
  6. Ensure that the report is accessible and can be reviewed by authorized personnel at any time.

text: The audit report shall include the total number of recycled parts used in the estimate.
ethical_us:
Title: Sustainability Audit Reporting

Description: As an environmental auditor, I want to include the total number of recycled parts used in the estimate so that I can accurately assess and report on our company's sustainability efforts.

Work: 
- Develop a mechanism to track the number of recycled parts used in each estimate.
- Ensure that the audit report template includes a section for recycled parts data entry.
- Validate the accuracy of the recycled parts data before it is added to the report.
- Provide a summary of the environmental benefits associated with the use of recycled parts in the audit report.
- Test the reporting feature to ensure accurate and reliable data presentation on recycled parts usage.

text: The audit report shall include the number of available recycled parts from the original search results.
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent Reporting of Recycled Parts Availability

Description: As a sustainability auditor, I want to have a clear view of the number of available recycled parts from the original search results so that I can accurately assess the environmental impact and resource efficiency of our processes.

Work:
- The audit report must clearly list the total number of recycled parts available from the search results.
- Ensure that the report updates dynamically to reflect any changes in the availability of recycled parts.
- Include a breakdown by type of part and origin to enhance transparency and understanding.
- Provide a user-friendly overview that allows the auditor to easily navigate and interpret the data.
- Validate data accuracy through automated checks against source databases.

text: The audit report shall include the percentage of available recycled parts used in the estimate
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent Recycling Practices in Audit Reports

Description: As an environmental auditor, I want to see the percentage of available recycled parts used in estimates so that I can ensure and communicate the commitment to sustainability and environmental responsibility.

Work: 
- Display the percentage of recycled parts used prominently in the audit report.
- Ensure the calculation method for the percentage is documented and accessible within the report.
- Include a comparison metric to show improvements or changes in recycled part usage over time.
- Provide a section in the report for any comments or explanations regarding the use of recycled parts.

text: The audit report shall include the total score of the audit which sums the indivual line items.
ethical_us:
Title: Transparency in Audit Reporting

Description: As a compliance officer, I want the audit report to include the total score calculated from individual line items so that I can easily understand the overall outcome of the audit and ensure transparency in reporting.

Work: 
- Acceptance Criteria:
  - The audit report must display a total score section that clearly aggregates the scores from each individual line item.
  - Each line item should have its score and contribution to the total score clearly indicated.
  - The calculation of the total score should be accurate and verifiable.
  - Ensure that the total score and its breakdown are easily accessible and prominently displayed in the audit report.
  - Provide explanatory notes or a methodology section explaining how the total score is derived from the line items.

text: The audit report shall be displayed to the user.
ethical_us:
**Title: Transparency in Audit Reports**

**Description:** As an informed user, I want to view the audit report so that I can understand the decision-making process and ensure transparency in how the system operates.

**Work:**
- Display the complete audit report in a user-friendly format.
- Ensure that key sections, like data sources and decision criteria, are highlighted for clarity.
- Implement a feature for users to download or print the audit report for further analysis.
- Provide a glossary or help section that explains technical terms within the report.
- Ensure access controls are in place so only authorized users can view detailed audit reports.

text: The audit report shall be available to other adjusters at later points in time.
ethical_us:
Title: Enhancing Transparency Through Access to Audit Reports

Description: As an adjuster, I want to access audit reports at later points in time so that I can ensure transparency in our auditing processes and make informed decisions.

Work: 
- Verify that the audit report storage system is secure and access-controlled.
- Ensure that all adjusters have the necessary permissions to view the audit reports.
- Implement a search function to locate specific audit reports quickly and easily.
- Allow the download of audit reports in various formats for further analysis.
- Log all access to audit reports to maintain a transparent record of who accessed what and when.
- Provide notifications or updates when audit reports are modified or updated.

text: The user shall select to view the preferred repair facility ratings.
ethical_us:
### Title: Empowering Users with Informed Decision-Making

#### Description: 
As a conscientious consumer, I want to view the preferred repair facility ratings so that I can make informed decisions based on transparent and reliable information.

#### Work:
- The system shall display ratings prominently for each preferred repair facility.
- The ratings must be accompanied by an explanatory note detailing the criteria used for assessment.
- The user shall have access to a date stamp indicating when the rating was last updated.
- The user can filter and sort repair facilities based on ratings.
- There shall be an option for the user to access detailed reviews or feedback that contributes to the ratings.
- Ensure compliance with privacy laws and user data protection when displaying ratings and reviews. 

This user story ties into the ethical principle of **Transparency**, ensuring that users are given clear, accurate, and understandable information about repair facilities to make informed decisions.

text: The current repair facility ratings shall be displayed to the user.
ethical_us:
Title: Display Repair Facility Ratings Transparently

Description: As a car owner, I want to view the current repair facility ratings so that I can make informed decisions based on transparent and reliable information.

Work:
- Ensure that repair facility ratings are easily accessible and visible to all users on the interface.
- Provide explanations or descriptors alongside ratings to clarify their meaning and origin.
- Implement sorting and filtering options for users to view ratings based on specific criteria (e.g., highest rated).
- Verify that the rating data presented is up-to-date and originates from credible, verified sources.
- Provide information on how ratings are calculated and any factors that might influence them.
- Include a feedback mechanism for users to report discrepancies or issues with the ratings displayed.

text: The system will display a blank set of ratings if there are not ratings yet defined.
ethical_us:
Title: Displaying Transparent Rating Information

Description: As a user, I want the system to display a blank set of ratings if there are no ratings yet defined so that I can trust that the information displayed is accurate and not misleading.

Work: 
- Ensure the system checks if there are existing ratings for a specific item.
- Implement logic to display a blank set of ratings if no ratings are available.
- Verify that no accidental default ratings or incorrect data are shown.
- Conduct user tests to ensure the displayed information is clear and understandable.
- Confirm that any explanatory messages or indicators of "no ratings yet" are visible to users.

text: The user shall enter new ratings based on the audit report
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Trust

Title: Facilitating Trustworthy Audit Reporting with User-Entered Ratings

Description: As a compliance auditor, I want to enter new ratings based on the audit report so that I can ensure the audit findings accurately reflect the situation and contribute to maintaining transparency and trust in the system.

Work:
- Acceptance of ratings is logged, and changes are documented to ensure audit trails are maintained.
- A mechanism is provided for the auditor to verify the integrity of the new ratings.
- Ensure the system provides feedback or acknowledgments once new ratings are entered to confirm successful updates.
- Ensure the system offers guidance or tooltips for entering ratings accurately to prevent errors and misinterpretations.
- Provide clear communication channels for discussing the ratings, if necessary, to foster trust and transparency.

text: The ratings shall be from a scale of 1-10
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Justice and Fairness

Title: Implement Fair Rating System

Description: As a user, I want the ratings to be from a scale of 1-10 so that I can provide accurate and equitable feedback without bias or unfairness.

Work:
- Ensure that the rating scale is consistent and clearly defined to all users.
- Conduct testing to verify that the rating distribution is fair and devoid of inherent biases.
- Provide clear instructions and guidelines for users to understand the rating system.
- Implement mechanisms to detect and mitigate any skewness or unfair patterns in user ratings.
- Gather user feedback on the rating system and make adjustments as necessary to maintain fairness.

text: The ratings shall include categories for attempted use of recycled parts and actual use of recycled parts
ethical_us:
Title: Enhancing Sustainability through Recycled Parts 

Description: As an environmentally-conscious consumer, I want the product ratings to include categories for attempted and actual use of recycled parts so that I can make informed purchasing decisions and support sustainable practices.

Work: 
- Develop a rating system that categorizes the use of recycled parts into 'attempted' and 'actual'.
- Implement a verification process to ensure the accuracy of reported recycled parts usage.
- Educate manufacturers on the benefits and criteria of incorporating recycled parts into their products.
- Display the recycled parts rating prominently for consumer visibility.
- Ensure that the rating system is transparent and easy to understand for consumers.

text: The user shall select to save the preferred repair facility ratings.
ethical_us:
Title: Empowering Users to Safeguard Their Repair Facility Preferences

Description: As a vehicle owner, I want to save the preferred repair facility ratings so that I can quickly reference my ratings for future repairs and make informed decisions based on my past experiences.

Work: 
- The system shall provide an intuitive interface that allows users to easily save their preferred repair facility ratings.
- Users must be able to access their saved ratings from any device after authentication.
- Ensure the data is securely stored to protect user privacy and preferences.
- The application must provide clear instructions for users on how to save and retrieve their preferred ratings.
- Implement a warning for data changes or deletions to prevent accidental loss of saved ratings.

text: The preferred repair facility ratings shall be saved by the system.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Justice and Fairness in Repair Facility Ratings

Description: As a customer, I want the system to save the ratings of preferred repair facilities so that I can make informed and unbiased decisions about where to get my repairs done.

Work: 
- The system should accurately store the ratings of each repair facility without alteration.
- Users should be able to access ratings data easily and understand the basis of each rating.
- Ensure that the ratings data is free from any form of discrimination, bias, or unfairness.
- Implement a mechanism to allow users to report suspicious or fraudulent ratings.
- Regularly audit the rating system to ensure accuracy and fairness.
- Provide transparency on how ratings are calculated and displayed to users.

text: The product must work with most database management systems (DBMS) on the market  whether the DBMS is colocated with the product on the same machine or is located on a different machine on the computer network.
ethical_us:
**Title:** Ensuring Compatibility Across Various Database Management Systems

**Description:** As a software integrator, I want to ensure that the product can work seamlessly with most database management systems (DBMS) on the market, whether the DBMS is colocated with the product on the same machine or is located on a different machine on the computer network, so that the software can operate flexibly and reliably in various infrastructural setups.

**Work:**
- Verify compatibility with the top DBMS systems, such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, and Microsoft SQL Server.
- Test the product's performance with colocated and remote DBMS setups to ensure consistent functionality.
- Document any limitations or special configuration requirements for each supported DBMS.
- Develop automated tests to regularly validate ongoing compatibility with different DBMS systems.
- Ensure secure and efficient connection protocols are in place for both local and remote DBMS integrations.

The ethical principle most related to this requirement is **Trust**. By ensuring that the product is compatible with a wide array of DBMS, organizations can demonstrate their trustworthiness by ensuring their technology is reliable, adaptable, and transparent to a variety of user needs and configurations.

text: The product will function alongside server software on any operating system where the Java runtime can be installed.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Platform Independence for Greater Accessibility

Description: As a developer, I want the product to function alongside server software on any operating system where the Java runtime can be installed so that it promotes inclusivity and fairness by ensuring compatibility across diverse systems.

Work: 
- Verify that the product is tested on multiple operating systems (e.g., Windows, macOS, Linux) to confirm compatibility.
- Ensure that Java runtime installation is straightforward and well-documented for each supported operating system.
- Confirm that the performance of the product is consistent across different operating systems.
- Gather user feedback from diverse system users to identify any additional compatibility issues.
- Address any discovered issues promptly and update the product to maintain accessibility and fairness.

text: The product will require collaboration with a database management system (DBMS).  The DBMS may be located on the same machine as the product or on a separate machine residing on the same computer network.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Secure and Responsible DBMS Collaboration

Description: As a database administrator, I want to ensure that the product collaborates securely and responsibly with the DBMS, whether on the same machine or a separate network machine, so that sensitive data is protected and system integrity is maintained.

Work:
- Verify that communication between the product and the DBMS is encrypted to protect data in transit.
- Ensure access controls are in place to prevent unauthorized access to the database.
- Audit the data sharing and access processes for compliance with privacy and security standards.
- Regularly update both the product and DBMS with security patches to mitigate vulnerabilities.
- Implement monitoring to detect and respond to potential security breaches or unusual activities.

text: The product must make use of web/application server technology.  Open source examples include Apache web server  Tomcat  and the JBoss application server.
ethical_us:
Title: Using Transparent and Trustworthy Server Technology

Description: As an ethical developer, I want to utilize open-source web/application server technology such as Apache, Tomcat, or JBoss, so that I can ensure transparency, trustworthiness, and community-driven support in deploying reliable and transparent applications.

Work: 
- Review and select a suitable open-source server technology (Apache, Tomcat, JBoss) that aligns with transparency and trust principles.
- Ensure clear documentation is available and refer to community resources to understand setup and maintenance.
- Implement secure configuration best practices to uphold user trust in application reliability and security.
- Perform regular updates and maintenance checks to ensure continued transparency and effectiveness of the server.
- Document server choices and configurations to maintain transparency for stakeholders and users.

text: A database management system such as Oracle  DB2  MySql or HSQL will need to be integrated with the product.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Data Privacy in Database Integration

Description: As a Data Privacy Officer, I want to integrate a database management system such as Oracle, DB2, MySQL, or HSQL with our product in a way that ensures user data privacy so that individual privacy rights are respected and protected.

Work:
- Conduct a privacy impact assessment to identify potential privacy risks involved with integrating the chosen database management system.
- Implement encryption measures to protect sensitive data stored in the database.
- Ensure that access controls are in place to restrict database access to only authorized personnel.
- Regularly audit and monitor database access logs to detect and respond to any unauthorized access.
- Provide transparent communication to users about data storage practices and any third-party database management system integrations.
- Ensure compliance with relevant data protection regulations, such as GDPR or CCPA, throughout the integration process.

text: The product\92s Look and Feel shall be able to incorporate aspects of the customer\92s organization such as logo  branding  and identity
ethical_us:
Title: Personalization and Identity Integration

Description: As a brand manager, I want to incorporate elements such as logo, branding, and identity into the product's look and feel, so that the product reflects our organization's unique identity and strengthens our brand presence.

Work: 
- The system must allow customization options for uploading the organization's logo.
- The branding colors specific to the organization should be applicable throughout the product interface.
- Custom fonts and textual styles associated with the company should be integrable into all text elements within the product.
- Ensure the adaptability of the UI design to accommodate different organizational branding without compromising the user experience.
- Validate that the customized look and feel is retained consistently across different user devices and platforms.

Ethical Principle: Dignity

Reasoning: This requirement aligns with the principle of Dignity, as it respects and upholds the inherent worth of the customer's organizational identity. It ensures that the organization's unique characteristics are recognized and represented, allowing them to present their values and mission consistently through their branding.

text: The product shall have a conservative and professional appearance.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Professional Presentation for User Trust

**Description**: As a stakeholder, I want the product to have a conservative and professional appearance so that it upholds the organization's reputation and fosters trust among users.

**Work**:

1. Design Review: Conduct a design review to ensure that all visual elements are consistent with a conservative and professional aesthetic.
   
2. User Feedback: Gather feedback from a focus group to validate that the appearance meets the expectations for professionalism in the target market.

3. Consistency Check: Ensure that all sections of the product maintain a uniform professional appearance without any elements that detract from perceived professionalism.

4. Iterative Testing: Implement iterative testing and refinement cycles based on stakeholder and user feedback to achieve the desired appearance.

5. Accessibility Compliance: Confirm that the professional appearance does not compromise accessibility standards, ensuring it is inclusive for all users.

text: The product shall make the users want to use it. 80% of the users surveyed report they are regularly using the product after the first 2 weeks post-launch.
ethical_us:
Title: Building Trustworthy Product Engagement

Description: As a product manager, I want to design a product that encourages users to engage with it naturally and sustainably so that 80% of users surveyed report regular usage after the first 2 weeks post-launch.

Work: 
- Conduct user research to understand the needs and motivations of the target audience.
- Ensure the design and functionality of the product prioritize user satisfaction and value.
- Implement transparent communication channels to receive and address user feedback.
- Continuously monitor product usage and engagement metrics to ensure they meet ethical standards of user trust.
- Develop an onboarding process that highlights the product's value and eases user integration into regular use.
- Regularly review and improve the product based on user experiences and ethical implications.

text: The product shall be easy to use. 90% of users will be able to successfully reserve a conference room within 5 minutes of product use.
ethical_us:
Title: User-Friendly Room Reservation Experience

Description: As a conference organizer, I want to easily and quickly reserve a conference room so that I can focus more on preparing for the event and less on administrative tasks.

Work:
- Ensure the user interface is intuitive and easy to navigate for new users.
- Conduct usability testing with diverse groups to ensure the reservation process is straightforward.
- Provide clear instructions or tooltips throughout the reservation process.
- Implement a quick-start guide or a tutorial for first-time users.
- Measure and analyze user feedback regularly to identify areas for improvement.
- Ensure that the reservation system is accessible to users with varying levels of technical proficiency. 

This user story primarily relates to the ethical principle of Beneficence, focusing on creating a positive and efficient user experience that benefits the conference organizers by making the process less time-consuming and accessible.

text: The product shall give users feedback when necessary. 80% of the users surveyed report that the product accurately confirms their actions.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Transparent Feedback for User Actions

Description: As a user, I want to receive accurate and timely feedback on my actions within the product so that I can understand my interactions and ensure my actions are correctly interpreted.

Work:
- Implement a feedback mechanism that provides users with confirmation of their actions in real time.
- Ensure the feedback is clear, concise, and easily understandable to the majority of users.
- Conduct testing with a sample of users to verify that at least 80% report the feedback accurately reflects their actions.
- Regularly review feedback mechanisms and user satisfaction to identify areas for improvement and maintain transparency. 

This ethical user story is based on the principle of Transparency, as it focuses on ensuring the users clearly understand the outcomes of their interactions with the AI product.

text: The product shall allow the user to select a chosen language from one of the target market countries.
ethical_us:
**Title: Enable Multilingual Support for Enhanced Accessibility**

**Description:** As an international user, I want to select a chosen language from one of the target market countries so that I can use the product in a language I understand and feel included.

**Work:**
1. The system should display a list of languages available for selection that correspond to the target market countries.
2. Upon selection of a language, the user interface should immediately reflect the change without requiring a restart.
3. All navigation elements, instructions, and key interaction points should be accurately translated to the selected language.
4. The system should remember the selected language for future sessions unless the user chooses to change it.
5. Language selection should be easily accessible within the product settings or during initial setup.
6. The language list must be maintained and updated with any new target market languages added in the future.

text: The product shall allow for customization of start page and views preferences.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Freedom and Autonomy

Title: Customizable Start Page and View Preferences for Enhanced User Autonomy

Description: As a user, I want to customize the start page and view preferences so that I can have a personalized and efficient experience that respects my autonomy and freedom of choice.

Work:
- Allow users to select and save preferred layout options for the start page.
- Enable users to choose and modify themes, color schemes, and font sizes for their views.
- Provide options for users to add or remove widgets and components on the start page.
- Ensure that all changes made by the user are retained after logging out and logging back in.
- Implement easy-to-use interfaces that guide users through the customization process.
- Provide a reset option for users to return to default settings if desired.

text: An employee will be able to successfully use the product within a few minutes.  After informally navigating the product for less than 15 minutes  users shall be able to successfully setup meetings and reserve conference rooms.
ethical_us:
Title: Streamlined Onboarding for Conference Room Booking

Description: As an office employee, I want to easily navigate and use the product to set up meetings and reserve conference rooms within a few minutes, so that I can efficiently manage my tasks without unnecessary delays or complications.

Work:
- Ensure the user interface is intuitive and user-friendly, minimizing the need for extensive instructions or training.
- Design a guided tutorial or walkthrough for first-time users to quickly grasp the main functionalities.
- Implement clear and concise labels and instructions within the application.
- Test with a group of new users to ensure the feature can be understood and used effectively within 15 minutes.
- Iteratively improve the design based on user feedback to enhance understandability and ease of use.

The ethical principle most related to this requirement is Transparency. The focus here is on making the product understandable and easy to use, ensuring that users can navigate it with minimal effort and thus enhancing their experience through clear communication of how to use it.

text: The product shall use a standard navigation menu familiar to most web users.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensure Transparent and Understandable Navigation

Description: As a web user, I want to use a standard navigation menu familiar to most people so that I can easily find the information or services I need without confusion or frustration.

Work:
- Evaluate commonly used web navigation menus to identify standard elements and structures.
- Design the navigation menu based on these standard elements to ensure familiarity and ease of use.
- Conduct usability testing with a diverse group of users to confirm the navigation menu is intuitive and understandable.
- Implement a feedback mechanism to continuously gather user input on the navigation experience.
- Make iterative improvements to the navigation menu based on user feedback and testing results.

text: The product shall allow for intuitive searching of available conference rooms.
ethical_us:
Title: Intuitive Conference Room Search for Fair Access

Description: As an employee needing workspace, I want to search for available conference rooms intuitively so that I can ensure fair and equitable access to meeting spaces.

Work:
- Implement a search feature that can filter conference rooms based on availability, capacity, and equipment.
- Ensure the system displays search results in a user-friendly and easily understandable format.
- Conduct user testing to ensure the search feature is accessible to all employees, regardless of technical expertise.
- Provide tooltips or guides for users unfamiliar with using search functionalities.
- Implement feedback mechanisms for continual improvement of the searching experience.

text: The response shall be fast enough to avoid interrupting the user\92s flow of thought.  90% of tasks shall complete within 5 seconds.  98% of tasks shall complete within 8 seconds.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Trust

Title: Ensuring Prompt System Response to Build User Trust

Description: As a user, I want the system to respond promptly to my requests so that I can maintain my flow of thought and trust that the system is reliable and efficient.

Work:
- Ensure that 90% of tasks complete within 5 seconds.
- Guarantee that 98% of tasks complete within 8 seconds.
- Conduct performance testing under various conditions to verify response time criteria are met.
- Implement necessary optimizations to enhance system responsiveness.
- Provide feedback to users in case of any delay beyond specified response times to maintain transparency and trust.
- Continuously monitor system performance and update benchmarks as needed.

text: Aside from server failure  the software product shall achieve 99.99% up time.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Reliable System Availability

Description: As a system user, I want the software product to achieve 99.99% uptime so that I can rely on the system for continuous availability without disruptions due to internal failures.

Work:
- Implement robust failover mechanisms to switch to backup servers in case of primary server failure.
- Conduct regular system maintenance and performance testing to detect and resolve potential issues proactively.
- Monitor system performance continuously and alert administrators of any potential downtime risks.
- Establish a contingency plan to address unforeseen circumstances that could impact system uptime.
- Provide transparent communication to users about scheduled maintenance windows and any unexpected service interruptions.

text: The product shall create an exception log of problems encountered within the product for transmission to our company for analysis and resolution.
ethical_us:
**Title: Exception Log Transparency**

**Description:** As a *user*, I want the product to create an exception log of problems encountered for transmission to the company, so that I can ensure transparency in the resolution process and trust that issues are being addressed responsibly.

**Work:**
- An exception log is generated automatically whenever a problem is encountered within the product.
- Ensure that the log contains detailed information about the problem, without including personal user data.
- Implement a secure transmission method for the exception log to be sent to the company.
- Provide users with a summary of what information is being logged and transmitted.
- Allow users to access a clear explanation of how the logged data will be used to resolve issues.
- Ensure users can opt out of data transmission while maintaining full functionality and usability of the product.

text: The product shall be capable of handling up to 1 000 concurrent requests.  This number will increase to 2 000 by Release 2.  The concurrency capacity must be able to handle peak scheduling times such as early morning and late afternoon hours.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensure Fair and Reliable Access During Peak Demand

Description: As a user, I want the system to handle up to 1,000 concurrent requests during peak times, eventually increasing to 2,000 by Release 2, so that I can access the service reliably and without interruption, regardless of busy hours.

Work:
- Ensure the system infrastructure can support 1,000 concurrent connections at the initial release.
- Increase capacity to handle 2,000 concurrent requests for Release 2.
- Conduct stress and load testing to validate the system's performance at peak hours, such as early morning and late afternoon.
- Implement monitoring tools to track concurrent user spikes and system responses during peak times.
- Compile a report on system availability and performance metrics during peak periods.
- Ensure that scaling processes do not discriminate against any geographic or user group, maintaining justice and fairness for all users.

text: The product shall be able to process 10 000 transactions per hour within two years of its launch.  This number will increase to 20 000 by Release 2.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Trust

Title: Ensuring Trust through Scalable Transaction Processing

Description: As a customer, I want the product to handle up to 20,000 transactions per hour by Release 2 so that I can trust the system to manage high demand without failures and ensure that my transactions are processed reliably.

Work:
1. Measure and monitor system performance to ensure it can scale to 10,000 transactions per hour within two years of launch.
2. Develop a plan to increase transaction processing capacity to 20,000 transactions per hour by Release 2.
3. Implement rigorous testing procedures to validate scalability and reliability at each phase of the capacity increase.
4. Establish a transparent reporting mechanism to communicate system performance and improvements to customers.
5. Ensure secure handling of transactions to maintain data integrity and trust during the scaling process.

text: The product shall be expected to operate for at least 5 years for each customer installation.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Long-Term Reliability and Trust

Description: As a customer, I want the product to operate reliably for at least 5 years after installation so that I can trust its durability and effective performance over time without concerns of premature failure.

Work:
- Verify that all components are designed and tested for longevity and durability beyond the 5-year period.
- Implement regular maintenance and update protocols to uphold product functionality throughout its lifecycle.
- Conduct customer feedback sessions annually to assess product performance and address potential issues promptly.
- Provide a comprehensive warranty and support plan covering the entire period of expected operation.
- Document and communicate any changes or updates in product specifications that may affect its long-term operation.

text: The product shall be used in office environments.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Appropriateness of AI Product for Office Environment

Description: As a responsible office manager, I want to ensure that the AI product is suitable for use in office environments so that it aligns with workplace ethics and maintains a professional setting.

Work: 
- Conduct a comprehensive impact assessment of the AI product to determine its suitability for office use.
- Verify that the AI product complies with workplace policies and ethical guidelines.
- Ensure that the AI system's outputs are professional and appropriate for an office setting.
- Implement a feedback mechanism for users to report any inappropriate use of the AI product in the office.
- Provide training for office staff on the ethical use of the AI product.

text: The product must be able to interface with any HTML browser.  The product shall transmit data between the user and the product without problems. The product shall display HTML properly in 80% of all HTML browsers tested (minimum is to test 8 browsers).
ethical_us:
Title: Universal Accessibility and Data Integrity in HTML Browsers

Description: As a web user, I want the product to interface and function seamlessly with any HTML browser so that I can access content reliably and without discrimination, ensuring fairness irrespective of my browser choice.

Work:
- Test the product's HTML display functionality on at least 8 different HTML browsers, including both popular and niche options, to ensure a wide coverage.
- Ensure that the product accurately transmits data between the user and the platform without any interruptions or loss.
- Validate that HTML is displayed correctly in at least 80% of the tested browsers, identifying and fixing any rendering issues in the remaining browsers.
- Document any compatibility issues and propose solutions or workarounds to ensure fair user experience across different browsers. 

This transformation aligns most with the ethical principle of Justice and Fairness, as it ensures that users, regardless of the browser they use, experience the product equally, without disadvantage or discrimination.

text: The product must be able to interface with various database management systems. The product shall communicate successfully with the database management system on 100% of all transactions.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensure Reliable and Transparent Database Interactions

Description: As a software engineer, I want the product to interface transparently and reliably with various database management systems so that stakeholders can trust that all transactions are correctly and consistently processed.

Work: 
- Implement a standardized communication protocol for integration with multiple database management systems.
- Conduct extensive testing to ensure the product communicates successfully with the database management system in 100% of all transactions.
- Develop automated monitoring tools to detect and report any communication failures or discrepancies.
- Document the integration process and interactions for clarity and transparency, making it easily accessible to all relevant stakeholders.

text: The product must be able to interface with various email servers. The product shall be able to send email.
ethical_us:
Title: Seamless Email Integration for Enhanced Communication

Description: As a system administrator, I want the product to interface with various email servers and send emails effectively so that communication remains streamlined and efficient across different platforms without compromising system integrity or user trust.

Work:
- Ensure compatibility with major email server protocols (e.g., SMTP, IMAP, and POP3).
- Implement a secure authentication process for email server connections.
- Validate successful email sending and delivery status.
- Provide clear documentation on configuring the product with different email servers.
- Conduct security assessments to prevent unauthorized access or data breaches.
- Facilitate test scenarios to verify robust email handling and logging for troubleshooting.

text: The product shall be available for distribution via the Internet as a binary or ZIP file.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Accessibility and Freedom and Autonomy

Title: Ensuring User Accessibility and Freedom of Choice

Description: As a user, I want to have the option to download the product via the Internet as a binary or ZIP file so that I can freely choose the most suitable format for my needs, ensuring I can access the product easily from different platforms and storage capacities.

Work: 
- The product should be available in binary format for direct installation on compatible systems.
- Provide a ZIP file option for users who prefer or require the software in a compressed format for offline or delayed installation.
- Ensure download links for both formats are clearly provided and easily accessible from the main distribution page.
- Include detailed installation and extraction instructions for each file format to aid users in installation regardless of technical expertise.
- Verify the integrity and security of both the binary and ZIP files to prevent malware and ensure user safety.
- Conduct user testing to ensure the download process is user-friendly and accessible on various Internet speeds and devices.

text: The product shall be available for distribution as a packaged CD.
ethical_us:
### Title: Ensuring Product Availability and Accessibility

### Description: 
As a consumer, I want to access the product as a packaged CD so that I can utilize the software without relying on continuous internet connectivity or digital download methods.

### Work:
- The product shall be packaged as a CD version, complete with all necessary software and documentation.
- Ensure that the CD packaging complies with environmental sustainability standards.
- Conduct quality assurance testing to ensure the CD functions correctly when used across different compatible devices.
- Provide clear instructions and support information within the CD package to help users install and access the product.
- Ensure availability of the CD in diverse geographic locations to enhance accessibility. 

This user story reflects the ethical principle of **Freedom and autonomy**, as it provides users with the autonomous choice to use the product without the dependencies associated with online access, ensuring their freedom to access the software according to their personal needs and circumstances.

text: The product will be available for licensing as a one-server  two-five servers  or five-or-more servers license.
ethical_us:
**Title: Flexible Licensing Options for Diverse Business Needs**

**Description:** As a business customer, I want to have flexible licensing options based on the number of servers in use so that my company can select the most cost-effective and suitable plan for our operations without incurring unnecessary costs.

**Work:**
- Evaluate and identify the various business customer segments based on their server needs.
- Develop three distinct licensing options: one-server, two-to-five servers, and five-or-more servers.
- Ensure that licensing terms are clearly documented and easily accessible to potential customers.
- Implement an intuitive purchasing interface that guides customers in selecting the appropriate licensing tier.
- Communicate the benefits and limitations of each licensing option to provide transparency and assist customers in making informed decisions.

**Related Ethical Principle: Justice and Fairness**  
The requirement aligns with the principle of justice and fairness by ensuring that businesses are not overcharged and can select a licensing option that best fits their needs, thus promoting equitable access to technology resources.

text: A new user must be able to be added to the system within 10 minutes. 90% of new users are able to log into the system within 10 minutes.
ethical_us:
Title: Quick Access to System for New Users

Description: As a new user, I want to be able to be added to the system and log in within 10 minutes so that I can begin using the system promptly and without unnecessary delays.

Work:
- Verify that the registration process for new users takes no more than 10 minutes.
- Ensure the system sends a confirmation email within 5 minutes of registration.
- Test user login functionality to confirm it works successfully within 10 minutes of registration for 90% of users.
- Review and update documentation to guide users through the process swiftly.
- Conduct user testing to gather feedback on the efficiency of the registration and login process. 

Related Ethical Principle: Trust
- This user story emphasizes promptness and reliability, which are key to building trust with users by ensuring they can access the system efficiently and without issues.

text: The product must be designed using Design Patterns and coding best practices.  90% of maintenance software developers are able to integrate new functionality into the product with 2 working days.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Trust

Title: Ensuring Trust through Efficient and Reliable Code Integration

Description: As a software maintenance developer, I want to integrate new functionality into the product efficiently and reliably so that I can maintain user trust in the system's stability and performance.

Work:
- Verify that the product design utilizes established Design Patterns.
- Ensure all code follows current coding best practices.
- Conduct thorough code reviews to maintain consistency and quality.
- Provide documentation and guidelines for integrating new functionality.
- Perform test integrations within the specified 2-working-day timeframe.
- Gather feedback from a diverse group of developers to ensure the solution works effectively for different experiences and capabilities.

text: The product must be highly configurable for use with various database management systems for the end users.  80% of end users are able to integrate new database management systems with the product without changing the product\92s software code.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Freedom and autonomy

Title: Configurable Integration for Diverse Database Systems

Description: As an IT administrator, I want to integrate new database management systems with the product without altering its software code so that I can maintain flexibility and autonomy over the data management tools I choose to use.

Work:
- Ensure the product supports seamless configuration with at least 80% of popular database management systems.
- Develop a user-friendly interface for database integration settings without the need to modify existing code.
- Provide comprehensive documentation and support for configuring new databases.
- Conduct usability testing with a diverse group of end-users to confirm ease of integration.
- Implement feedback mechanisms for continuous improvement of the integration process.

text: Maintenance releases will be offered to customers once a year.  The releases shall take no longer than 5 minutes for 80% of the customer base to install.
ethical_us:
**Title:** Efficient and Timely Maintenance Release

**Description:** As a responsible developer, I want to offer maintenance releases to customers once a year with minimal installation time so that customer operations remain uninterrupted and their trust in our service is maintained.

**Work:**

1. Ensure that all maintenance releases are tested thoroughly for compatibility with different systems prior to deployment.
