2. The system should implement algorithms that ensure an equitable distribution of leads among admissions representatives.
3. Regular audits of lead distribution records should be conducted to identify and mitigate any potential bias.
4. Admissions representatives should be notified about how and why a lead was assigned to them to maintain transparency.
5. A feedback mechanism should be in place for admissions representatives to flag any perceived unfairness in lead distributions.

text: The leads washing functionality shall receive a period list of available reps from the enterprise system.
ethical_us:
**Title: Transparent Integration of Leads Washing Functionality**

**Description:** As an enterprise system administrator, I want the leads washing functionality to transparently receive a periodic list of available representatives from the enterprise system so that the process can be monitored effectively, ensuring all stakeholders understand how data flows between systems.

**Work:**
- The system must log every instance of data exchange, including timestamps and data volume.
- The data received by the leads washing functionality should be clearly documented and accessible to relevant stakeholders.
- Notifications should be sent to concerned parties whenever the list is updated.
- Detailed documentation on how the leads data is utilized in lead washing must be provided.
- Ensure the enterprise system's privacy policies are adhered to during the data integration process.

text: The product shall simulate the look of ships at sea.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensure Visual Accuracy of Ship Simulations

Description: As a naval strategist, I want to simulate the look of ships at sea so that the representations are accurate and do not create misunderstandings or misinformation.

Work: 
- Acceptance Criteria:
  1. Verify that the simulation visually represents ships at sea with high fidelity, maintaining accuracy in color, size, and scale.
  2. Ensure that the simulation includes realistic environmental conditions such as weather changes and sea states.
  3. Provide clear documentation on how the simulation achieves its visual representation, ensuring transparency in the design process.
  4. Conduct user testing with naval experts to validate that the visual simulations are true to life and practical for strategic evaluations.

text: The product shall display the grids within a circle as a view from a periscope.
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent Visualization of Grid Display

Description: As a user interacting with the product, I want the grids to be displayed clearly within a circle as a view from a periscope so that I can understand and engage with the visual data effectively and transparently.

Work: 
- Ensure the grid display within the periscope view is clear and unambiguous.
- Provide an explanation or legend for the grid display to aid user understanding.
- Implement user feedback mechanisms to continually improve the clarity of the visualization.
- Test the grid display for clarity and understandability across different devices and screen sizes. 
- Document the design rationale and functionality of the grid display for user transparency.

text: The product shall display each type of ship in a grid using an image of the specific type of ship.
ethical_us:
Title: Clear and Understandable Visualization of Ship Types

Description: As a user interested in naval transportation, I want the product to display each type of ship in a grid using an image of the specific type of ship so that I can easily and accurately identify and differentiate between various ship types.

Work:
- Display a grid layout on the user interface to show images of each ship type.
- Ensure that each grid item includes a clear, high-quality image of the specific type of ship it represents.
- Include a descriptive label or tag beneath each image for further clarification.
- Provide an easy-to-navigate interface so users can explore different ship types efficiently.
- Include an option to view additional details or specifications of each ship type if the user desires further information.

text: When the offensive player takes a shot  the product shall simulate the sound of a ship at sea.
ethical_us:
Title: Seamless User Experience through Authentic Sound Effects

Description: As a game designer, I want to simulate the sound of a ship at sea when the offensive player takes a shot so that players experience an immersive and engaging gameplay environment.

Work:

1. Ensure the sound effect is authentic and does not include offensive or harmful audio content.
2. Implement the sound effect seamlessly in the game code to play at the appropriate action (i.e., when the player takes a shot).
3. Test the sound effect across different devices to ensure consistent audio quality and volume.
4. Gather and incorporate user feedback regarding the sound's addition, making adjustments if it detracts from the game's enjoyment or accessibility.

text: When a shot is marked as a miss  the product shall simulate the sound of a shot missing its target.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Ethical Sound Design in Gaming Experience

**Description**: As a game developer, I want to simulate the sound of a shot missing its target so that players receive accurate feedback without promoting harm or glorifying violence.

**Work**: 
- Acceptance Criteria:
  1. Identify and select appropriate sound effects that indicate a shot has missed without being alarming or promoting violence.
  2. Ensure sound design adheres to non-maleficence by not causing distress or unnecessary excitement related to violence.
  3. Implement the selected sound effects in the game to trigger accurately when a shot is marked as a miss.
  4. Test the audio feedback with players to ensure it enhances their gaming experience without promoting harmful behavior.
  5. Review the sound implementation regularly with updates to ensure alignment with ethical sound design principles.

text: When a shot is marked as a hit  the product shall simulate the sound of a shot hitting its target.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Non-Maleficence in Sound Simulation for Hits

Description: As a responsible developer, I want to simulate the sound of a shot hitting its target with consideration for non-maleficence so that the simulation does not cause distress or harm to users or unintended consequences in various contexts.

Work:
- Conduct research to identify any potential harm or distress that may arise from the simulated sound, such as triggering PTSD or causing panic.
- Implement a sound design that respects the principle of non-maleficence, avoiding realistic or distressing audio cues.
- Provide users with an option to disable or modify the sound to suit their emotional comfort.
- Test the sound simulation across diverse user groups to ensure it is universally non-harmful.
- Document the design choices made to adhere to non-maleficence and gather feedback for continuous improvement.

text: When a ship is sunk  the product shall simulate the sound of a sinking ship.
ethical_us:
Title: Ethical Simulation of Ship Sinking Sounds

Description: As a game developer, I want to simulate the sound of a sinking ship in a realistic yet non-traumatic way, so that players can experience an immersive game environment without being exposed to distressing or harmful content.

Work: 
- Acceptance Criteria:
  1. The simulated sound of a sinking ship should be realistic but not overly alarming or distressing, ensuring it maintains a balance between immersion and non-maleficence.
  2. Sound levels should be adjustable according to user preference to accommodate different sensitivities.
  3. Alternative sound options should be provided for players who may find sinking ship sounds triggering or uncomfortable.
  4. The game should include a content advisory before moments where dramatic or potentially distressing sounds occur, allowing players to prepare or opt-out if desired.
  5. Feedback from players regarding the sound experience should be collected and analyzed to ensure it aligns with the ethical principle of non-maleficence, making adjustments as necessary.

text: The product shall be available 24 hours per day  seven days per week.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Constant System Availability

Description: As a user, I want the product to be available 24 hours per day, seven days per week, so that I can access its features and services whenever I need them, ensuring reliability and building trust.

Work: 
- The system must maintain a 99.9% uptime, with monitoring and alerts in place to identify and fix issues promptly.
- Implement redundant systems and failover mechanisms to ensure continuous service availability.
- Conduct regular maintenance during off-peak hours with advance notice to users.
- Run periodic load testing to ensure the system can handle high volumes of traffic.
- Establish a transparent communication channel for users to be informed of any potential downtime or system issues.

text: The product shall able to handle a large number of games simultaneously.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring System Reliability for High Volume Gaming

Description: As a game network administrator, I want the product to handle a large number of games simultaneously so that players experience a stable and uninterrupted gaming environment.

Work: 
- Ensure the system architecture can support simultaneous game sessions without performance degradation.
- Conduct stress testing to validate the system's capacity to handle peak loads.
- Implement load balancing mechanisms to distribute gaming workloads effectively.
- Monitor system performance in real-time to quickly address any arising issues.
- Ensure seamless scalability to accommodate future increases in simultaneous game sessions. 

Related Ethical Principle: Trust

The requirement is closely related to the ethical principle of Trust. Ensuring the product can handle a large number of games simultaneously builds trust with users by guaranteeing a reliable and robust gaming infrastructure. When users have confidence the system will perform consistently without failure, they are more likely to trust the system and continue using it.

text: The response time shall be fast enough to maintain the flow of the game.  The response time shall be no more than 2 seconds for 95% of responses and no more than 4% for the remaining responses.
ethical_us:
Title: Timely Game Response for Seamless Player Interaction

Description: As a gamer, I want the game's response time to be fast enough to maintain the flow of the game so that I can have an uninterrupted and enjoyable gaming experience without unnecessary delays.

Work:
- Ensure that 95% of game responses occur in under 2 seconds.
- Verify that no more than 4% of game responses exceed 4 seconds.
- Conduct multiple rounds of performance testing to assess average and maximum response times.
- Optimize server and network infrastructure to support fast response times.
- Collect player feedback after performance improvements to ensure satisfaction.
- Implement monitoring tools to track response times in real-time during gameplay.

text: The product shall be intuitive and self-explanatory.  Nine out ten users shall be able to successfully complete a game with no training.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensure Intuitiveness and Understandability

Description: As a casual gamer, I want to navigate and play the game without needing a tutorial or external guidance, so that I can enjoy the gaming experience immediately and without frustration.

Work:
- Conduct usability testing with a diverse group of users to ensure intuitive navigation.
- Design a simple and clear user interface that guides users seamlessly through the game.
- Implement feedback mechanisms to identify areas where users face difficulties.
- Ensure that all game elements and instructions are easily understandable.
- Achieve a 90% success rate of users completing a game on their first attempt without training.
- Regularly update the interface based on user feedback to maintain high levels of intuitiveness.

Ethical Principle: Transparency

This requirement aligns with the ethical principle of transparency, as it focuses on making the game understandable and navigable without hidden complexities, enhancing the overall user experience.

text: The product shall provide players no access to information that might reveal the identity of another player
ethical_us:
**Title: Protecting Player Anonymity**

**Description:** As a game player, I want to ensure that my identity and personal information remain private and undisclosed to other players so that I can enjoy the game without concerns about privacy risks or unwanted exposure.

**Work:**

- Implement an in-game system that anonymizes player identifiers, such as usernames or character names, during interactions.
- Design and incorporate layers of data encryption to protect personal information stored within the game servers.
- Establish access controls to restrict player information visibility exclusively to authorized personnel and functions.
- Develop a user agreement and privacy policy detailing how player data is handled, stored, and shared, and make it readily accessible to players.
- Conduct regular security audits and updates to ensure that data protection mechanisms remain effective and compliant with privacy regulations.

text: The response time shall be fast enough to maintain the flow of the game. The response time shall be no more than 2 seconds for 95% of responses and no more than 4% for the remaining responses.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Fast Response Time for Interactive Gaming Experience

Description: As a gamer, I want the game response time to be fast enough to maintain my flow and engagement, so that my gaming experience remains enjoyable and uninterrupted.

Work: 
- Ensure that the game server's processing time is optimized to handle requests within designated limits.
- Implement efficient data handling mechanisms to minimize delay in game responses.
- Conduct regular performance testing to verify that 95% of game responses are within 2 seconds, and the remaining 5% are within 4 seconds.
- Monitor server health continuously to identify and resolve potential bottlenecks.
- Gather user feedback to ensure that the perceived responsiveness meets player expectations.
- Maintain documentation of system performance benchmarks and optimization strategies employed.

The most relevant ethical principle for this requirement is Trust. Ensuring fast response times is critical to maintaining user trust as it ensures the system performs efficiently and meets user expectations.

text: The product shall maintain a list of players.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Privacy

Title: Ensure Privacy of Player Information

Description: As a game administrator, I want to manage and maintain a list of players so that their personal data is handled securely and confidentially, ensuring their privacy is protected.

Work:
- Acceptance Criteria:
  - The system shall allow storage of player data with encryption to protect privacy.
  - Access to the player list shall be restricted to authorized personnel only.
  - The system shall include a method for players to review and request corrections to their stored data.
  - Logs of data access and modification shall be maintained to ensure traceability.
  - There shall be a mechanism to delete player data upon request, in compliance with relevant data protection laws.
  - Players shall be informed about what data is being collected, how it is used, and their rights regarding their data.

text: The product shall allow a user to identify himself or herself as a player.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensure User Autonomy in Player Identification

Description: As a player, I want to identify myself within the product so that I can ensure my personal identity and preferences are recognized and respected.

Work:
- Implement a secure login system that allows users to register their identity as a player.
- Provide clear options for users to update or change their identity information as needed.
- Ensure that the system respects user autonomy by allowing users to manage their identity data.
- Incorporate mechanisms that give users control over how their identity is displayed within the platform.
- Clearly communicate how user identity information is used and protected by the system.

text: Once a game has been initiated  the product shall make the players assigned to the game unavailable for selection from the list of players.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Fair Play in Game Management

Description: As a game organizer, I want to make players assigned to a game unavailable for selection from the list of players so that the integrity and fairness of the game process are maintained, preventing duplicate selections and enhancing trust among participants.

Work:
- Acceptance criteria:
  1. Once a game has been initiated, automatically mark all players in that game as unavailable for selection in the player list.
  2. Verify that marked players are unable to be selected for any other simultaneous games.
  3. Ensure that players' unavailability status is visible and communicated clearly to all relevant users of the system.
  4. Test and confirm that the functionality works correctly across different game scenarios and user interactions.
  5. Provide an option for organizers to manually override in exceptional cases, with appropriate logging of changes for accountability.

text: The product shall allow a user to remove himself or herself from the list of players at any time.
ethical_us:
Title: Allow Users to Opt-Out Freely

Description: As a player, I want to remove myself from the list of players at any time so that I can maintain my freedom and autonomy over my participation.

Work: 
- Ensure a clear and easily accessible option is available for users to remove themselves from the player list.
- Verify that the opt-out process requires minimal steps and is free of unnecessary barriers.
- Confirm that users receive a notification confirming their removal from the player list.
- Test that the system promptly updates to reflect changes when a player opts out.
- Document the opt-out feature to ensure transparency and understanding of the process for all users.

text: The product shall make inactive players unavailable for selection from the list of players.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensure Fairness and Transparency in Player Selection

Description: As a team manager, I want inactive players to be unavailable for selection in the player list so that team selection is fair and transparent to all stakeholders.

Work:
- Implement a system to automatically detect and update the status of inactive players.
- Ensure inactive players are effectively excluded from the available selection list.
- Create a clear communication process that informs the team manager of changes in player availability.
- Provide a user interface notification to highlight why a player is marked as inactive.
- Test the functionality to confirm inactive players are consistently and accurately made unavailable.

text: The product shall remove players who have been inactive for 24 hours from the list of players.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Fair Play by Managing Inactivity

Description: As a community-focused game developer, I want to remove players who have been inactive for 24 hours from the list of players so that active participants experience a fair and engaging gaming environment.

Work:
- Verify player inactivity based on accurate time-tracking mechanisms.
- Develop and implement a feature that automatically removes inactive players after 24 hours of inactivity.
- Notify players about inactivity removal policies through clear communication within the platform.
- Test the feature to ensure it functions correctly without mistakenly removing active players.
- Establish a mechanism to allow removed players to rejoin the game seamlessly once they become active again.

text: The product shall allow a player to initiate a game by selecting another available player from the list of players.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Freedom and autonomy

Title: Player Autonomy in Game Initiation

Description: As a player, I want to initiate a game by selecting another available player from the list of players so that I have the autonomy to choose my gaming partners and enjoy a personalized gaming experience.

Work: 
- Ensure that the list of available players is displayed to every player.
- Enable players to send game invitations to other players on the list.
- Implement a system where the invited player can accept or decline the game invitation.
- Validate that the player has full control to cancel the game initiation process at any point before the game starts.
- Provide feedback to the player about the status of the invitation (sent, accepted, declined).

text: Once a game is initiated  the product shall display a defensive grid to each player
ethical_us:
**Principle: Transparency**

**Title:** Display Defensive Grid Transparently for Fair Gameplay

**Description:** As a player, I want the game to display a defensive grid to each player once a game is initiated so that all players understand their current defensive position and can strategize effectively, ensuring an equal and transparent playing field.

**Work:**

- The game should automatically display the defensive grid immediately upon game initiation for each player.
- The grid must be clear and easy to understand, with legends and labels where necessary.
- Players should receive a brief, one-time tutorial or explanation of the grid display when they first encounter it.
- Ensure that the grid visibility is identical and simultaneous for all players to maintain fairness.
- Game settings must allow players to revisit grid-related information and controls to reinforce understanding.
- Conduct user testing to ascertain the understandability and intuitiveness of the defensive grid display for players.

text: Once a game is initiated  the product shall display an offensive grid to each player.
ethical_us:
**Title:** Fair Game Setup for All Players  

**Description:** As a player, I want the game to display an offensive grid to each player once a game is initiated so that everyone has an equal opportunity to strategize and play fairly.

**Work:**  
- Ensure the offensive grid is identically configured for each player to maintain fairness.  
- Verify that the grid display is clear and easily understandable for all players.  
- Confirm that the grid loads simultaneously for all players at the start of the game.  
- Check that there are no biases or unfair advantages coded into the grid presentation.

text: The product shall prevent a player from viewing the offensive or defensive grids of the other player.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensure Fair Play Through Visibility Controls

Description: As a player, I want to prevent visibility of my opponent's offensive or defensive grids so that the game remains fair and free from any unfair advantage.

Work:
- Implement a system to restrict each player's view to only their own grids.
- Test the visibility controls to ensure no glitches allow players to view their opponent's grids.
- Provide clear communication to players about how visibility and privacy in the game are maintained.
- Conduct regular audits to ensure compliance with visibility restrictions.
- Gather player feedback to identify any potential loopholes or issues around grid visibility. 

The requirement aligns with the ethical principle of Justice and Fairness. This principle relates to ensuring the game is free from any form of unfairness and inequality, making the system just for all players by preventing unfair advantages through unauthorized access.

text: Once a game is initiated  the product shall allow each player to position their 5 ships on their respective defensive grids.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Fair Gameplay through Equal Setup Opportunities

Description: As a player, I want to fairly position my 5 ships on my defensive grid during game initiation so that I can engage in the game with an equal chance of success.

Work:
- The system must allow each player to access their defensive grid before the game officially starts.
- The system must provide clear instructions and a user-friendly interface for positioning ships.
- Ships must fit within the grid boundaries without overlap, ensuring fairness for all players.
- Confirmation of ship placement must be received from each player before the game proceeds.
- Any issues or errors in placement must be communicated to the player in an understandable manner.
- Ensure that the setup phase is the same for each player, without bias or advantage.

text: The product shall allow a player to position ships horizontally on their grid.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Freedom and autonomy

Title: Horizontal Ship Positioning for Player Autonomy

Description: As a player, I want to position ships horizontally on my grid so that I can exercise my strategic autonomy and enjoy the gameplay according to my preferences.

Work:
- Acceptance Criteria:
  - The game interface supports horizontal ship placement on the player's grid.
  - Players can select ships and choose their horizontal position with ease.
  - The placement mechanism provides clear feedback when a ship is positioned successfully.
  - The system prevents ships from being placed outside the grid boundaries.
  - Ensure the feature works seamlessly across all supported devices and platforms.

text: The product shall allow the player to position ships vertically on their grid.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Freedom and Autonomy

Title: Enable Freedom of Ship Placement in Battleship Game

Description: As a player, I want to be able to position my ships vertically on the grid so that I have the freedom to strategize and play the game according to my personal preferences.

Work: 
- Ensure the game interface allows ships to be rotated and placed vertically.
- Validate that the vertical placement of ships respects the game's grid boundaries.
- Allow players to modify the position and orientation of ships before starting the game.
- Test functionality to ensure consistent user experience across different devices and platforms.
- Confirm through user feedback that the vertical placement feature enhances game enjoyment and strategy flexibility.

text: The product shall allow the player to position ships diagonally on their grid
ethical_us:
Title: Fair and Equitable Gameplay Experience

Description: As a player, I want to position my ships diagonally on my grid so that I can enjoy a more strategic and engaging gameplay experience, ensuring fairness and equity for all players.

Work: 
- Ensure the game interface allows players to position ships diagonally without technical issues.
- Validate that diagonal ship placement rules are clear and apply to all players equally.
- Test the game with various ship layouts to confirm that diagonal positioning does not provide an unfair advantage.
- Update game instructions to include guidance on diagonal ship placement.
- Collect player feedback to ensure that the ability to place ships diagonally is perceived as a fair enhancement to the game.

text: The product shall prevent the player from overlapping ships on their grid.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Fair Gameplay through Ship Placement Restrictions

Description: As a game player, I want to ensure fair gameplay by not being able to overlap ships on the grid, so that every player has a fair and equal opportunity to strategize and play without unintended advantages or errors.

Work: 
- Develop a mechanism in the game engine to detect overlapping ship placements.
- Implement visual feedback when a player attempts to place a ship on an already occupied grid space.
- Ensure the mechanism prompts the player to reposition the overlapping ship.
- Conduct testing to confirm that ship overlap prevention functions correctly across various scenarios and game states.
- Include documentation explaining the overlap prevention feature to enhance transparency for players.

text: When both players have positioned their 5 ships on their defensive grids  the product shall define the status of each player for the first turn.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Fair Gameplay Initialization

Description: As a game developer, I want to implement a fair and unbiased method to determine the status of each player for the first turn after both have positioned their ships, so that every game of battleship starts on an even playing field, free from any form of unfairness or advantage.

Work:
1. Verify that the system can accurately detect when both players have positioned all 5 ships on their defensive grids.
2. Implement a randomization algorithm to decide the first turn while ensuring the process is transparent and unbiased.
3. Ensure that there are no external factors influencing the determination of the player's status.
4. Conduct testing to confirm that the first turn determination process is consistently fair and just.
5. Provide clear documentation explaining how the first turn status is decided to both players.

text: For each turn  the product shall identify one player as offensive status and one player as defensive status.
ethical_us:
Based on the given requirement, the most relevant ethical principle is Justice and fairness. This principle is pertinent because it ensures that the system fairly identifies and assigns roles without discrimination or bias towards any player.

Title: Fair and Equitable Status Assignment in Gameplay

Description: As a game developer, I want to ensure one player is identified as having offensive status and another as having defensive status fairly and consistently so that the gameplay remains balanced, competitive, and free from bias.

Work:
- Ensure the algorithm used for assigning offensive and defensive status is tested for bias and fairness.
- Implement a logging system to record each status assignment for transparency and auditing purposes.
- Develop a method for players to provide feedback on the fairness of status assignments.
- Regularly review player feedback and status assignment logs to identify and address any emerging biases.
- Provide an accessible explanation of how status assignments are determined to players to promote transparency.

text: The product shall maintain the status of each player for a turn  either offensive or defensive.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Fair Gameplay Representation

Description: As a game player, I want the product to accurately maintain and display each player's status (either offensive or defensive) for a turn, so that the game proceeds with justice and fairness, ensuring no player gains an undeserved advantage or experiences unintentional bias.

Work:
- Verify that the system correctly identifies and updates a player's status to offensive or defensive at the start of each turn.
- Ensure that the status of each player is transparently displayed to all players involved in the game.
- Test various scenarios to make sure the status does not change erroneously during a turn.
- Ensure the status update process is clearly documented and understandable for both developers and players.
- Implement logging for status changes to allow for traceability and accountability in case of disputes.

text: At the start of each turn  the product shall notify each player of his or her status.
ethical_us:
**Ethical Principle: Transparency**

**Title: Ensure Player Status Transparency**

**Description:** As a player, I want to be notified of my status at the start of each turn so that I can understand my current position in the game clearly and make informed decisions.

**Work:**
- The system must send a clear notification to the player at the start of each turn indicating their current status.
- The notification should include details like the player’s score, position, and any relevant game-specific conditions.
- Players must have an option to access a detailed explanation of what their status means in the context of the game.
- The notification must be easily accessible and visible to prevent any misunderstandings.
- Ensure that the notification is consistent across different devices and platforms.

text: For each turn  the product shall allow the offensive player to define a shot.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Freedom and Autonomy

Title: Empowering Offensive Player's Strategy Through Shot Definition

Description: As an offensive player, I want to define my shot within the game so that I can execute my strategies freely and maintain my autonomy in decision making.

Work:
- The system must allow the offensive player to choose the type of shot they wish to make.
- Players should be provided with an intuitive interface to select shot power and direction.
- Implement clear feedback to ensure players understand the outcome of their selected shot.
- Ensure that the shot definition feature does not impose unnecessary constraints that hinder player autonomy.
- Validate that the shot definition settings can be easily adjusted or canceled as per the player's strategy needs.

text: For each shot  the product shall examine the defensive grid of the defensive player to determine whether the shot was a hit or miss.
ethical_us:
**Title: Ensure Fair Evaluation of Shot Outcomes**

**Description:** As a *game player*, I want the game to fairly and accurately evaluate each shot on the defensive grid as a hit or miss so that the gameplay is based on justice and fairness, ensuring no player is unfairly advantaged or disadvantaged.

**Work:**
1. The system must assess each shot against the precise coordinates of the defensive grid.
2. Ensure the system algorithms are free from biases that might result in unfair shot evaluations.
3. Validate that the shot outcome determination is consistently accurate across different game sessions.
4. Provide a clear explanation or notification of each shot's result (hit or miss) to all players involved.
5. Conduct regular audits of the shot evaluation process to ensure ongoing fairness and accuracy.

text: For each shot  the product shall notify the players whether the shot was a hit or miss.
ethical_us:
**Title:** Notification Transparency for Game Shots  

**Description:** As a player, I want to be notified whether my shot was a hit or miss so that I can understand my performance and strategize effectively.  

**Work:**  
- Ensure the system provides immediate feedback for each shot taken, indicating a hit or miss.
- Develop a clear and intuitive interface that displays the hit/miss notification.
- Include an option for audio or visual cues that players can customize for hit/miss detection.
- Test the notification system to ensure reliability and consistency in different game scenarios.
- Document the notification process and include it in the player manual for transparency.  

The ethical principle most related to this requirement is **Transparency**. This principle aligns with providing clear and understandable feedback to the players, ensuring they are informed of their actions' outcomes within the game.

text: For each shot  the product shall mark the shot as a hit or miss on the defensive grid of the defensive player.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Transparency

Title: Accurate Shot Feedback on Defensive Grid

Description: As a player of the game, I want the system to transparently mark each shot as a hit or miss on the defensive grid so that I can clearly understand the outcome of each action and make informed decisions for my next moves.

Work: 
- Ensure the system provides real-time feedback on the defensive grid for each shot, clearly indicating hits and misses.
- Implement a clear visual distinction on the grid between hits and misses to enhance player understanding.
- Include a detailed explanation of how the system determines hits and misses, accessible to the player.
- Test the system to verify that the feedback provided is accurate and reflective of each shot made.
- Collect player feedback on the transparency and clarity of the shot feedback system to make iterative improvements.

text: For each shot  the product shall mark the shot as a hit or miss on the offensive grid of the offensive player.
ethical_us:
**Title: Ensuring Fairness and Accuracy in Game Feedback**

**Description:** As a player, I want to receive accurate feedback on whether my shots are hits or misses on my offensive grid, so that I can trust the game's fairness and make informed decisions in future moves.

**Work:** 
- Verify that the system accurately detects and records the coordinates of each shot.
- Ensure the visual indication on the offensive grid matches the actual outcome (hit or miss).
- Implement a notification system that provides immediate feedback to the player after each shot.
- Validate the algorithm's accuracy through testing in various scenarios (e.g., edge cases, multiple hits in a row).
- Conduct user testing to ensure players perceive the system as fair and transparent in its judgments.

text: When the hit results in sinking a ship  the product shall notify the players that the ship was sunk.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Transparency in Game Notifications

Description: As a player, I want to be clearly notified when my hit results in sinking a ship so that I can understand the outcome of my action in the game and make informed decisions moving forward.

Work: 
- The system shall provide a clear and immediate notification to all players when a ship is sunk.
- The notification should include which ship was sunk and the player's action that led to it.
- Ensure that the notification format is consistent and visible on all gaming platforms.
- Conduct user testing to confirm that players understand the notification and its implications.

text: When the hit results in sinking a ship  the product shall mark the ship as sunk on the defensive grid of the defensive player.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Fair Play in Defensive Strategy

Description: As a game player, I want the system to accurately mark my ships as sunk on the defensive grid when hit, so that the game remains fair and transparent for both players.

Work:
- Verify the system accurately registers a ship as sunk once all its positions are hit.
- Ensure the defensive grid updates automatically to reflect a sunk ship.
- Confirm the update is visible to the defensive player in real-time.
- Implement a notification to inform the defensive player of the ship status change.
- Conduct tests to ensure no discrepancies appear in ship status between players' views.

text: When the hit results in sinking a ship  the product shall indicate the type of ship sunk on the defensive grid of the defensive player.
ethical_us:
Title: Transparency in Game Feedback

Description: As a player, I want to know the type of ship that was sunk on my defensive grid so that I can have a clear understanding of the game status and make informed decisions.

Work:
- The system must accurately identify and display the type of ship that has been sunk on the defensive grid.
- Ensure the displayed ship type matches the sunk ship in both physical representation and naming.
- Implement a visual indicator to differentiate between sunk and unsunk ships on the grid.
- Ensure that the game rules and feedback are communicated clearly and are easily accessible to all players.
- Test the feature across different devices and screen sizes to confirm consistent and clear visibility.

text: When the hit results in sinking a ship  the product shall mark the ship as sunk on the offensive grid of the offensive player.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Transparency

Title: Transparency in Game Status Updates for Offensive Players

Description: As an offensive player, I want to have the game clearly indicate when I have successfully sunk an opponent's ship so that I can have a transparent view of my progress in the game.

Work:
- Ensure that all sunk ships are visually marked distinctively on the offensive player's grid.
- Provide a notification or message confirming the ship has been sunk.
- Update the offensive grid interface immediately after a sinking event to maintain real-time transparency.
- Test the feature to ensure accurate and consistent updates across different scenarios and game sessions.

text: If the shot was marked as a hit  the product shall allow the offensive player to define a shot.
ethical_us:
Based on the requirement provided, the most relevant ethical principle would be Responsibility. This principle emphasizes the responsibility of developers and stakeholders to ensure the system functions correctly and allows appropriate actions to be taken within the application.

Title: Responsible Shot Definition for Offensive Players

Description: As a game developer, I want to allow the offensive player to define a shot when it is marked as a hit so that the gameplay is fair, transparent, and provides opportunities for strategic decision-making.

Work:
- Ensure the system accurately identifies when a shot is marked as a hit.
- Provide clear guidance and options for the offensive player to define the hit shot.
- Implement a user-friendly interface for shot definition that minimizes confusion or errors.
- Validate the input data from the offensive player to avoid incorrect game state changes.
- Log and monitor shot definitions for accountability and fair play analysis.
- Ensure that changes made by the offensive player are reflected immediately and reliably within the game environment.

text: If the shot was marked as a miss  the product shall change the status of the offensive player to defensive
ethical_us:
Title: Accurate Game Status Transition for Player Roles

Description: As a sports coach, I want the game product to accurately change the status of players from offensive to defensive following a shot being marked as a miss so that the game flow is fair and maintains integrity.

Work: 
- Ensure that the system accurately detects when a shot is marked as a miss.
- Verify that the player's status is reliably changed from offensive to defensive.
- Confirm that all stakeholders can access an explanation of how player status is automatically changed after a miss.
- Validate that this transition maintains fairness in game rules and player treatment.
- Provide documentation outlining the logic behind status changes for transparency to users.

text: If the shot was marked as a miss  the product shall change the status of the defensive player to offensive
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Fair Role Transition in Game Mechanics

Description: As a game developer, I want to implement a mechanism that automatically changes the status of a defensive player to offensive when a shot is marked as a miss, so that the game mechanics are fair and consistently uphold the rules for all players.

Work: 
- Ensure that the system reliably detects and marks a shot as a miss.
- Automatically update the player's role from defensive to offensive when a missed shot is identified.
- Test this functionality to verify accurate updates every time a shot misses.
- Validate that all players are subjected to the same conditions and rules to maintain fairness.
- Provide feedback to players about the role change to enhance transparency. 

(Note: This user story aligns with the principle of Justice and Fairness, ensuring that the system operates equitably for all participants.)

text: The product shall continue to assign turns until the game is ended.
ethical_us:
Title: Consistent Gameplay Turn Assignment

Description: As a game participant, I want the game to continue assigning turns until the game is ended so that all players can experience a fair and complete gaming session.

Work:
- Ensure the game logic correctly identifies when a game has started and is ongoing.
- Implement a mechanism to assign turns consistently to all active participants without interruption.
- Validate that turns are only stopped once a clear end-game condition is met.
- Conduct testing to confirm turns are assigned fairly among participants throughout gameplay.
- Document the turn assignment process to maintain transparency and trust among players.

text: The product shall end a game when a hit by the offensive player results in sinking the last of the defensive player\92s ships  which had not been previously marked as sunk.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensure Fairness in Game End Condition

Description: As a defensive player, I want the game to end immediately when my last ship is sunk so that the game adheres to fair play rules and provides a clear, just outcome.

Work: 
- Verify the game correctly tracks the status of all ships during play.
- Implement a check to determine if the last remaining ship is hit.
- Trigger the game-ending protocol immediately upon confirmation of all ships being sunk.
- Ensure that the transition to game end is seamless and communicated clearly to both players.
- Test the game with various scenarios to ensure consistent and fair determination of game end. 

**Related Ethical Principle: Justice and Fairness** - This principle is relevant here to ensure that the game's outcome is fair and unbiased, treating both offensive and defensive players equitably in terms of game rules and conditions.

text: The product shall allow a player to end a game at any time during the game.
ethical_us:
Title: Game Termination for Player Autonomy

Description: As a player, I want to be able to end the game at any time during the gameplay so that I can maintain my autonomy and control over my gaming experience.

Work: 
- The game interface must have a clearly visible and accessible option to end the game at any time.
- The system should provide a confirmation prompt to avoid unintentional termination.
- Upon ending the game, the player should be informed about any progress saved or lost.
- Ensure that ending the game does not penalize the player unfairly in terms of score or rewards.
- Test the termination feature across different game scenarios and platforms to ensure consistent functionality.

text: When a game is ended  the product shall notify the players that the game is ended.
ethical_us:
Title: End Game Notification for Player Transparency

Description: As a player, I want to be notified when the game has ended so that I can understand the game status and plan my next actions accordingly.

Work:
- Ensure that the game system sends a clear and timely notification to all players at the end of the game.
- Verify that the notification includes essential details such as the game result and any relevant statistics.
- Test the notification feature to ensure it works seamlessly across different devices and platforms.
- Provide players with an option to acknowledge receipt of the notification.
- Include an explanation in the notification detailing why the game has ended if applicable.

text: The notification of the game ending will include the reason the game is ended (i.e.  a player has won the game or a player has ended the game).
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent Game Conclusion Notification

Description: As a player, I want to receive a clear notification explaining why the game has ended, so that I can understand the outcome and the reason behind the game's conclusion.

Work: 
- The game system should generate a notification at the end of each game.
- The notification must clearly state the reason for the game's conclusion (e.g., a player has won, or a player has manually ended the game).
- The notification should be accessible within the game's user interface and be easily readable.
- Test to ensure the notification displays the correct reason in various game-ending scenarios.
- Gather player feedback to confirm the adequacy and clarity of notifications.

text: When a game is ended  the product shall allow each player to identify himself or herself as an available player in the list of players.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Player Freedom and Autonomy in Game Availability

Description: As a player, I want to have the ability to identify myself as an available player in the list of players once a game has ended, so that I can maintain my autonomy in deciding when to participate in another game.

Work:
- The system must provide an option for each player to mark themselves as available after a game ends.
- There should be clear instructions for players on how to change their availability status.
- The player's availability status should be visible to all players in the game list.
- The feature must function consistently across all supported devices and platforms.
- Ensure privacy of any personal information while changing availability status.

text: When a game is ended  the product shall allow each player to remove himself or herself from the list of players.
ethical_us:
Title: Empowering Player Autonomy in Game Participation

Description: As a player, I want to have the ability to remove myself from the list of players after a game ends so that I can maintain control over my gaming experience and personal choices.

Work:
- Implement a user interface feature allowing players to opt-out of the player list upon game conclusion.
- Ensure the removal option is clearly visible and accessible to all players.
- Validate that the player's data related to the specific game session is properly handled and not retained unnecessarily.
- Test the feature to ensure it functions seamlessly across different platforms and devices.
- Provide feedback to the player confirming their successful removal from the player list.

text: The system shall be easy to use by callers and supervisors. Callers and supervisors must be able to accomplish any system task within 2 minutes.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring User-Friendly Interaction for Callers and Supervisors

Description: As a caller or supervisor, I want the system to be intuitive and efficient to use so that I can accomplish necessary tasks quickly and without frustration.

Work: 
- The system interface should be designed for ease of navigation for both callers and supervisors.
- All system tasks must be executable within 2 minutes for any user.
- User feedback should be collected and analyzed to continuously improve the system's usability.
- Comprehensive training materials and help resources should be provided for end-users.
- Regular usability testing sessions should be conducted to ensure the ease of use is maintained over updates.

This user story relates to the ethical principle of Trust, as it builds confidence in the system through ease of use and efficiency, ensuring that users can rely on the technology to perform tasks swiftly and without confusion.

text: The system shall be easy to learn by callers and supervisors. Callers and supervisors shall learn how to use the system within 10 minutes.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring System Understandability for Callers and Supervisors

Description: As a caller or supervisor, I want the system to be easy to learn so that I can efficiently perform my duties without requiring extensive training.

Work: 
- The system interface should provide intuitive navigation.
- Include a quick-start guide or tutorial accessible from the system.
- Conduct user testing to ensure new users can learn to operate the system within 10 minutes.
- Implement a feedback mechanism for users to report ease of use issues. 

This ethical user story aligns with the principle of Transparency, focusing on understandability and making the system accessible for users through clear and straightforward interfaces.

text: The system shall be responsive. At the DePaul TeleServices Center  when a supervisor uses the system to view a callers schedule  the system response time must be no more than 2 seconds 90% of the time and no more than 5 seconds the rest of the time.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Efficient System Response for Call Schedulers

**Description**: As a supervisor at the DePaul TeleServices Center, I want the system to respond promptly when I view a caller's schedule so that I can manage my team's time effectively and maintain high service standards without delays.

**Work**:
- Ensure the system responds in no more than 2 seconds 90% of the time when accessing caller schedules.
- Guarantee that the remaining 10% of responses do not exceed a 5-second wait time.
- Conduct performance testing during peak and non-peak hours to verify compliance with response time criteria.
- Implement optimizations and adjustments as needed to maintain responsiveness standards.
- Provide a feedback mechanism for supervisors to report any persistent issues with system response times.

Ethical Principle: **Trust**

This user story is related to the ethical principle of Trust, as it emphasizes the system's reliability and effectiveness in providing timely responses, thereby ensuring that users can depend on the technology to perform efficiently during their critical tasks.

text: On a 56k connection  the system response time for all operations must be no more than 6 seconds 90% of the time.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Justice and Fairness

Title: Ensure Timely Access for All Users

Description: As a user with limited internet connectivity, I want the system to respond to my operations within 6 seconds 90% of the time so that I can have equitable access to services without being disadvantaged by my connection speed.

Work: 
- Conduct performance testing on the system to ensure it meets the specified response time on a 56k connection.
- Implement optimizations in data processing and transfer to reduce the load time without compromising the user experience.
- Regularly monitor system performance and user feedback to identify and address any deviations from the 6-second response goal.
- Update documentation and user guides to reflect system enhancements for users with slower connections.
- Conduct user testing with individuals on various connection speeds to validate fairness in response times.

text: On a 112k connection or faster  the system response time for all operations must be no more than 3 seconds 90% of the time.
ethical_us:
Title: Fast and Reliable System Response for Optimal User Experience

Description: As a system user, I want the system to respond within 3 seconds on a 112k connection or faster so that my user experience remains efficient and frustration-free.

Work:
- Ensure system operations are optimized to handle requests efficiently within the specified response time.
- Implement monitoring tools to track response times consistently, ensuring they meet the 3-second criterion 90% of the time.
- Conduct regular performance testing on different connectivity speeds, particularly focusing on 112k connections, to identify and address any potential issues.
- Provide a fallback mechanism or user notification in the event of prolonged response times to maintain transparency with the user.

text: The system must be available for use between 7:00AM and 11:59PM all days of the year.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Trust

Title: Ensuring Continuous System Availability for Trustworthiness

Description: As a system user, I want to have access to the system between 7:00 AM and 11:59 PM every day of the year so that I can rely on the system being consistently available when I need it, thereby enhancing my trust in its reliability.

Work:
- Verify that the system's servers and infrastructure are optimized to handle the operational demands for 17 hours a day, every day.
- Conduct regular maintenance and updates during non-operational hours to prevent downtime.
- Implement monitoring tools to ensure the system is available and running smoothly within the specified hours.
- Establish a notification system for users about any unexpected maintenance that may impact availability during the operational hours.
- Test the system periodically to confirm its availability aligns with the set schedule.
- Ensure there is a robust incident management process to address any unscheduled disruptions rapidly.

text: The product shall be internet browser independent.The product must run using Internet Explorer and Netscape Navigator.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Freedom and Autonomy

Title: Cross-Browser Compatibility for Freedom of Choice

Description: As an internet user, I want to access the product using my preferred internet browser so that I have the freedom to choose the browser that best suits my needs and preferences without being forced into using a specific one.

Work: 
- Ensure the product functions correctly on Internet Explorer.
- Ensure the product functions correctly on Netscape Navigator.
- Conduct comprehensive testing across different browsers to identify and fix any compatibility issues.
- Implement responsive design practices to maintain consistent user experience regardless of browser choice.
- Document any known issues and provide workarounds if full compatibility is currently not feasible.

text: The product shall ensure that only supervisors can advertise empty time slots.The product must ensure that supervisors are allowed to access advertise empty time slots.
ethical_us:
Title: Supervisor Access Control for Slot Advertising

Description: As a system administrator, I want to ensure that only supervisors can advertise empty time slots so that the process remains controlled and adheres to internal policy requirements.

Work: 
- Verify that supervisor roles are correctly assigned and updated in the system.
- Implement access controls to restrict slot advertising functions to users with a supervisor role.
- Test the system to ensure that only supervisors have the ability to advertise empty time slots.
- Ensure there is a logging mechanism to record attempts of access to the advertise slot function by non-supervisors. 

The most related ethical principle to this requirement is "Responsibility". This principle is applied by ensuring that the responsibility to perform certain tasks (advertising empty time slots) is assigned only to those qualified (supervisors), preventing unauthorized or inappropriate usage by unqualified personnel.

text: The product shall ensure that only supervisors can enter a caller\92s schedule.The product must ensure that supervisors are allowed to access advertise empty time slots.
ethical_us:
**Title: Ensuring Proper Access for Schedule Management**

**Description:** As a supervisor, I want to access and edit a caller’s schedule, so that I can effectively manage and advertise empty time slots.

**Work:**
- Verify that only users with supervisor credentials can log into the schedule management system.
- Ensure that supervisors have permissions to view, edit, and manage caller schedules.
- Provide an interface for supervisors to advertise empty time slots.
- Implement an audit trail that logs changes made to schedules by supervisors to maintain accountability.
- Test the system to ensure unauthorized users cannot access or modify caller schedules.

**Ethical Principle:** Responsibility - This user story focuses on the responsibility of ensuring that proper access controls are in place, emphasizing accountability and integrity in accessing and managing sensitive information.

text: The product shall ensure that only supervisors can view schedule of all callers.The product must ensure that supervisors are allowed to access advertise empty time slots.
ethical_us:
Title: Secure Access to Caller Schedules

Description: As a supervisor, I want to view the schedules of all callers so that I can manage and allocate resources effectively by advertising empty time slots.

Work:
- Ensure that the system has robust authentication and authorization protocols to verify supervisor access.
- Implement role-based access control that restricts schedule viewing permissions to supervisors only.
- Test the access control system to confirm that only supervisors can view caller schedules.
- Enable supervisors to easily access and advertise empty time slots within the schedule.
- Ensure compliance with data protection regulations and user privacy standards.

text: The interface shall have a simple look. In the interface and usability survey  90% of beta testers must report that the interface is adequately simple.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensure Simplicity in User Interface for Enhanced Understandability

Description: As a responsible developer, I want to provide a simple and easily understandable interface for users so that they can navigate and utilize the system effectively without confusion or frustration.

Work:
- Conduct an initial design review to ensure the interface aligns with simplicity and ease-of-use guidelines.
- Gather a diverse group of beta testers to participate in an interface and usability survey.
- Ensure that feedback is collected from beta testers to assess the simplicity of the interface.
- Implement iterative design changes based on user feedback until at least 90% of beta testers report that the interface is adequately simple.
- Provide clear documentation and training materials to support user understanding of the interface.
- Conduct final evaluation to confirm that the interface meets the desired simplicity criteria.

text: The interface shall be appealing to callers and supervisors. In the interface and usability survey  80% of beta testers must report that the interface is appealing.
ethical_us:
### Title: Ensuring Interface Appeal for Enhanced User Experience

### Description: 
As a **user-centered designer**, I want to create an appealing interface for callers and supervisors so that their interaction with the system is enjoyable and efficient, fostering a positive perception and overall usability.

### Work: 
- Conduct a comprehensive study on design preferences for both callers and supervisors.
- Develop wireframes and prototypes based on this research.
- Implement a testing phase with a diverse group of beta testers representing both user groups.
- Collect feedback through surveys, ensuring at least 80% of beta testers find the interface appealing.
- Analyze the feedback to identify areas for improvement and refinement.
- Make iterative adjustments to the interface design to enhance its appeal.
- Ensure the final design aligns with accessibility standards and caters to diverse user needs.
- Conduct a final round of usability testing to validate enhancements and ensure compliance with the 80% appeal criterion.

text: The product shall comply with City of Chicago Application Development Guide Framework.Application Development Framework will provide structured Graphical User Interface.
ethical_us:
**Title: Compliance with City of Chicago Development Framework**

**Description:** As a local government official, I want the product to comply with the City of Chicago Application Development Guide Framework, so that the application maintains transparency and consistency with municipal regulations.

**Work:**
- Review and understand the City of Chicago Application Development Guide Framework.
- Implement a structured Graphical User Interface in line with the guidelines provided by the City of Chicago.
- Ensure that all design and development processes adhere to the framework.
- Conduct regular audits and assessments to verify compliance with city regulations.
- Document all compliance efforts and modifications for transparency and reporting purposes.

text: The product shall provide Monitoring Services.The product shall be easy for System Administrators and DBAs to use after two weeks of usage.
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent Monitoring System for Administrators

Description: As a System Administrator, I want to easily understand and use the monitoring services after two weeks of usage so that I can efficiently manage and ensure the smooth operation of our systems.

Work:
- Ensure the monitoring system has a comprehensive and clear user guide for administrators and DBAs.
- Provide training sessions within the initial two weeks to familiarize users with system functionalities.
- Develop an intuitive user interface that enables easy navigation and understanding of monitoring services.
- Implement features that allow administrators to view detailed logs and reports for better decision-making.
- Offer continuous support and access to a help desk for ongoing inquiries and further clarification.

text: The product shall provide Error Tracking Services.The product shall help the System Administrators and DBAs to resolve transaction errors 99% of the time.
ethical_us:
**Title: Ensure Reliable Error Resolution**

**Description:** As a **System Administrator**, I want to have effective and accurate error tracking services so that I can resolve transaction errors 99% of the time without causing additional issues or delays.

**Work:**  
- The system must provide detailed and understandable error logs that pinpoint the source of an error.
- Error logs should be organized in a user-friendly interface that allows quick access and filtering.
- Provide clear and comprehensible suggestions or automated solutions for resolving common transaction errors.
- Ensure logs are updated in real-time to reflect the most current state of system transactions.
- Verify system accuracy by conducting tests to ensure a 99% error resolution rate over a specified period.
- Maintain a detailed system guide or support documentation that explains how to utilize the error tracking services effectively.
- Conduct user training sessions to familiarize System Administrators and DBAs with using the error tracking tools efficiently.

**Ethical Principle: Trust**  
By implementing robust error tracking services that allow System Administrators and DBAs to resolve errors with a high success rate, the product builds trust in its capability to maintain system stability and integrity.

text: The product shall provide Portals.The product shall help System Administrators to analyze the transactions with ad-hoc reporting and KPIs (Key Performance Indicators)
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Transparency

Title: Enhancing Administrative Transparency Through Ad-hoc Reporting

Description: As a System Administrator, I want to analyze transactions using ad-hoc reporting and KPIs so that I can transparently monitor and communicate system performance and insights to relevant stakeholders.

Work: 
- Ensure that the ad-hoc reporting feature provides clear and understandable transaction data outputs.
- Develop intuitive dashboards displaying KPIs that allow easy interpretation of transactional data.
- Implement tools for visualizing transaction metrics that can be easily shared with stakeholders.
- Allow customization of reports to enable administrators to generate data-driven insights tailored to stakeholder inquiries.
- Provide robust documentation and training resources to help administrators effectively use the reporting tools for transparent communication.

text: The product shall provide Asynchronous Messaging.The product shall provide asynchronous messaging to enable parallel processing and reduce the overhead in communications
ethical_us:
**Title: Facilitate Efficient Communication with Asynchronous Messaging**

**Description:** As a **system architect**, I want to implement asynchronous messaging **so that the system can efficiently handle parallel processes and minimize the communication overhead, enhancing system performance**.

**Work:**

1. Ensure that the asynchronous messaging system does not cause data loss or corruption during transit.
2. Verify that messages are delivered reliably even in cases of network interruptions.
3. Confirm that the system supports queue management for orderly message processing.
4. Implement logging for message tracking and debugging purposes to maintain transparency and accountability.
5. Provide documentation and training for users on how to use the asynchronous messaging feature effectively.
6. Conduct performance tests to ensure that the implementation achieves the intended parallel processing benefits without introducing substantial delays.

This requirement aligns primarily with the principle of **Trust**, which focuses on ensuring systems are secure and effective, maintaining transparent processes to build and maintain user trust.

text: The product shall provide Multi-threading and Load Balancing.The product shall provide multi-threading technology as well as load balancing to overcome data load spikes and traffic.
ethical_us:
Title: Efficient Performance for Seamless User Experience

Description: As a system administrator, I want to ensure that the AI system can handle data load spikes and traffic efficiently so that users have a seamless and reliable experience without delays or interruptions.

Work: 
- Implement multi-threading technology to allow concurrent processing of tasks.
- Integrate load balancing mechanisms to distribute workloads evenly across system resources.
- Test the system under various load conditions to ensure stability and performance.
- Monitor and optimize system performance regularly to adapt to changing load patterns.
- Ensure that documentation is provided on how the multi-threading and load balancing features work and how to troubleshoot common issues.

The ethical principle most related to this requirement is **Trust**. By ensuring the efficient functioning of the AI system, users can trust that the technology will perform reliably and effectively, maintaining their confidence in the system's capabilities.

text: The product shall process messages within 2 seconds.The product shall have a maximum message processing time of 2 seconds
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Timely Communication

Description: As a real-time communication user, I want to ensure messages are processed within 2 seconds so that I can maintain efficient and uninterrupted conversations.

Work: 
- Measure and verify the current message processing time to ensure it is within the 2-second limit.
- Implement necessary performance optimizations to reduce processing time, if current performance exceeds the acceptable threshold.
- Conduct thorough testing in various scenarios to ensure consistent message processing time within 2 seconds.
- Monitor system performance regularly to guarantee ongoing compliance with the 2-second requirement.
- Provide a report detailing system performance for transparency and user assurance.
  
Ethical Principle: Trust

The principle of Trust is most related to this requirement because it focuses on ensuring that the system works properly and meets promised performance standards, enhancing user confidence in reliable communication experiences.

text: The product shall poll the system for messages every second.The product shall poll the system for new messages at a maximum of every 1 second.
ethical_us:
Title: Timely Message Retrieval for User Autonomy

Description: As a user, I want the system to poll for new messages every second so that I can stay informed and make timely decisions based on the latest information.

Work: 
- Ensure the system's polling mechanism is configured to check for new messages every second.
- Validate that the message retrieval does not cause system lag or delays affecting user experience.
- Test the system under various network conditions to ensure reliability and consistency in message polling.
- Include a configuration option for users to adjust polling frequency according to their preferences.
- Document the process for users to understand how the polling mechanism works and their options for adjustment.
- Conduct a security review to ensure no excessive data is collected that might compromise user privacy. 

This user story is aligned with the principle of "Freedom and Autonomy," ensuring that users have control over the timeliness of information without system-imposed restrictions.

text: The product shall provide Dynamic Change Support and Transparent resource addition.The product shall support Transparent Resource addition and Dynamic Change support to provide scalability and avoid service interruptions of more than 1 day.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Transparent Resource Addition and Dynamic Change Support  

Description: As a system administrator, I want to transparently add resources and manage dynamic changes so that I can ensure scalability and minimize service interruptions to less than one day.  

Work:  
- Implement a user-friendly interface that clearly outlines the process for adding new resources.  
- Develop documentation that provides a step-by-step guide for resource addition and system scalability procedures.  
- Ensure that all changes to resource allocation are logged and can be easily audited.  
- Provide real-time updates to users about the status of resource additions and any potential impacts on service availability.  
- Create notifications for system administrators to proactively address potential scalability issues.  
- Test the system to ensure that resource additions can be performed without causing interruptions exceeding one day.  

This user story aligns with the ethical principle of Transparency by ensuring clear and understandable procedures for system changes and resource management.

text: The product shall be robust.The product shall have fault avoidance based on standards adoption.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring System Robustness Through Standards

Description: As a system engineer, I want to adopt fault avoidance strategies based on established standards so that the product is robust and dependable, ensuring it functions properly for all users.

Work:
- Conduct research to identify relevant industry standards for fault avoidance.
- Implement design and coding practices aligned with these standards.
- Perform rigorous testing to identify potential faults and weaknesses.
- Review and update the fault avoidance strategies regularly to incorporate new standards and best practices.
- Create documentation that explains the fault avoidance measures and how they align with the chosen standards. 

This user story aligns with the ethical principle of Trust, emphasizing the importance of creating reliable and secure systems that users can depend on.

text: The product shall be robust with fault tolerance.The product shall have fault tolerance by using recovery technique compensatory transaction and routing around failures.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensure Robustness and Fault Tolerance in AI Systems

Description: As an AI system user, I want the product to be robust with fault tolerance through recovery techniques and compensatory transactions, so that I can rely on the system's continuous operation and avoid potential disruptions.

Work:
1. Implement recovery techniques that effectively handle failures and ensure system continuity.
2. Design and integrate compensatory transaction mechanisms to recover from errors without user intervention.
3. Develop routing strategies that allow the system to circumvent failures, maintaining functionality.
4. Conduct comprehensive testing to validate the system's fault tolerance capabilities.
5. Provide transparent documentation explaining the fault tolerance processes to users.

text: The product shall be able to process all transactions.The product shall process minimum of 1 million transactions per year.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Fair and Consistent Transaction Processing

Description: As a financial auditor, I want the product to process all transactions efficiently, ensuring it handles a minimum of 1 million transactions per year, so that the system remains unbiased and equitable, serving all users fairly.

Work: 
- Ensure the system can handle high volumes of transactions without failure.
- Implement monitoring tools to detect and address any biases or discrepancies in transaction processing.
- Conduct regular audits to verify adherence to fairness and consistency standards.
- Validate that transaction processing times remain consistent, regardless of transaction volume or user demographics.
- Ensure robust error handling to prevent data loss or corruption during high transaction loads.

text: The product shall be platform independent.The product shall enable access to any type of development environment and platform.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Freedom and autonomy

Title: Ensuring Platform Independence for User Autonomy

Description: As a developer, I want to use the product across any development environment and platform so that I have the freedom to choose the tools and systems that best suit my work needs and preferences without constraints.

Work: 
- Verify the product is compatible with various operating systems, such as Windows, macOS, and Linux.
- Ensure integration of the product with multiple development environments, including IDEs like Visual Studio, Eclipse, and PyCharm.
- Develop comprehensive documentation to guide users on setting up the product on different platforms.
- Test and confirm seamless functionality and performance consistency across diverse platforms.
- Include support for community-driven plugins and customization to enhance platform independence.

text: The product shall interface CSR and Datastream.The product shall exchange messages between CSR and EAM on a real time basis without any direct interfaces between two systems.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Seamless Communication Without Compromising Privacy

Description: As a data integrity officer, I want to ensure secure and private real-time message exchange between CSR and EAM without any direct interfaces, so that sensitive data is protected and privacy is upheld while maintaining system functionality.

Work:
- Verify that the message exchange method complies with current data protection regulations and standards.
- Ensure that data encryption is implemented during message transmission to prevent unauthorized access.
- Conduct regular security audits to ensure there are no vulnerabilities in the communication protocol.
- Implement monitoring mechanisms to detect and log any attempted unauthorized access.
- Provide clear documentation that explains how user data is protected during transit between systems.
- Train relevant personnel on the importance of protecting user data privacy in interfacing systems.

text: The product shall continue to operate during upgrade  change or new resource addition.The product shall be able to continue to operate with no interruption in service due to new resource additions.
ethical_us:
Title: Seamless Upgrade and Resource Integration

Description: As an IT manager, I want the product to continue operating seamlessly during upgrades or when adding new resources so that there is no interruption in service and continuous trust is maintained with end-users and stakeholders.

Work: 
- Ensure that the system design supports hot-swapping and rolling updates without downtime.
- Implement redundancy and failover mechanisms to handle possible disruptions during upgrades.
- Test the system rigorously to verify uninterrupted service during resource addition or system upgrades.
- Provide detailed documentation on the upgrade and resource addition processes, outlining steps to ensure continuous operations.
- Conduct regular training for the IT team on best practices for maintaining service continuity during system changes.

text: The product shall be updated on a regular basis.The product will have a new major feature introduced every six months and quarterly maintenance releases every six months.
ethical_us:
Title: Regular Product Updates for Trust and Reliability

Description: As a responsible tech user, I want the product to be updated on a regular basis, including major feature updates every six months and quarterly maintenance releases, so that I can trust that the application remains reliable, secure, and effective in meeting my needs.

Work: 
- Ensure a timeline is established for new major feature introductions every six months.
