- Schedule and conduct quarterly maintenance releases to address any existing bugs, vulnerabilities, or performance issues.
- Communicate update schedules and new features to users in advance to maintain transparency.
- Conduct thorough testing before each release to ensure stability and security.
- Gather user feedback after each update to continually improve the product.

text: The product shall operate with every platform.The product shall accommodate any new technology without any change in its architecture.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Platform Compatibility and Future-proofing for Continuous Fair Access

Description: As a technology user and stakeholder, I want the product to operate seamlessly across all platforms and accommodate any new technology without requiring architectural changes, so that everyone, regardless of their preferred technology or platform, can access the product equitably and benefit from its features without discrimination or exclusion.

Work:
- Acceptance Criteria:
  1. The product must be tested and confirmed to operate across major existing platforms (e.g., Windows, macOS, Linux, iOS, Android).
  2. The architecture must support modular adaptations to integrate emerging technologies without requiring foundational changes.
  3. Continuous updates and iteration processes should be implemented to ensure consistent compatibility and performance parity across platforms.
  4. Regular audits must be conducted to assess and improve platform compatibility and adaptability.
  5. User feedback should be collected to identify any access or performance issues across diverse platforms promptly.
  6. Document any updates or changes transparently, maintaining open communication with users about platform integration and compatibility expectations.

text: The product shall have security.The product shall provide authentication  and authorization.
ethical_us:
Title: Secure User Access with Robust Authentication and Authorization

Description: As a system administrator, I want to ensure secure access through rigorous authentication and authorization so that user data is protected from unauthorized access and misuse.

Work:
1. Implement multi-factor authentication (MFA) to verify user identity.
2. Develop role-based access control (RBAC) to ensure users have access only to necessary resources.
3. Conduct regular security audits to identify and address potential vulnerabilities.
4. Use encryption protocols for secure transmission and storage of sensitive information.
5. Provide training for users on secure password practices and recognize phishing attempts.

text: The product shall have audit capabilities.The product shall store messages for a minimum of one year for audit and transaction tracking purposes.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Auditable Transactions

Description: As a compliance officer, I want to have access to audit capabilities and store messages for a minimum of one year so that I can ensure accountability and transparency in transaction tracking.

Work: 
- Implement a secure and reliable audit log system that records all transactions.
- Ensure that all messages are stored for at least one year without loss or corruption.
- Provide a user interface for compliance officers to access and review stored messages and transaction logs.
- Enable export functionality for audit logs to facilitate reporting and regulatory compliance.
- Implement access controls to ensure only authorized personnel can view audit data, maintaining confidentiality and integrity.
- Regularly test and verify the accuracy and completeness of the audit logging system.

text: The system shall use IBM and CCR branding standards. The interface must have one IBM logo and one CCR logo.
ethical_us:
Title: Brand Transparency in User Interface

Description: As a conscientious user, I want the system interface to clearly display one IBM logo and one CCR logo so that I can readily identify the entities responsible for the product.

Work:
- Display the IBM logo prominently in the designated section of the user interface.
- Display the CCR logo prominently in the designated section of the user interface.
- Ensure the logos adhere to all official branding guidelines for size, color, and placement.
- Review the interface design to confirm that logos are clear and not obstructed by other design elements.
- Validate that the presence of both logos is consistent across different device screens and resolutions.

text: The system shall be displayable on any work computer a CCR user may have. The system interface shall be formatted to display at 800 by 600 pixel resolution.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Fair and Accessible System Interface

Description: As a CCR user, I want the system to be displayable on any work computer and formatted to display at 800 by 600 pixel resolution so that all users have equal access to the system regardless of their hardware specifications.

Work: 
- Verify that the system interface is responsive and can adjust to an 800 by 600 pixel resolution.
- Conduct testing across multiple computer models to ensure consistent display and functionality.
- Confirm that all features are accessible and clearly visible at the specified resolution.
- Ensure compatibility tests are conducted for different operating systems common in work environments.
- Gather feedback from users on the accessibility and usability of the system interface at the specified resolution.

text: The system interface will use CCR nomenclature. The system must use the same nomenclature used in the existing WCS system and reports
ethical_us:
**Title:** Consistent Nomenclature for Improved Understandability

**Description:** As a **data analyst**, I want to use the CCR nomenclature in the system interface, so that there is consistency with the existing WCS system and reports, enhancing transparency and understandability in data analysis processes.

**Work:** 
- Verify that the system interface integrates CCR nomenclature effectively.
- Ensure that all system reports generated utilize the CCR nomenclature.
- Conduct a comparison between the nomenclature used in the current WCS system and reports with the new system to ensure complete alignment.
- Create documentation or guidelines for users that highlight the nomenclature consistency and its benefits for transparency.
- Include a feedback mechanism for users to report any inconsistencies in nomenclature usage.

text: The interface must summarize the data in a fashion that\92s appealing to CCR management. Every report type must have at least one high level summary shown in the results dashboard/interface
ethical_us:
The requirement of summarizing data in a fashion that is appealing to management while ensuring that reports have high-level summaries available aligns most closely with the ethical principle of **Transparency**. The principle of transparency involves clarity in communication and ensuring understandability, which is key when presenting data summaries to management.

Title: User-Friendly High-Level Data Summary

Description: As a CCR management member, I want the interface to provide appealing and easily understandable high-level data summaries so that I can quickly grasp the essential insights and make informed decisions.

Work:
- Acceptance Criteria:
  1. Provide a high-level data summary for each report type on the dashboard/interface.
  2. Ensure that summaries are presented in a clear and visually appealing manner.
  3. Include graphical elements (charts/graphs) to enhance understandability of the data summary.
  4. Allow users to drill down into detailed data from the summary view if needed.
  5. Guarantee that all summaries are accurate and up-to-date.
  6. Include tooltips or help sections to explain any complex terms or figures present in the summary.

text: The system must use a point and click interface. 100% of all selection and navigation functionality must be able to be activated/selected by either a mouse or a keyboard
ethical_us:
Title: Accessible Navigation Interface

Description: As a user with mobility limitations, I want to interact with the system using either a mouse or a keyboard so that I can navigate and use the application effectively and independently, ensuring my autonomy and equity in the digital experience.

Work: 
- Ensure that all navigation elements and functionalities can be activated by a mouse.
- Ensure that all navigation elements and functionalities can be triggered using keyboard shortcuts.
- Conduct accessibility testing with users who have mobility challenges to ensure usability.
- Provide clear instructions and support for using keyboard navigation.
- Ensure that the interface is compliant with accessibility standards such as WCAG (Web Content Accessibility Guidelines).

text: The interface shall be easy to use. 90% of users should be able to successfully use the system to generate a report on their first use. The interface should adhere to IBM usability standards.
ethical_us:
**Title:** Easy-to-Use Interface for All Users

**Description:** As a user, I want to easily generate a report on my first use so that I can efficiently complete my tasks without confusion or delay.

**Work:**

- The interface design should align with IBM usability standards to ensure consistency and ease of use.
- 90% of users should be able to navigate the system and complete a report generation process successfully on their first attempt.
- Perform user testing to gather feedback on ease of use and make improvements as needed to enhance user experience.
- Provide clear instructions or tooltips within the interface to assist users who might require additional guidance.
- Ensure accessibility for users with disabilities by implementing features that comply with accessibility standards. 

This user story aligns with the ethical principle of **Transparency**. Providing an easy-to-use interface with clear instructions contributes to the understandability and accessibility of the system, ensuring users can interact with it effectively without confusion.

text: Reports must be easy to generate. Reports must be generated within one button click and exported within one button click (after selecting the report)
ethical_us:
Title: Seamless Report Generation for Increased Transparency

Description: As a data analyst, I want to generate and export reports quickly and easily with one button click so that I can maintain transparency in data-driven decisions and communicate findings efficiently.

Work:
1. Implement a one-click functionality for generating reports from selected data sets.
2. Design a user-friendly interface that clearly displays available report options for selection.
3. Ensure the export process can be completed with a single click after report selection, supporting common formats like PDF and CSV.
4. Provide clear instructions and tooltips to guide users in generating and exporting reports.
5. Conduct usability testing to ensure the process is intuitive and meets transparency requirements.
6. Verify that generated reports include all necessary information for thorough understanding and analysis.

text: A user shall be able to use the system without instruction after a short amount of time. After one use a user should understand and remember 90% of the system usage and navigation.
ethical_us:
Title: Intuitive System Usability

Description: As a new user, I want to understand and remember the system's usage and navigation with minimal instruction after a short amount of time so that I can efficiently and confidently use the system, ensuring transparency in its design and functionality.

Work: 
- Conduct usability testing to ensure users can navigate the system with minimal guidance.
- Design an intuitive user interface that requires less than 10 minutes to get familiar with.
- Implement clear and understandable labels and prompts throughout the system.
- Ensure a 90% comprehension rate for system usage and navigation after the first use.
- Gather and incorporate user feedback to continually improve understandability.

text: All CCR users shall receive training before the WCS system is deployed. One training session will be held for 100% of CCR users before system deployment (based on a CCR user being available)
ethical_us:
Title: Mandatory Training for WCS System Deployment

Description: As a CCR user, I want to receive training before the WCS system is deployed so that I am prepared to use the system responsibly and effectively, ensuring a smooth transition and safeguarding operations.

Work:
- Verify that all CCR users are registered for a training session.
- Schedule and conduct training sessions covering all necessary aspects of the WCS system.
- Confirm attendance for 100% of CCR users who are available.
- Provide materials and documentation that reinforce training concepts.
- Evaluate user understanding and provide additional support if necessary.

Ethical Principle: Responsibility

Justification: This user story emphasizes the ethical principle of responsibility by ensuring that CCR users are well-prepared and informed about the system they will be interacting with. By mandating comprehensive training, the organization takes responsibility for enabling users to act with integrity and accountability when using the WCS system, reducing potential errors and promoting effective use.

text: The WCS system shall use appropriate nomenclature and terminology as defined by the Corporate Community Grants organization. All interfaces and reports will undergo usability tests by CCR users.
ethical_us:
**Title: Ensuring Clarity and Usability for CCR Users**

**Description:**  
As a CCR user, I want the WCS system to use appropriate nomenclature and terminology as defined by the Corporate Community Grants organization and for all interfaces and reports to undergo usability tests, so that I can interact with the system easily and efficiently, ensuring that I comprehend the system's features and outputs.

**Work:**  
- Acceptance Criteria:
  1. The WCS system’s terminology must align 100% with the Corporate Community Grants organization's defined nomenclature.
  2. Conduct usability testing sessions with a representative group of CCR users for all interfaces and reports.
  3. Gather and analyze feedback from usability tests to identify any issues with language clarity or user interaction.
  4. Implement updates to the system based on test feedback to improve clarity and usability.
  5. Validate any updates with follow-up usability tests to ensure that the desired level of user understanding and satisfaction is achieved.

This user story is centered around the ethical principle of **Transparency**, as it emphasizes the importance of clear communication and understanding between the system and its users.

text: The WCS system shall be available at all times as long as IBM\92s internal intranet W3 is accessible. The WCS system will be available 95% of the time IBM\92s internal intranet W3 is available.
ethical_us:
Title: Reliable System Accessibility

Description: As an employee of IBM, I want the WCS system to be reliably available 95% of the time when the internal intranet W3 is accessible so that I can efficiently perform my work tasks without interruptions.

Work: 
- Ensure the WCS system is integrated with the internal intranet W3 in a way that maximizes uptime and reliability.
- Implement monitoring tools to continuously track the availability of the WCS system and the internal intranet.
- Develop and maintain a contingency plan to quickly address any downtime or accessibility issues.
- Provide regular updates and transparent communication to users regarding system availability and maintenance schedules.
- Validate that the WCS system remains operational for at least 95% of the time in alignment with W3's availability through rigorous testing and reporting. 

This user story is aligned with the ethical principle of Trust, emphasizing the importance of ensuring systems work properly and that their reliability instills confidence in users.

text: The WCS system shall have the ability to connect other designated WCS databases currently not included in the system.
ethical_us:
**Title: Ensuring Connectivity with Ethical Oversight**

**Description:** As a *database administrator*, I want to connect other designated WCS databases currently not included in the system *so that* I can manage data more effectively while ensuring non-maleficence by protecting against data breaches and unauthorized access.

**Work:**

1. Verify that all new databases to be connected meet the security protocols and standards to prevent data breaches.
2. Implement encryption methods to protect data during transit between databases.
3. Ensure that access controls are in place, granting permissions only to authorized personnel.
4. Perform regular security audits to identify and address potential vulnerabilities in the connectivity process.
5. Provide clear documentation and guidelines on the connection process to ensure transparency and accountability.
6. Test the connection setup in a controlled environment to ensure it functions without affecting the integrity or security of existing systems.

text: The WCS system shall have the ability to include data for regions outside the United States and be accessed by users outside of the United States if approved by CCR management.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Justice and Fairness in Global Data Access

Description: As an international data analyst, I want to access WCS system data for regions outside the United States, so that I can perform equitable analyses and interpretations with global perspectives.

Work:
- Ensure that data inclusion for regions outside the United States adheres to non-discriminatory practices.
- Implement a process for CCR management to approve access requests from international users, ensuring fairness in decision-making.
- Develop clear guidelines for equitable data access irrespective of the user's location.
- Validate that the system provides unbiased data access and reporting capabilities for all approved users.

text: The WCS system shall be run in a Windows environment. The WCS shall be accessed by users through the Internet on an IBM computer running a Windows 2000 or above operating system.
ethical_us:
Title: Accessible System Environment

Description: As a system administrator, I want the WCS system to be accessible through the Internet on an IBM computer running a Windows 2000 or above operating system so that users have a consistent and reliable environment to access the system.

Work: 
- Verify that the WCS system is compatible with Windows 2000 and above operating systems.
- Ensure that users can reliably access the WCS system over the internet using an IBM computer.
- Test the system environment for stability and compatibility across supported Windows versions.
- Provide clear documentation to users on how to access the WCS system using the specified environment.

(Note: The ethical principle most related to this requirement is Transparency. Ensuring that a system is accessible through specific environments promotes understanding and enables users to have clear expectations about the system's operability and accessibility.)

text: The Brio portion of the WCS system must be able to export files in spreadsheet form (Microsoft Excel and Lotus 1-2-3 formats).  Brio will provide buttons in the user interface that produce/export reports in .xls or .123 file formats.
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent Data Export Capability

Description: As a business analyst, I want to export Brio reports in spreadsheet format (Microsoft Excel and Lotus 1-2-3) so that I can easily understand and communicate data findings with stakeholders.

Work: 
- Ensure buttons are available in the Brio user interface for exporting reports.
- Implement functionality to export reports as .xls files.
- Implement functionality to export reports as .123 files.
- Ensure exported reports maintain format and data integrity.
- Provide user documentation and help resources for exporting reports.

text: The WCS system must run queries to the WCS databases once again (on a specified day) to update the available data available to CCR users. Queries must be made to external databases for data refresh once a week.
ethical_us:
Title: Ethical Data Refresh for Accurate User Information

Description: As a data integrity specialist, I want to ensure that the WCS system runs weekly queries to update the data available to CCR users so that the information remains current, accurate, and beneficial for users' decision-making processes.

Work:
- Schedule and configure the system to automatically run external database queries once a week.
- Ensure that all data retrieval processes preserve data integrity and accuracy.
- Validate and verify that updated data is correctly reflected in the WCS system for CCR users.
- Implement logging and monitoring to track the success and any issues during the data refresh process.
- Review and update the external database connections to ensure they are secure and compliant with privacy standards. 

This user story is related to the ethical principle of Beneficence, as it focuses on ensuring that the system serves the users with up-to-date information, enhancing their ability to benefit from accurate and current data.

text: The system shall only be accessed by authorized Corporate Community Grants (CCR) employees. Users must be authenticated using their IBM intranet user name and password.
ethical_us:
**Ethical Principle:** Privacy

**Title:** Secure Access for Corporate Community Grants Employees

**Description:** As an authorized CCR employee, I want to access the system using my IBM intranet username and password so that my personal information and the data handled within the system remain private and secure.

**Work:**
- Ensure that the system only permits access to users with verified IBM intranet credentials.
- Implement a secure authentication process that encrypts user credentials during transmission and storage.
- Verify that access mechanisms comply with the latest privacy regulations and company policies.
- Conduct regular audits to ensure access controls are effective and to prevent any unauthorized access.
- Provide users with guidelines on maintaining password security to enhance their own privacy protection.

text: The WCS system shall not allow automatic logins by any user. Cookies containing WCS login information about a user will not be stored on a user\92s computer.
ethical_us:
Title: Secure and Private User Login Process

Description: As a security-conscious user, I want to ensure that my login information is not automatically stored or used for automatic logins so that my privacy and data integrity are maintained.

Work: 
- Verify that the system does not store login credentials in cookies.
- Ensure that any attempt to store cookies containing login information is blocked.
- Implement a mechanism that requires manual login for every session.
- Test the user login process to confirm no data is saved for automatic login purposes.
- Conduct a security audit to ensure that user credentials are protected and privacy is upheld. 

Ethical Principle: Privacy. This user story ensures the protection of personal data by preventing unauthorized access and storage of user login information.

text: Each team owner will need to use a username and password in order to be authenticated to reach the team owner\92s page
ethical_us:
**Ethical Principle: Privacy**

---

**Title: Secure Authentication for Team Owners**

**Description:** 
As a team owner, I want to use a username and password to be authenticated so that my personal and team-related information is secure and my privacy is ensured.

**Work:**
- Verify that each team owner is required to create a unique username and password.
- Ensure that passwords meet complexity requirements to enhance security.
- Implement an authentication system that securely validates credentials.
- Log authentication attempts and inform users of successful or failed login attempts to detect unauthorized access.
- Store all authentication credentials securely using encryption methods.
- Conduct regular security audits to maintain the effectiveness of the authentication system.

text: The Commissioner will be the only authorized user per league to adjust league settings.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Responsibility

Title: Ensure Responsible Access to League Settings

Description: As a League Commissioner, I want to be the only authorized user to adjust league settings so that I can maintain the integrity and fairness of the league's operations.

Work: 
- Verify that only the Commissioner has administrative access to league settings.
- Implement user authentication processes to ensure the Commissioner's identity.
- Provide an audit trail of changes made to league settings by the Commissioner.
- Notify league members when any changes are made to the settings, ensuring transparency and accountability.
- Provide a mechanism for escalating issues if unauthorized access attempts are detected.

text: Each page shall contain a navigation menu which shows the index into which the current page is contained.
ethical_us:
**Title:** Transparent Navigation for Easier User Experience

**Description:** As a user, I want to see a navigation menu on each page that shows the index of the current page so that I can understand the context and easily navigate through the content.

**Work:**
- The navigation menu should be clearly visible on every page.
- The menu should accurately reflect the hierarchy and position of the current page within the entire content.
- Users should be able to click on links within the navigation menu to move to other pages.
- The navigation structure should be intuitive and consistent across all pages.
- Ensure that the index information is updated dynamically as users browse different sections.
- Test the navigation menu on different devices and screen sizes to ensure accessibility and usability.

This user story aligns with the ethical principle of Transparency, ensuring that users can understand the layout and navigation of the content hierarchy effectively.

text: Each page shall contain a similar format with action items in one location and navigation buttons in a different location.
ethical_us:
**Title: Ensuring Consistency for User Autonomy**

**Description**: As a website user, I want each page to have a consistent format with action items and navigation buttons in distinct locations so that I can easily navigate and make informed decisions without unnecessary hindrance.

**Work**: 
- Ensure that all web pages follow a uniform layout regarding the placement of action items.
- Verify that navigation buttons are consistently positioned across every page.
- Conduct user testing to confirm that users find the layout intuitive and can navigate without confusion.
- Ensure that any changes to the layout are communicated clearly to existing users.

text: The message board shall contain the 5 most recently posted messages on the league page. The messages will contain up to the first 150 characters of the message.
ethical_us:
**Title:** Recent Message Transparency on League Pages

**Description:** As a league member, I want to view the 5 most recently posted messages with only the first 150 characters displayed so that I can quickly understand the latest updates without being overwhelmed by lengthy posts.

**Work:**
- Display the most recent 5 messages in chronological order on the league page.
- Ensure each message preview is truncated to 150 characters, without cutting off mid-word if possible.
- Provide a user interface that informs users the message is truncated.
- Implement a "read more" link or button to allow users to view full messages.
- Conduct usability testing to confirm that users can easily identify and access recent messages.

text: A new user shall be able to navigate through the league and team pages within 30 seconds of reaching the start-up page.
ethical_us:
Title: Seamless Navigation for User Accessibility

Description: As a new user, I want to navigate through the league and team pages within 30 seconds of reaching the start-up page so that I can quickly access information without frustration or confusion.

Work:
- Ensure the start-up page loads completely within 5 seconds under standard network conditions.
- Implement intuitive navigation menus that are easy to locate and understand for new users.
- Ensure that the transition between pages is smooth and takes no longer than 3 seconds each.
- Conduct user testing to confirm that 95% of users can navigate to the desired pages within the 30-second timeframe.
- Provide alternative text descriptions and guidelines for users who need additional assistance or use assistive technologies.

text: Users shall be able to reach the \91add\92  \91drop\92  and \91trade player\92 pages with one click from the team owner\92s page.
ethical_us:
Title: Streamlined Player Management Access

Description: As a fantasy sports team owner, I want to reach the 'add,' 'drop,' and 'trade player' pages with one click from my team owner's page, so that I can manage my team efficiently and without unnecessary delays.

Work:
- Ensure that the 'add,' 'drop,' and 'trade player' options are clearly visible and accessible from the team owner's page.
- Develop intuitive and user-friendly navigation with a single-click feature to each page.
- Test the navigation feature to confirm there are no errors or redundant steps in accessing the player management pages.
- Validate that changes made during player management actions are immediately reflected in the user's team data.
- Gather user feedback on the ease of access and incorporate any necessary adjustments for improved user experience.

Ethical Principle: Trust

Reasoning: Enabling users to easily manage their teams with transparent and efficient access to key functions is essential to building trust in the system. Users should be able to rely on the system to function as expected without unnecessary complications or obstructions. By ensuring that these tasks are performed effectively, the system demonstrates trustworthiness and commitment to providing a reliable user experience.

text: Users shall be able to view at least 25 NFL player statistics and points on each page.
ethical_us:
**Title: Transparent Access to NFL Player Statistics**

**Description:** As a sports enthusiast, I want to view at least 25 NFL player statistics and points on each page so that I can easily and transparently analyze player performances without excessive navigation.

**Work:**
- Ensure the interface displays at least 25 player statistics and points on a single page.
- Provide a clear and understandable layout for player statistics to facilitate easy comparison.
- Include filters or sorting options to allow users to easily find specific information among the 25 players.
- Implement a pagination or scrolling mechanism to navigate through additional player statistics seamlessly.
- Ensure the data representation is consistent and transparent, allowing users to verify the integrity of the displayed information.

text: The application shall ask the user to confirm dropping a player or trading a player before performing the action.
ethical_us:
Title: User Confirmation for Player Changes

Description: As a fantasy sports manager, I want to confirm any action of dropping or trading a player before it is finalized so that I can ensure my decisions are intentional and prevent accidental changes to my team.

Work: 
- Display a confirmation dialog whenever a user initiates a drop or trade action.
- Include clear options in the confirmation dialog to either proceed with or cancel the action.
- Ensure that no player drop or trade is executed until the user explicitly confirms the action by selecting the appropriate option. 
- Test the confirmation process to guarantee it functions correctly and consistently across all scenarios.

text: The application shall be able to complete every user transaction within one fourth of a second of receiving the request over the network.
ethical_us:
Title: Efficient Transaction Processing for Enhanced Trust

Description: As a user, I want the application to complete every transaction within one fourth of a second of receiving the request over the network, so that I can trust the system's reliability and effectiveness.

Work: 
- Benchmark the existing transaction processing time to identify any bottlenecks.
- Optimize the network and server configurations to reduce latency.
- Implement performance testing to ensure the application consistently meets the speed requirement.
- Monitor real-time transaction processing to promptly address any deviations from the expected performance.
- Update documentation to transparently communicate the application's capabilities and limitations in terms of transaction speed.

text: The application shall have a downtime of at most 10 minutes per year.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Trust

Title: Ensure High System Availability for Building User Trust

Description: As a user, I want the application to have a downtime of no more than 10 minutes per year so that I can trust the service reliability and ensure my operations are not disrupted.

Work:
- Monitor server performance and implement redundancy to prevent system failures.
- Set up automatic alerts for potential system issues to enable rapid response.
- Regularly update and maintain server infrastructure to ensure optimal performance.
- Conduct periodic audits and testing to verify system availability and reliability.
- Create a contingency plan and communication protocol for unplanned downtimes.

text: The application shall run on a web application server.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Trust

Title: Ensuring Application Reliability through Web Server Deployment

Description: As a user, I want the application to run on a web application server so that I can trust that it will operate reliably and consistently, ensuring secure and effective performance.

Work:
- Verify that the web application server is designed to handle expected user load without performance degradation.
- Ensure that the server's security features are up-to-date to prevent unauthorized access and data breaches.
- Confirm that regular updates and maintenance procedures are in place to keep the server running smoothly.
- Conduct thorough testing to ensure that the application behaves predictably and correctly under different usage scenarios.
- Document server deployment and maintenance processes clearly for transparency and accountability.

text: A primary database will be used to store cached data for active users.
ethical_us:
**Title: Protecting User Privacy in Data Storage**

**Description:** As a privacy-conscious user, I want my data to be securely stored in the primary database so that my personal information remains confidential and protected from unauthorized access.

**Work:**
- Ensure encryption of all cached data stored in the primary database.
- Implement strict access controls to prevent unauthorized access to user data.
- Conduct regular security audits of the database to identify potential vulnerabilities.
- Provide users with a clear privacy policy explaining data usage and storage practices.
- Implement data anonymization techniques where applicable to enhance user privacy.
- Ensure compliance with relevant data protection laws and regulations.

text: A secondary database will be used to store historical statistics and data.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Privacy in Historical Data Storage

Description: As a data privacy officer, I want to ensure that the secondary database used to store historical statistics and data is secure and compliant with privacy regulations so that individuals' personal data is protected and their privacy is not jeopardized.

Work:
- Verify that the secondary database architecture supports data encryption both at rest and in transit.
- Ensure that access controls are implemented to restrict data access to authorized personnel only.
- Conduct a privacy impact assessment to identify and mitigate any potential privacy risks.
- Ensure that data anonymization techniques are applied to any personally identifiable information stored in the database.
- Implement regular audits and monitoring to detect any unauthorized access or data breaches.
- Verify that data retention policies are in place and adhered to, ensuring that data is not stored longer than necessary.
- Document compliance with all relevant data privacy laws and regulations.

text: Application updates shall occur between 3AM and 6 AM CST on Wednesday morning during the middle of the NFL season.
ethical_us:
Title: Minimize Disruption During Updates

Description: As a sports enthusiast, I want application updates to occur during late-night hours on Wednesday mornings, so that my experience of watching NFL games is not interrupted by maintenance.

Work: 
- Ensure updates are scheduled between 3 AM and 6 AM CST on Wednesdays.
- Verify automated notifications are sent to users 24 hours before the update.
- Test the system to confirm updates are completed successfully without impacting user activity.
- Conduct user feedback surveys to assess satisfaction with update timing to prevent disruption.

text: New System version releases shall be released at the beginning of each NFL season.
ethical_us:
Title: Timely Release of System Updates for Enhanced Trust

Description: As an NFL fan, I want system version releases to be available at the beginning of each NFL season so that I can trust and rely on the system for a smooth experience during the games.

Work: 
- Verify the timely scheduling of system version release to align with the NFL season start date.
- Ensure thorough testing of new system versions for reliability and security before deployment.
- Communicate release plans and updates to users well in advance.
- Prepare support resources to handle potential issues immediately after release.
- Conduct post-release evaluations to confirm system performance and user satisfaction.

text: The RFS system should be available 24/7  especially during the budgeting period. The RFS system shall be available 90% of the time all year  and 98% during the budgeting period. 2% of the time  the system will become available within 1 hour of the time that the situation is reported.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensure RFS System Reliability and Accessibility

Description: As a finance officer, I want the RFS system to be accessible 24/7, especially during the budgeting period, so that I can fulfill my responsibilities efficiently and without interruption.

Work:
- Ensure the system uptime is maintained at 90% annually.
- Guarantee that system availability rises to 98% during the budgeting period.
- Implement protocols to restore system access within 1 hour during the 2% downtime instances after the situation is reported.
- Conduct regular system audits and stress tests to identify and address potential vulnerabilities.
- Establish a dedicated support team available to address accessibility issues swiftly, especially during critical periods.
- Provide transparent communication to users regarding expected downtimes and measures taken to address them.

text: 98% of the user workstations shall meet the minimum hardware requirements prior to implementation. Minimum Hard Disk Space:  400MB.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensure Hardware Readiness for Ethical AI Deployment

Description: As an IT administrator, I want to ensure that 98% of user workstations meet the minimum hardware requirements of 400MB hard disk space prior to AI implementation, so that the system performs efficiently and responsibly, avoiding any potential operational harm.

Work: 
- Verify the current hardware specifications of all user workstations.
- Identify workstations that do not meet the minimum requirements.
- Upgrade or replace hardware components on workstations that fall short of the requirements.
- Conduct a compliance check confirming that 98% of workstations meet or exceed the 400MB hard disk space requirement.
- Provide a report on the compliance status of all workstations before implementation.
- Validate the upgraded workstations' performance to ensure no harm or disruption in user activities.

text: 98% of the user workstations shall meet the minimum software requirements prior to implementation: Microsoft Internet Explorer 5.0. Microsoft .NET Framework 1.1. Microsoft Internet Explorer Web Controls
ethical_us:
**Title:** Ensuring Software Readiness for Compliance and Non-maleficence

**Description:** As an IT administrator, I want to ensure that 98% of user workstations meet the minimum software requirements prior to implementation so that the new system is operational without causing harm or disruption to user productivity.

**Work:**
- Verify that 98% of workstations have Microsoft Internet Explorer 5.0 installed.
- Ensure that Microsoft .NET Framework 1.1 is installed on 98% of user workstations.
- Confirm that Microsoft Internet Explorer Web Controls are present on 98% of workstations.
- Conduct a pilot test to identify potential issues with unmet software requirements.
- Provide a contingency plan for the 2% of workstations that do not meet requirements.
- Communicate clear instructions to all users to facilitate a smooth implementation process.

text: The RFS system should be able to easily interface with the BDW environment  in order to load the data. \95
ethical_us:
Title: Seamless Integration for Transparent Data Exchange

Description: As a Data Analyst, I want the RFS system to easily interface with the BDW environment in order to load data efficiently and transparently so that I can ensure data analysis processes are clear and replicable.

Work: 
- Verify that the RFS system interface with the BDW environment is implemented and operational.
- Confirm that data loading processes are documented and accessible to relevant stakeholders.
- Ensure that the data transfer between RFS and BDW is traceable, with logs that are easy to understand.
- Conduct a test scenario to check for any data discrepancies during the transfer and ensure resolution mechanisms are in place.
- Provide training material or sessions to explain how the interfacing works and how to monitor it.

text: Changes to revenue and expense formulae must be applied to the RFS system  every year  prior to the budgeting process start. Revenue and expense formulae will be updated within one week of their receipt  after which 2 weeks will be allotted to testing of the budget calculations  to be conducted jointly by the project development team and PCG Finance.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Accurate and Transparent Budgeting Calculations

Description: As a Budget Analyst in the PCG Finance team, I want to ensure that revenue and expense formulae are updated and tested in the RFS system prior to the budgeting process so that we maintain accuracy and transparency in our financial projections.

Work:
- Receive updated revenue and expense formulae every year.
- Ensure formulae are applied to the RFS system within one week of receipt.
- Allocate two weeks to thoroughly test updated budget calculations.
- Conduct joint tests with the project development team to verify accuracy.
- Document any discrepancies or changes needed during testing.
- Finalize and confirm tested and updated formulae before the budgeting process starts.
- Maintain a transparent log of changes and test results for future audits and reviews.

text: New branches/complexes/districts/regions and revenue/expense accounts added to the BDW  must be reflected in the RFS system. 100% of the entities (mentioned above) available as of October month-end  will be loaded into the RFS system  prior to the budget start process.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Transparency

Title: Ensure Transparency in System Data Updates

Description: As a financial analyst, I want new branches, complexes, districts, regions, and revenue/expense accounts added to the Business Data Warehouse (BDW) to be reflected in the Revenue Financial System (RFS) so that I can ensure accurate financial reporting and budgeting processes with full visibility of data changes.

Work: 
- Verify that all new entities in the BDW as of October month-end are identified and listed.
- Ensure the data integration process is in place to load the identified entities into the RFS system.
- Confirm that 100% of the entities are loaded into the RFS before the budget start process.
- Test and validate the data reflection from BDW to RFS for accuracy and completeness.
- Document the process and results for transparency and future audits.

text: Only authorized user shall access the RFS system. ONLY users that exist in the UAS system  with the RFS system assigned to their role(s)  shall access the RFS system and use it.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Authorized Access to RFS System

Description: As a system administrator, I want to ensure that only authorized users who exist in the UAS system and have the RFS system assigned to their roles can access and use the RFS system, so that we protect user privacy and maintain system security.

Work:
- Verify that the UAS system accurately reflects the current list of authorized users.
- Ensure role assignments clearly designate access permissions to the RFS system within the UAS system.
- Implement access controls within the RFS system to require verification of user roles against the UAS system.
- Conduct testing to confirm that only users with correct role assignments in the UAS can access the RFS system.
- Document the access control process and update as necessary to maintain security standards.

text: User access should be limited to the permissions granted to their role(s) Each level in the PCG hierarchy will be assigned a role and users will be assigned to these roles. Access to functionality within RFS system is dependent on the privileges/permission assigned to the role..
ethical_us:
Title: Role-Based Access Control for Ethical Data Security

Description: As a system administrator, I want to ensure that user access is limited to the permissions granted to their role(s) so that we maintain privacy and uphold data security within the RFS system.

Work:
- Verify that each user in the system is assigned to a specific role corresponding to their position within the PCG hierarchy.
- Ensure that roles are accurately defined with appropriate privileges/permissions that align with organizational data security policies.
- Implement functionality that restricts user access to only the features permitted by their role.
- Test the access restrictions to confirm they effectively prevent unauthorized actions or data access.
- Monitor roles and user assignments regularly to adjust permissions as needed according to evolving responsibilities or organizational changes.

text: The product must comply with the intranet page standards and requirements of ENET Securities. 95% of the product look & feel will be approved by the Architecture group  prior to implementation. The remaining 5% will be corrected and approved within one month of product release.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Interface Compliance with Standards

Description: As an architectural review board member, I want the product's look and feel to comply with ENET Securities' intranet standards so that the product maintains consistency, trust, and usability across company platforms.

Work: 
- Ensure 95% of the product's interface design is approved by the Architecture group prior to implementation.
- Incorporate feedback from the Architecture group for any discrepancies found in the design.
- Implement any necessary corrections to the remaining 5% of the product within one month of release.
- Conduct a follow-up review session to ensure all aspects meet the intranet standards.
- Obtain final approval from the Architecture group after all corrections are made. 

The most related ethical principle to this requirement is "Trust," as it emphasizes maintaining consistency and assuring stakeholders through compliance and final approvals, fostering trust in the product and the organization.

text: The intranet pages should display appropriately in all resolutions  from 800x600 and higher. The display of all the pages will be correct in 95% of the resolutions  prior to implementation. The remaining 5% will be corrected within a week of notification of the incorrect display.
ethical_us:
**Title:** Ensure Intranet Page Display Compatibility Across Resolutions

**Description:** As a **content manager**, I want the intranet pages to display appropriately in all resolutions from 800x600 and higher so that **users have a consistent and reliable experience, ensuring fairness and accessibility regardless of their device.**

**Work:**
- Verify that intranet pages display correctly at all specified resolutions before implementation.
- Ensure that 95% of the resolutions are tested and adjusted for correct display.
- Develop a process for users to report display issues easily.
- Within one week of receiving a notification, address any incorrect displays in the remaining 5% of resolutions.
- Conduct follow-up testing to confirm corrections are successfully implemented and the visual integrity is maintained.

text: The users should be able to easily use the system to successfully complete their budgets  within the stipulated time for completion. With a week of training prior to product implementation  98% of the users shall complete their budgets within the stipulated time.
ethical_us:
**Title: User-Friendly Budgeting System for Efficient Completion**

**Description:** As an employee with budgeting responsibilities, I want to easily use the system to successfully complete my budgets within the stipulated time frame so that I can meet my deadlines and have confidence in my financial planning.

**Work:**
- Ensure the user interface is intuitive and easy to navigate, minimizing potential confusion.
- Provide a comprehensive training program one week before product implementation to all users.
- Design a help system with FAQs and step-by-step guides that can assist users in real-time.
- Test the system's ease of use with a diverse group of employees to ensure accessibility and usability.
- Collect feedback from users post-training to identify and address any remaining usability challenges.
- Set up a query management system where users can get immediate help during the budgeting process. 

This user story aligns with the ethical principle of **Responsibility**, as it reflects the duty of the developers to create an easy-to-use system, ensure proper training, and support users to complete tasks efficiently and effectively.

text: The product interface should be fast. The response time of the product interface should not exceed 2 seconds 90% of the time. For 10% of the time  the response time should not be more than 10 seconds.not be more than 10 seconds.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Responsive User Experience

Description: As an end user, I want the product interface to respond quickly and efficiently so that I can complete my tasks without unnecessary delays and frustration.

Work:
- Ensure the product interface responds within 2 seconds at least 90% of the time.
- Verify that for the remaining 10% of interactions, the response time does not exceed 10 seconds.
- Conduct thorough testing under various conditions to ensure response times align with specified criteria.
- Implement performance monitoring tools to track and report interface response times in real-time.
- Optimize backend processes to enhance overall system performance and reduce latency.
- Provide user feedback mechanisms for reporting instances where response time exceeds expected limits.

text: The system shall operate on Unix and Windows operating systems.
ethical_us:
Title: Cross-Platform Compatibility for Inclusivity

Description: As a diverse group of users, I want the system to operate on both Unix and Windows operating systems so that everyone, regardless of their platform preference or requirement, can access and use the system without discrimination.

Work: 
- Ensure the system is installed and runs smoothly on Unix operating systems.
- Ensure the system is installed and runs smoothly on Windows operating systems.
- Conduct compatibility and performance tests on both Unix and Windows platforms.
- Provide documentation on system requirements and installation procedures for both operating systems.
- Gather user feedback from both Unix and Windows users to address any platform-specific issues and enhance the overall user experience.

text: The system shall be evoked by typing “pine” into a command or shell prompt.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Transparency

Title: Enable Transparent Invocation of the System

Description: As a command-line user, I want to evoke the system by typing “pine” into a command or shell prompt so that I can transparently access the system's features with clear and straightforward commands.

Work:
- Acceptance Criteria:
  1. The system should accept the string “pine” as a valid command to start the application.
  2. Provide clear documentation that explains the purpose of the “pine” command.
  3. Ensure that typing “pine” gives immediate feedback that the system is being evoked.
  4. Log the use of the “pine” command in a manner that respects user privacy, ensuring traceability and accountability.
  5. Develop and provide a help command or option that further explains functionalities accessible via “pine.”

text: The system shall use the SMTP mail protocol.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensure Secure and Trustworthy Email Communication

Description: As an IT administrator, I want the system to use the SMTP mail protocol securely and effectively so that users can trust our email communications and ensure data sent via email is protected.

Work:
- Verify that the SMTP configuration adheres to the latest security standards and protocols.
- Implement encryption for email transmissions to prevent unauthorized access.
- Conduct regular security audits and checks to maintain the integrity and trustworthiness of the system.
- Ensure clear communication about the security measures in place for email transmission to enhance user trust.
- Provide training sessions for related stakeholders on the usage and implications of the SMTP mail protocol in terms of security and trust.

text: The system shall support the ability to perform a send and receive operation.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Ethical Communication through Transparent Send/Receive Operations

Description: As a user, I want to perform send and receive operations with full transparency so that I can understand how my data is being handled and trust that the system is operating ethically.

Work: 
- Log each send and receive operation with timestamps and data size.
- Provide clear notifications to users before each operation detailing what data will be sent or received.
- Offer detailed logs and reports that users can access to verify past operations.
- Ensure the data handling process is explained in simple language that is accessible to all users.
- Implement an easy-to-understand consent process for users before any data exchange occurs.
- Provide users with options to review and revoke permissions for send and receive operations at any time.

text: The system shall support the ability to perform a send only operation.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Freedom and Autonomy

Title: Enable Users to Perform Send-Only Operations

Description: As a privacy-conscious user, I want to perform send-only operations so that I can control my communication preferences and protect my personal data from unintended sharing.

Work: 
- Ensure the system provides a clear option for send-only operations in the user interface.
- Implement backend functionality that limits data transmission to sending only, without receiving data.
- Provide users with detailed information about what send-only operations entail and how it benefits their autonomy and privacy.
- Test the system to confirm that no data is received unexpectedly during a send-only operation.
- Include documentation that explains how users can enable or disable send-only operations at any time.

text: The system shall support the ability to perform a receive only operation.
ethical_us:
Title: Enabling Secure Data Reception

Description: As a data security officer, I want to ensure the system supports a receive-only operation so that I can protect sensitive information and maintain user privacy.

Work: 
- Verify that the system allows data to be received without the ability to send or manipulate outgoing information.
- Ensure encryption protocols are implemented for all incoming data.
- Validate that user access controls are in place to restrict data handling to authorized personnel only.
- Conduct thorough testing to confirm that the receive-only operation prevents unauthorized data transmission.
- Document the receive-only feature functionality and provide transparency about its operation to stakeholders.

text: The system shall use a text-based interface to display a listing of available mail.
ethical_us:
**Title:** Ensuring Understandable Email Access Interface

**Description:** As an email user with accessibility needs, I want to interact with a text-based interface to display a listing of available mail so that I can easily and clearly access my emails regardless of my visual or cognitive abilities.

**Work:**
- Ensure the text-based interface is intuitive and easy to navigate for all users.
- Include customizable text size and contrast settings for better accessibility.
- Provide keyboard navigation support for users who prefer not using a mouse.
- Implement clear labeling and headings to assist users in understanding and navigating the email list.
- Test the interface with a diverse group of users to gather feedback on usability and clarity.

text: The system shall have a help system that offers tips and explanation for each screen and each item on the screens upon demand.
ethical_us:
Title: Interactive Help System for User Clarity

Description: As a user, I want to access a help system that offers tips and explanations for each screen and item on demand so that I can better understand and navigate the system with ease.

Work:
- Ensure that each screen has an accessible help icon or button prominently displayed.
- Develop context-sensitive help pop-ups that provide clear and concise explanations for each item on the screen.
- Implement a search function within the help system to find specific topics or tips.
- Allow users to give feedback on the help content for continuous improvement.
- Test the help system with a diverse group of users to ensure explanations are understandable and effective. 

Ethical Principle: Transparency

text: The system shall allow a text search that users may use to find mail messages.
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent Mail Message Search 

Description: As a regular email user, I want to use a text search to find mail messages so that I can quickly access the information I need without unnecessary complexity or hidden processes.

Work:
- Ensure the search functionality is easy to locate and use within the email system interface.
- Provide a clear explanation of how the search algorithm retrieves and prioritizes results.
- Offer users an option to sort search results based on different criteria (date, relevance, sender).
- Clearly communicate any limitations of the search feature, such as what types of content it can and cannot search.
- Provide a user guide or help section explaining the search function's capabilities and common troubleshooting steps. 

This user story aligns with the principle of Transparency, ensuring that the text search feature is comprehensible and effectively communicates its capabilities and limitations to users.

text: The system search feature should support the use of regular expressions in search.
ethical_us:
Title: Enhanced Search Capability for Understanding and Transparency

Description: As a data analyst, I want to use regular expressions in the system's search feature so that I can efficiently retrieve specific data patterns, leading to more informed and transparent decision-making processes.

Work: 
- Implement support for regular expressions within the search function.
- Ensure that the search feature provides clear and understandable instructions or examples for using regular expressions.
- Test the search feature with various regular expression patterns to confirm accuracy and reliability.
- Document the use of regular expressions in the system's help or FAQ section for user reference.
- Provide a user-friendly interface for constructing and testing regular expressions within the search feature.

text: The system shall provide an option to withdraw money.
ethical_us:
**Title:** Empowering Financial Autonomy through Withdrawal Options

**Description:** As a bank customer, I want to withdraw money from my account so that I can have access to cash when needed and manage my finances autonomously.

**Work:**

1. Ensure a secure authentication process for customers accessing their accounts to initiate a withdrawal.
2. Provide clear and understandable instructions within the user interface for withdrawing money.
3. Allow users to select the desired amount and preferred method of withdrawal, such as ATM, teller, or online transfer.
4. Implement safeguards to prevent overdraft or unauthorized withdrawals.
5. Maintain transparency regarding any fees associated with the withdrawal process.
6. Confirm transactions with a detailed receipt, available both electronically and in print.
7. Provide easily accessible customer support to help with any withdrawal-related queries or issues. 

This user story relates most to the ethical principle of "Freedom and Autonomy," ensuring that users have the capability and independence to manage their financial matters effectively and safely.

text: The system shall query the user for the amount of money.
ethical_us:
Based on the requirement "The system shall query the user for the amount of money," the most relevant ethical principle relates to "Transparency." This principle ensures that users clearly understand why and how the information about the amount of money is being requested and used, which enhances trust and informed decision-making.

Title: Transparent Inquiry for Monetary Transactions

Description: As a user, I want the system to transparently query me for the amount of money required for a transaction so that I can understand the purpose and context of the request and make informed decisions.

Work:
- The system must provide a clear explanation of why the amount of money is being requested.
- The system must offer insights into how the requested amount will be used or processed.
- The system must ensure that users can easily access further information or clarification about the monetary transaction if needed.
- The system must allow users to confirm or cancel the transaction after understanding the request.
- The user interface must present information in a user-friendly manner, using layman's terms to enhance understandability.

text: The system shall query the user for the account type.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Transparent User Account Type Selection

Description: As a user, I want to be transparently informed about the different account types available and their specific features, so that I can make an informed decision regarding the most suitable account type for my needs.

Work:
- The system shall provide a clear and concise explanation of each account type and its features to the user.
- The system shall offer a comparison table highlighting the differences between the account types.
- The system shall display any terms and conditions related to each account type before the user makes a selection.
- The system shall include a FAQ section addressing common questions about account types to assist users in their decision-making.
- The system shall ensure that all information presented is easily accessible and understandable for users.

text: The system shall validate the amount is available in the user’s account before releasing funds to the user.
ethical_us:
### Title: Ensuring Responsible Fund Release

#### Description:
As a bank customer, I want the system to validate that the amount is available in my account before releasing funds so that I can ensure responsible financial management and avoid overdrafts.

#### Work:
- The system must check the account balance in real-time before permitting any withdrawal or fund transfer.
- Provide a clear notification or message to the user if the account balance is insufficient for the transaction.
- Ensure the validation process is quick and does not delay the transaction unnecessarily.
- Log the validation check and resulting transaction status for accountability and audit purposes.

text: The system shall validate the amount is a multiple of $20.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensure Transaction Fairness

Description: As a bank customer, I want the system to validate that transaction amounts are multiples of $20, so that the transactional fairness and transparency are maintained in my cash withdrawals or deposits.

Work:
- Verify that the transaction input field only accepts amounts that are multiples of $20.
- Provide real-time feedback to the user if they enter an invalid amount, including suggestions for valid amounts.
- Ensure all transaction records accurately reflect the validation check.
- Confirm that customer service representatives are informed about this rule to assist users effectively.
- Conduct user testing to ensure the rule is clear and understandable to customers.

text: The system shall debit the user’s account upon withdrawal of funds.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Trust

Title: Ensure Transparent and Trustworthy Account Debiting

Description: As a bank customer, I want the system to clearly notify and provide details when my account is debited upon withdrawal of funds so that I can trust the system and manage my financial transactions confidently.

Work: 
- Acceptance Criteria:
  1. Verify that the system sends a notification via a chosen communication method (e.g., SMS, email, app notification) immediately upon a withdrawal transaction.
  2. Ensure the notification includes the transaction amount, date, time, and updated account balance.
  3. Allow the user to access a transaction history log with detailed records of all debiting activities.
  4. Implement security measures to authenticate the transaction and ensure it is performed by the authorized user.
  5. Provide an option for users to report any unauthorized transactions easily.

text: The system shall be able to issue a specific amount of money to the user.
ethical_us:
Title: Secure and Transparent Financial Transaction Process

Description: As a bank customer, I want the system to issue a specific amount of money to me efficiently and securely so that I can access my funds without any risk or uncertainty.

Work: 
- The system must ensure that each transaction is verified and authenticated to maintain security.
- The system should provide a clear and understandable confirmation message outlining the details of the transaction (amount, date, time).
- Users must receive a digital receipt or notification after the transaction is completed for transparency.
- The transaction process must comply with all relevant financial regulations and standards for transparency and trust.
- User data and transaction details should be handled according to privacy and data protection laws.
- The system must record logs of each transaction to ensure accountability and allow audits if necessary. 

Ethical Principle: Trust - This user story ensures that the system builds trust with users by processing transactions securely, transparently, and adhering to all necessary regulations.

text: The meeting scheduler system shall be able to select a participant as an important participant.
ethical_us:
Title: Prioritizing Participants in Scheduling for Fairness 

Description: As a meeting organizer, I want to be able to select a participant as an important participant so that their availability is prioritized in the scheduling process and ensures fairness in participation.

Work:
- The system must allow the organizer to designate specific participants as important during the meeting setup.
- The system must incorporate the availability of important participants into the automatic scheduling algorithm.
- The system must notify the organizer if conflicts arise with the important participants’ schedules and propose alternative solutions.
- The system must ensure that prioritizing important participants does not unfairly exclude or marginalize others.
- The system should provide a summary of how participant priorities were considered in generating the final meeting schedule.

text: The meeting scheduler system shall cancel a meeting due to canceling of an important participant.
ethical_us:
Title: Maintain Participant Equality in Meetings

Description: As a meeting organizer, I want the system to automatically cancel a meeting if an important participant cancels so that no unfair power dynamics or exclusions occur among meeting participants.

Work:
- Verify that the system can identify important participants based on predefined criteria.
- Implement functionality to automatically check if an important participant has canceled their attendance.
- Ensure the system sends immediate notifications to all participants about the meeting cancellation.
- Provide participants with a reason for the cancellation to maintain transparency.
- Allow organizers to easily reschedule the meeting while ensuring the availability of the important participant.

text: The meeting scheduler system shall reschedule a meeting to support conflict resolutions.
ethical_us:
Title: Supportive Meeting Rescheduling for Conflict Resolution

Description: As a meeting participant, I want the meeting scheduler system to reschedule meetings in a way that aids conflict resolutions, so that all participants can attend meetings without scheduling conflicts and maintain harmonious collaboration.

Work:
- Ensure the system detects scheduling conflicts among participants’ calendars.
- Implement automated suggestions for new meeting times that accommodate all participants.
- Notify participants of changes and provide options to accept or propose alternative schedules.
- Allow for manual intervention by users to adjust or finalize rescheduled meetings if needed.
- Log change histories and provide transparency in decision-making for reschedules.

text: The meeting scheduler shall be accessed from the Web.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Equal Access to the Meeting Scheduler

Description: As an employee who relies on scheduling meetings, I want to access the meeting scheduler from the Web so that I can efficiently manage my schedule from any location and device without limitations.

Work:
- Ensure the meeting scheduler has a responsive design compatible with mobile and desktop browsers.
- Verify compatibility with various web browsers (e.g., Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge).
- Implement accessibility standards, including screen reader compatibility and keyboard navigation.
- Provide clear instructions and help resources online for users accessing the scheduler.
- Regularly test web access functionality for security and usability. 

Related Ethical Principle: Justice and Fairness

This principle aligns with ensuring that all users, regardless of their location or device, have equal access to the meeting scheduler, thereby promoting fairness and reducing barriers to its usage.

text: The meeting scheduler system may (optionally) automatically propose another meeting if current meeting is canceled by an important participant.
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent Rescheduling for Canceled Meetings

Description: As a meeting organizer, I want the meeting scheduler system to automatically propose an alternative meeting when an important participant cancels, so that the scheduling process is seamless and aware of participants' priorities, maintaining transparency in decision-making.

Work:

1. System detects cancellation by an important participant and notifies all involved parties immediately.
2. The system uses predefined criteria to evaluate participant importance and communicates this rationale to the meeting organizer.
3. Automatically suggest alternative meeting times, ensuring the rescheduling criteria and process are clear to all participants.
4. Provide an option for the meeting organizer to override or modify the system-suggested meeting times.
5. Ensure that the information about the importance of the participants and alternate scheduling is accessible and understandable to all participants.

text: The meeting scheduler system may provide the “meeting initiator” a summary of the scan of “potential meeting participants” showing available “time slots” and schedule conflicts as a means of informing the “meeting initiator” of the overall results of the system.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Transparency

Title: Transparent Meeting Availability Summary for Initiators

Description: As a meeting initiator, I want to receive a clear and transparent summary of potential meeting participants' available time slots and any scheduling conflicts so that I can make informed decisions when proposing meeting times.

Work:
- The system must generate a summarized report of participants' available time slots and conflicts without revealing personal calendar details.
- Ensure the summary is presented in a clear, understandable format that highlights key information at a glance.
- Provide an option for meeting initiators to request additional clarification or explanation of the summarized data if needed.
- Implement clear documentation within the system that explains how scheduling data is aggregated and summarized.
- Ensure that privacy agreements regarding data usage for generating summaries are clearly communicated to all users.

text: The meeting scheduler system may be able to include an agenda for a meeting proposal.
ethical_us:
**Title: Transparent Meeting Agenda Inclusion**

**Description:** As a meeting organizer, I want to include an agenda in the meeting proposal so that all participants are fully informed and can prepare adequately for the discussion topics.

**Work:**  
- The system must allow the meeting organizer to add a detailed agenda to the meeting proposal.  
- The agenda should be easily accessible and clearly displayed to all invitees when they receive the meeting proposal.  
- Ensure that any updates or changes to the agenda are automatically communicated to all participants.  
- Provide an option for participants to confirm their understanding of the agenda prior to the meeting.

text: The meeting scheduler system may suggest a “virtual meeting” for available “time slots” if no location is available or feasible for the meeting.
ethical_us:
Title: Facilitating Accessibility in Meeting Schedules

Description: As a remote team member, I want the meeting scheduler system to suggest virtual meetings when no physical location is available or feasible so that I can participate equally and effectively regardless of geographical constraints.

Work:
- The system should automatically propose virtual meeting options when no physical meeting space is available.
- Users should receive a notification with suggested virtual meeting times and links.
- Ensure the virtual meeting platform is accessible from various devices and locations.
- Provide an option for users to confirm or suggest alternative time slots conveniently.
- Maintain clear communication and easy access to virtual meeting details for all participants.

text: The meeting scheduler system may be able to include a list of required equipment for a meeting proposal.
ethical_us:
**Title:** Equipment Transparency in Meeting Scheduler

**Description:** As a meeting organizer, I want to include a list of required equipment for a meeting proposal so that all participants are informed about the necessary resources and can adequately prepare or provide feedback if adjustments are needed.

**Work:**
- Ensure that the meeting scheduling interface allows organizers to add a list of equipment needed for each meeting proposal.
- Implement a feature that automatically notifies all participants about the equipment requirements when they receive the meeting invitation.
- Provide an option for participants to acknowledge receipt of the equipment list and confirm their ability to meet the requirements.
- Add a feedback mechanism for participants to raise concerns or suggest alternatives regarding the proposed equipment before the meeting date.
- Develop a clear and understandable guide for organizers on how to effectively use the equipment listing feature to promote transparency.

text: A meeting scheduler system will temporarily reserve the “time slots” for the proposed meeting.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Transparency

Title: Ensure Clear Communication of Meeting Slot Reservations 

Description: As a meeting participant, I want the meeting scheduler system to transparently inform me when my time slots are temporarily reserved for a proposed meeting, so that I am aware of changes to my availability and can plan my schedule accordingly.

Work:
- The system should visibly mark temporarily reserved time slots on the user's calendar interface.
- An email notification should be sent to the user detailing which time slots have been reserved and for what purpose.
- The system must offer a clear explanation on how long the reservation will last and under what conditions it might be released.
- A user-friendly option should be provided to confirm attendance or reject the reservation, offering a clear path forward for both actions.
- The interface should include a help section or FAQ that explains the reservation process in a transparent manner, ensuring users understand the system's workings.

text: A meeting scheduler system will inform the “potential meeting participant” of the meeting.
ethical_us:
**Title: Transparent Meeting Notification System**

**Description:** As a potential meeting participant, I want to be informed about scheduled meetings so that I am aware of my commitments and can plan accordingly.

**Work:** 
- The system must automatically notify me via email or preferred communication method about upcoming meetings.
- Notification should include the date, time, and agenda of the meeting.
- I should be able to access further details about the meeting by opting for more information through a provided link.
- Notifications must be sent promptly upon scheduling a meeting or whenever there are changes.
- The system must provide a log of all notifications sent for verification and records. 

**Related Ethical Principle:** Transparency – The user requires clear communication and understandability about meetings they are part of, ensuring that they are always kept informed.

text: The system must be easy to use by both managers and chefs such that they do not need to read an extensive amount of manuals.
ethical_us:
Title: Intuitive and Accessible System Interface

Description: As a manager or chef, I want to use the system with ease without needing to read a large amount of manuals so that I can efficiently perform my tasks without unnecessary delays and confusion, promoting a user-friendly environment.

Work:
- The system interface must be designed based on user-centered design principles to ensure ease of use.
- Conduct usability testing with a diverse group of managers and chefs to gather feedback on interface design.
