- Incorporate features such as tooltips, guided tours, and contextual help to assist users in real-time.
- Simplify navigation paths and make frequently used functionalities easily accessible.
- Ensure that the language and terminology used within the system are clear and aligned with industry standards.
- Implement a feedback mechanism for users to report difficulties or suggest improvements.
- Provide a concise and easy-to-search digital manual or help resource for users who want further clarification.

text: The system must be quickly accessible by both managers and chefs.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Fair Access to System for Managers and Chefs

Description: As a restaurant staff member, I want to be able to access the system quickly, regardless of whether I am a manager or chef, so that I can perform my duties efficiently and without unnecessary delays.

Work: 
- Ensure the system login interface is user-friendly and quick to access.
- Validate that system load times are optimized for users with varying roles.
- Implement role-based access controls that allow easy navigation to necessary features for both managers and chefs.
- Perform user testing with both managers and chefs to confirm that the system meets their accessibility needs.
- Monitor and address any access-related issues promptly to maintain fair use. 

Ethical Principle: Justice and fairness, ensuring equal and fair access to the system for both managers and chefs without discrimination or bias towards either role.

text: The system must be intuitive and simple in the way it displays all relevant data and relationships.
ethical_us:
**Title: Transparent Data Representation for Better Understanding**

**Description:** As a user, I want the system to be intuitive and simple in the way it displays all relevant data and relationships so that I can easily understand and make informed decisions based on the information presented.

**Work:**
- The interface displays data in a clear and organized manner, using charts and graphs where applicable.
- Data relationships are highlighted with visual aids, such as icons or connectors that indicate links between data points.
- A help section or tooltips are available to explain complex data terms or relationships.
- Users can customize the data view to focus on specific areas of interest or minimize less relevant information.
- Conduct user testing to ensure the interface is general and intuitive for a diverse range of users.
- The system provides an explanation for unexpected results or anomalies in data display to enhance user understanding.

text: The menus of the system must be easily navigable by the users with buttons that are easy to understand.
ethical_us:
Title: Intuitive Menu Navigation for Users

Description: As a user, I want the menus of the system to be easily navigable with buttons that are easy to understand so that I can effectively interact with the system without confusion or frustration.

Work: 
- Ensure all menu labels are clear and descriptive.
- Implement a consistent layout for menu items across all parts of the system.
- Conduct usability testing with diverse user groups to assess navigability and comprehension.
- Provide tooltips or guides for menu buttons to assist new users.
- Ensure menu navigation can be performed using a keyboard and is accessible to users with disabilities.
- Gather user feedback on the menu experience and make iterative improvements based on this feedback.

Related Ethical Principle: Transparency. By ensuring that the menus are easily navigable and understandable, we are enhancing the transparency of the AI technology to the users, which aligns with the principle of making systems understandable and accessible for effective communication and user interaction.

text: All the functions of the system must be available to the user every time the system is turned on.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Trust

Title: Consistent System Functionality Access

Description: As a user, I want to have access to all the functions of the system every time the system is turned on so that I can rely on its consistent performance and trust it to meet my needs without disruption.

Work: 
- Ensure that the system initializes all functionalities upon startup.
- Conduct regular testing to verify that all features are accessible after the system is powered on.
- Implement robust error handling to address and notify users of any temporary unavailability of functions.
- Provide clear communication or documentation for users regarding expected system behavior upon startup.
- Develop a feedback mechanism for users to report any discrepancies in functionality access.

text: The calculations performed by the system must comply according to the norms set by the user and should not vary unless explicitly changed by the user.
ethical_us:
**Title: Consistent Calculation Compliance**

**Description:** As a responsible system administrator, I want the calculations performed by the system to strictly comply with the norms set by the user without variation, unless explicitly changed by the user, so that the integrity and trustworthiness of the system decisions are maintained.

**Work (Acceptance Criteria):**

1. The system must clearly document the norms currently set for calculation processes.
2. The system should lock the calculation norms and ensure they remain unchanged unless an explicit change request is made by the user.
3. Any change to the calculation norms must require user authentication and confirmation.
4. The system should provide a log of all change requests and approvals related to calculation norms.
5. The system must notify users of successful changes in calculation norms and provide an option to revert changes if necessary.
6. Ensure that system alerts are triggered if any discrepancies from set norms are detected.

text: The client should agree to EULA before using our software.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Informed Consent Before Software Usage

Description: As a responsible software developer, I want users to agree to the End User License Agreement (EULA) before using our software so that they are fully informed about the terms of use, ensuring transparency and fostering trust.

Work:
- Display the EULA prominently before the first use of the software.
- Ensure the EULA is written in clear, understandable language.
- Implement a mechanism for users to acknowledge they have read and accept the EULA terms.
- Provide an option for users to download or print the EULA for their records.
- Verify that users have agreed to the EULA before granting access to the software.
- Allow users to easily access the EULA within the software for future reference.

text: All Web pages generated by the system shall be fully downloadable in no more than 10 seconds over a 40KBps modem connection.
ethical_us:
**Title:** Efficient Web Page Accessibility

**Description:** As a user with limited internet bandwidth, I want to download all web pages generated by the system in no more than 10 seconds over a 40KBps modem connection, so that I can have equitable access to information without undue delay and frustration.

**Work:**
- Ensure the system compresses web pages effectively to accommodate users with low-speed connections.
- Validate that all web pages load within the specified time frame when tested on a 40KBps modem connection.
- Implement and test fallback strategies for high-bandwidth elements to maintain performance on slow connections.
- Conduct usability testing with users on low-speed connections to ensure the experience meets expectations.
- Provide documentation and support on how to optimize performance for users with limited bandwidth. 

The related ethical principle here is **Justice and Fairness**, ensuring that all users, regardless of their internet connection speed, have fair access to web content.

text: Responses to queries shall take no longer than 7 seconds to load onto the screen after the user submits the query.
ethical_us:
Title: Timely Response for Enhanced User Trust

Description: As a user, I want the responses to my queries to load within 7 seconds after submission so that I can trust the efficiency and reliability of the system.

Work:
- Ensure the system infrastructure is optimized for speed and efficiency.
- Implement performance monitoring tools to track response times.
- Conduct regular load testing to ensure the system can handle peak traffic without delays.
- Provide users with visual feedback if loading exceeds the 7-second mark.
- Have a contingency plan to address and rectify any factors causing extended loading times.
- Continuously optimize backend processes and algorithms for faster response rates.

text: The system shall display confirmation messages to users within 4 seconds after the user submits information to the system.
ethical_us:
Title: Prompt Feedback for Improved User Trust

Description: As a user, I want to receive confirmation messages within 4 seconds after submitting information to the system so that I can trust that my data has been processed correctly and securely.

Work: 
- Ensure that a confirmation message is triggered immediately upon user data submission.
- Develop the system to process and display confirmation messages within 4 seconds.
- Conduct performance tests to verify that the system consistently meets the 4-second response time.
- Implement an alert system to notify developers if the response time exceeds 4 seconds.
- Create user feedback mechanisms for reporting issues with response times.

text: Users shall be required to log in to the Cafeteria Ordering System for all operations except viewing a menu.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring User Privacy and Security Through Authentication

Description: As a user, I want to be required to log in to the Cafeteria Ordering System for all operations except viewing a menu, so that my personal information and order history are protected, maintaining my privacy and security.

Work: 
- Implement a secure login mechanism for the Cafeteria Ordering System.
- Ensure that all user operations (except viewing the menu) prompt for a login.
- Encrypt and protect user credentials and personal data.
- Provide users with information on how their data is stored and protected.
- Allow users to manage and update their login credentials easily.
- Test the system for security vulnerabilities and fix any identified issues.

text: Patrons shall log in according to the restricted computer system access policy.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Secure and Responsible Access for Patrons

Description: As a system administrator, I want patrons to log in according to the restricted computer system access policy so that unauthorized access is prevented and data security is maintained, ensuring responsible use and protection of sensitive information.

Work: 
- Implement user authentication mechanisms that align with the restricted access policy.
- Ensure multi-factor authentication is enforced for logging in.
- Provide clear instructions and communication to patrons on the login process and access policy requirements.
- Monitor login activities to detect and prevent unauthorized access attempts.
- Regularly review and update the access policy to align with current security standards.

text: The system shall permit only cafeteria staff members who are on the list of authorized Menu Managers to create or edit menus.
ethical_us:
**Title:** Authorized Access to Menu Management

**Description:** As a cafeteria staff member, I want only authorized Menu Managers to be able to create or edit menus so that the integrity and accuracy of the menu offerings are maintained and unauthorized modifications are prevented.

**Work:**
- Ensure that a list of authorized Menu Managers is maintained and regularly updated.
- Implement authentication mechanisms to verify the identity of cafeteria staff members attempting to access menu management functions.
- Restrict access to menu creation and editing features only to those on the authorized list.
- Log all access attempts and modifications to the menu for accountability and auditing purposes.
- Provide training to authorized Menu Managers on secure and ethical access practices. 

The ethical principle most related to this requirement is **Responsibility**, as it emphasizes accountability, integrity, and safeguarding the menu management process by ensuring only authorized personnel have access.

text: Only users who have been authorized for home access to the corporate Intranet may use the COS from non-company locations.
ethical_us:
Title: Authorized Access to Corporate Intranet for Remote Users

Description: As a security-conscious employee, I want to access the corporate Intranet from non-company locations only if I am authorized, so that sensitive company information is protected from unauthorized access and potential breaches.

Work: 
- Verify user authorization credentials before granting access to the corporate Intranet from non-company locations.
- Implement robust authentication measures such as multi-factor authentication to enhance security.
- Ensure all data transmitted over the network is encrypted to maintain confidentiality and integrity.
- Regularly audit and update the list of authorized users to maintain accurate access control.
- Provide training to employees on secure access protocols and the importance of authorization. 

Ethical Principle: Privacy – This requirement is closely related to the ethical principle of privacy, as it ensures that only authorized users can access sensitive corporate data, thereby protecting personal and company information from unauthorized access.

text: Programmers and application developers will have access to source code to address bugs or system enhancements as deemed necessary. Network Administrator and DBA support is also required to maintain a 24x7 system uptime.
ethical_us:
The ethical principle most related to this requirement is Responsibility, as it highlights the accountability of developers, administrators, and support personnel in maintaining system uptime and addressing issues promptly.

Title: Ensuring System Reliability Through Access and Support

Description: As a Network Administrator, I want to have access to the source code and collaborate with Programmers and DBAs to address bugs or system enhancements as needed, so that we can maintain a 24x7 system uptime and ensure reliable operations.

Work:
- Programmers will have secure access to the source code for debugging and enhancements.
- Network Administrators will coordinate with Programmers to schedule necessary updates or fixes.
- DBA support will be available to assist with database-related issues affecting system performance.
- A communication protocol will be established for reporting and prioritizing system issues.
- Regular maintenance windows will be scheduled without disrupting critical operations.
- A monitoring system will be implemented to detect and alert the team of any system downtime or anomalies.
- Documentation of all changes, updates, and fixes will be maintained for accountability and transparency.

text: System security and access levels are provided in the online system. There are varying levels of system access and functional authority. Each student’s access is limited to his/her own registration records. Only authorized system administrator(s) has access to all student registration records.
ethical_us:
Title: Secure and Restricted Access to Student Records

Description: As a system user, I want to ensure that system security and access levels are implemented effectively so that only authorized individuals have appropriate access, maintaining the privacy and integrity of student registration records.

Work:
- Verify that student users can only access their own registration records.
- Ensure that varying levels of access are clearly defined and implemented within the system.
- Confirm only authorized system administrators have comprehensive access to all student registration records.
- Implement and test security protocols to prevent unauthorized access.
- Regularly review and update access policies to ensure continued compliance with privacy standards.

text: The online registration system is “self-service style” system that shall initially address the student registration needs.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Freedom and Autonomy

Title: Empower Students with Self-Service Registration

Description: As a student, I want to independently manage my registration process through a self-service online system so that I can exercise autonomy over my educational choices and schedule.

Work: 
- The registration system must be accessible to all enrolled students.
- Students should be able to view all available courses and their schedules.
- The system should allow students to add or drop courses within the official registration period.
- Provide clear instructions and support options for any technical issues encountered.
- Ensure the system is secure and protects student data privacy.
- Confirm successful registration with an email notification to the student.

text: All data entry forms for the application should match their Microsoft Excel hardcopy counterparts as closely as possible. Hardcopies of these forms were provided to the design team during the second requirements interview.
ethical_us:
Title: Alignment of Digital and Hardcopy Data Entry Forms

Description: As a data entry operator, I want the digital data entry forms to match their Microsoft Excel hardcopy counterparts as closely as possible so that I can ensure consistency and accuracy in data entry, enhancing transparency and reducing errors.

Work:
- Ensure that the digital fields in the data entry application mirror the layout and labels of the Excel hardcopy forms.
- Provide a clear and accessible guide on any differences between digital and hardcopy formats if they exist.
- Conduct usability testing with data entry operators to verify that the digital forms are intuitive and consistent with the hardcopies.
- Implement a feedback mechanism for operators to report discrepancies or improvements between digital and hardcopy forms.
- Document any changes or updates to forms and communicate these to all stakeholders in a timely manner.

text: 95% of users will not need to read the user manual to be able to use the application.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring User-Friendly Application Interface

Description: As an everyday user, I want to interact effortlessly with the application without needing to refer to a user manual, so that I can effectively utilize its features with minimal learning curve and maximize my productivity.

Work:
- Test the application interface with a diverse group of users to ensure 95% can operate it intuitively.
- Conduct usability testing sessions and gather feedback on user interface elements.
- Implement clear and concise in-app guidance and tooltips that aid user navigation.
- Ensure all features are easily accessible and understandable within the application design.
- Iterate design based on testing feedback to reduce dependency on external user manuals.

**Ethical Principle: Transparency**

This requirement aligns with the ethical principle of transparency, as it focuses on ensuring that the application is easily understandable, promoting clear communication between the technology and the user. By creating an intuitive and user-friendly interface, the potential for misunderstandings or misinterpretations is minimized, fostering a transparent interaction with the software.

text: Changes made to the Manage My ID website can be adopted without altering the iOS application.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Sustainability

Title: Ensure Independent Website Updates for Sustainable Development

Description: As a website developer, I want to make changes to the Manage My ID website without requiring alterations to the iOS application so that the system remains sustainable and efficient in resources and time management.

Work: 
- Evaluate the current architecture of the Manage My ID system to identify dependencies between the website and iOS application.
- Implement a decoupled architecture that allows changes to the website independently of the iOS application.
- Test the website changes to ensure no unintended impacts on the iOS application functionality.
- Confirm that the website updates meet the required functionality and do not introduce new bugs or inefficiencies.
- Document the changes and the new architecture to maintain transparency and ease of future updates.

text: The application should be connected to the Internet.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Responsible Internet Connectivity

Description: As an application user, I want the application to be connected to the Internet so that I can access up-to-date information and services securely and responsibly.

Work: 
- Ensure the application uses secure protocols for data transmission over the Internet.
- Implement measures for data protection and privacy in compliance with relevant regulations.
- Provide clear communication to users regarding what data is collected and how it is used.
- Establish reliable uptime and connectivity to ensure users have consistent and trustworthy access to services.
- Develop a system for monitoring connectivity issues and addressing them promptly to maintain user trust.

text: The application should be connected to the GPS device.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Privacy

Title: Enable GPS Connectivity with Respect for User Privacy

Description: As a privacy-conscious user, I want the application to connect to the GPS device only with clear consent and transparent options, so that I can maintain control over my location data and ensure my privacy is protected.

Work: 
- Ensure the application requests explicit user consent before connecting to the GPS device.
- Provide a clear and understandable explanation of why GPS connectivity is necessary and how location data will be used.
- Include options for users to enable or disable GPS connectivity at any time.
- Implement robust data protection measures to safeguard location information from unauthorized access.
- Regularly review and update privacy policies related to GPS data usage and inform users of any changes.

text: The application should be easy to extend. The code should be written in a way that it favors implementation of new functions.
ethical_us:
Title: Flexible and Extensible Codebase for Development Teams

Description: As a software developer, I want the application code to be easy to extend so that I can efficiently implement new functions without unnecessary complexity.

Work: 
- Ensure the code is modular and follows best practices for extensibility.
- Apply design patterns that promote extendability, such as the Open/Closed Principle.
- Write clear and comprehensive documentation to facilitate future developments.
- Implement a review process to validate that new code does not hinder the ability to extend the application further.
- Test new functions to ensure they integrate smoothly with existing code. 

The chosen ethical principle related to this requirement is **Responsibility**. This principle emphasizes the developers' responsibility to create a system that can be efficiently maintained and upgraded, ensuring accountability and integrity in the long-term development process.

text: Test environments should be built for the application to allow testing of the applications different functions.
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent Testing Environments for App Functionality

Description: As a developer, I want to build test environments for the application to allow comprehensive testing of the application's different functions so that any issues can be identified and communicated openly, ensuring the app functions transparently and effectively.

Work: 
- Create a separate test environment that mirrors the production environment.
- Implement detailed logging and reporting features within the test environment.
- Ensure the test environment allows for the testing of all functionalities without impacting the live application.
- Document and communicate testing processes and outcomes clearly.
- Regularly update the test environment to reflect any changes in the production environment.  
- Obtain stakeholder feedback on the transparency and understandability of test results.

text: The application should be portable with iOS and Android.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Freedom and Autonomy

Title: Ensure Cross-Platform Accessibility for Enhanced User Autonomy

Description: As a mobile user, I want the application to be available on both iOS and Android platforms so that I can freely choose the device I prefer without losing access to the application's features.

Work:
- Ensure the application is developed and tested for compatibility on both iOS and Android operating systems.
- Verify that all features work seamlessly on both platforms without performance degradation.
- Conduct user trials to confirm a consistent user experience across different devices.
- Provide clear documentation on any platform-specific differences and resolutions. 
- Gather feedback from users on both platforms to identify and address any potential usability issues.

text: The system shall show a tabbed display (or equivalent functionality) with the campus map on one tab and info on the most recently announced building on the other.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Transparency  

Title: Transparent Access to Campus Information  

Description: As a student, I want to have easy access to the campus map and recent building announcements so that I can stay informed and navigate the campus efficiently.  

Work:  
- The system shall have a clear and visible tabbed interface for switching between the campus map and building information.   
- The campus map should be detailed and up-to-date, allowing students to find locations and navigate effectively.     
- The most recently announced building information should be prominently displayed, with clear details about its purpose and any relevant updates.    
- Provide a user guide or tooltip for navigating the tabbed display for first-time users.    
- Ensure that updates to the tabs (map or building information) are communicated to the users in real-time.

text: The system shall allow the user to scroll the campus map from the campus map tab.
ethical_us:
Title: User-Friendly Campus Navigation

Description: As a student, I want to scroll the campus map from the campus map tab so that I can easily locate buildings and facilities without difficulty.

Work:
- Ensure the campus map is interactive and scrollable within the tab.
- Verify the scrolling function works smoothly on all devices and screen sizes.
- Provide clear instructions or tooltips for users on how to navigate the map.
- Test the feature for seamless integration with accessibility tools for students with disabilities.

text: The campus map shall provide visual clues regarding what areas have prepared audio and therefore may be selected.
ethical_us:
Title: Visual Accessibility Cues on Campus Map

Description: As a visually impaired student, I want the campus map to provide visual clues about areas with prepared audio features so that I can navigate the campus independently and effectively.

Work:
- Ensure the campus map indicates areas with prepared audio features using distinct visual markers.
- Provide a legend or key explaining these visual markers for clarity.
- Test the visual markers for intuitiveness and accessibility with a diverse group of visually impaired users.
- Ensure that the digital version of the map is compatible with screen readers and other assistive technologies.
- Implement a feedback mechanism for users to report missing or malfunctioning audio features. 

The ethical principle most related to this requirement is the principle of Dignity. By ensuring that visually impaired individuals have access to clear and useful information on the campus map, their inherent worth and rights to equal access and respectful treatment are acknowledged and supported.

text: The campus map shall have a pause/resume button. The pause and resume button will allow the user to scroll and select other buildings without being interrupted by the automatic search and announce feature.
ethical_us:
Title: Enable User-Controlled Navigation on Campus Map

Description: As a visually impaired student, I want to have the ability to pause and resume the campus map's automatic search and announce feature so that I can navigate and select buildings at my own pace without unnecessary interruptions.

Work: 
- Implement a pause button that temporarily stops the automatic search and announce feature.
- Implement a resume button that restarts the automatic feature from where it was paused.
- Ensure the feature is easily accessible and operable by users needing assistive technologies.
- Test the functionality to confirm it does not interfere with the map's other features.
- Collect feedback from visually impaired users to validate the usability and effectiveness of the pause/resume feature.

This user story is closely aligned with the ethical principle of Freedom and Autonomy, allowing users to maintain control over their interaction with the AI-driven map, thus supporting their autonomy in navigation.

text: The system shall provide a way to return to the startup screen.
ethical_us:
Title: Easy Navigation for User Autonomy

Description: As a user, I want to have the ability to return to the startup screen easily so that I can maintain control over my navigation experience and make autonomous choices about my activities within the system.

Work:
- Implement a clearly visible and accessible button for returning to the startup screen on all pages.
- Ensure that the return button is functional and consistently redirects the user to the startup screen without error.
- Test the navigation feature with a diverse group of users to confirm ease of use and clarity.
- Provide on-screen guidance or tooltips to inform users about using the return navigation feature.

text: It should generate a report about registered complaint to the admin and response report to the user who has submitted his queries.
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent Complaint Handling and Feedback System

Description: As a user who submits a complaint or query, I want to receive a response report and for the admin to generate a report about registered complaints so that the process is transparent and I can trust that my issue is being addressed.

Work:
- Ensure that a confirmation message is sent to the user upon complaint submission, including a reference number.
- Develop a mechanism to compile and send a summary response report to the user after addressing their query or complaint.
- Create an accessible admin dashboard that automatically generates detailed reports on registered complaints and their status updates.
- Implement clear communication protocols for users to track their complaint status in real time.
- Maintain a log of all complaint responses and resolutions for admin review to ensure transparency.
- Regularly update users on the progress of their complaint resolution until completion.

text: The system should maintain correct schedules of labs and the documentation of all the lab equipment.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Accurate Lab Schedules and Equipment Documentation

Description: As a lab manager, I want the system to maintain correct schedules of labs and documentation of all lab equipment so that I can efficiently manage resources and ensure the smooth operation of the lab activities.

Work:
- The system must provide up-to-date and accurate schedules for all lab sessions.
- The system should allow for easy updates and modifications of lab schedules when necessary.
- All lab equipment must be documented accurately with its current status and availability.
- Users must be able to access equipment documentation easily and verify the accuracy of the information.
- Implement automated notifications for any changes made to schedules or equipment statuses.
- Maintain an audit trail for all changes made to the schedules and documentation to ensure integrity and accountability.

text: The system should use the company colors and logos.
ethical_us:
Title: Consistent Branding for User Clarity

Description: As a brand manager, I want the system to consistently use the company colors and logos so that users can easily recognize and trust our brand identity across all interactions.

Work:
- Ensure that all digital interfaces and printed materials display the official company logo correctly.
- Verify the use of company-approved color palettes in all design elements of the system.
- Conduct user testing to confirm that the brand identity is easily recognizable across different platforms and devices.
- Document and implement guidelines for any future updates to brand elements in the system.

text: The system shall be capable of restoring itself to its previous state in the event of failure (e.g. a system crash or power loss).
ethical_us:
**Title:** Ensuring System Reliability and Continuity

**Description:** As a system administrator, I want the system to be capable of restoring itself to its previous state in the event of a failure (e.g., a system crash or power loss) so that the integrity and continuity of operations are maintained, minimizing data loss and downtime.

**Work:**
- Implement automated backup processes at regular intervals to capture system states.
- Design and test robust recovery procedures to ensure seamless restoration after a failure.
- Provide clear documentation on the restoration process for system administrators.
- Ensure that restoration processes comply with data integrity and security standards.
- Conduct regular drills to test system recovery capabilities in simulated failure scenarios.

text: The system shall be able to display a menu at all times to facilitate manual order taking should the need arise.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Smooth Ordering Process 

Description: As a staff member, I want to have access to a menu at all times so that I can manually take orders without interruption.

Work: 
- Ensure the menu is always accessible through a dedicated button or link on the system interface.
- The menu must be fully functional and allow for easy navigation and selection of items.
- Implement a failsafe mechanism to display the menu even in case of system errors.
- Test the menu display functionality under different scenarios to ensure reliability.
- Provide a brief user guide explaining how to access and use the menu for manual order taking.

text: The system shall utilise periodic 30-second keep-alive messages between tablets and the server to monitor tablet operational status.
ethical_us:
**Title: Ensuring Trust Through Operational Status Monitoring**

**Description:** As an IT systems administrator, I want to ensure tablets are communicating with the server through periodic 30-second keep-alive messages, so that I can trust the system's operational status and address any connectivity issues promptly.

**Work:**
- Implement a mechanism for tablets to send keep-alive messages to the server every 30 seconds.
- Develop server-side logic to monitor and log the receipt of keep-alive messages from each tablet.
- Design alerts to notify the administrator if a tablet fails to send keep-alive messages within a specified timeframe.
- Conduct tests to validate the consistency and accuracy of keep-alive messages between the tablets and the server.
- Ensure that the system adheres to data protection standards while monitoring tablet operational status.

text: The system shall flag tablets that fail to send timely keep-alive messages as non-operational and disassociate the assigned waiter from the tablet.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Fairness and Efficiency in Resource Allocation

Description: As a restaurant manager, I want the system to automatically flag and disassociate tablets that fail to send timely keep-alive messages so that waiters are not unfairly held accountable for non-operational devices and can continue their work efficiently.

Work: 
- The system must monitor keep-alive messages from each tablet every minute.
- If a tablet fails to send a keep-alive message within a predefined time period, flag it as non-operational.
- Automatically disassociate the faulty tablet from the assigned waiter in the system.
- Notify both the manager and the affected waiter about the disassociation.
- Provide a system report indicating which tablets are currently flagged as non-operational and awaiting technical review.

text: A waiter password used for tablet login must have a bit-strength of at least 64 bits.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Secure Logins for Waitstaff

Description: As a restaurant owner, I want the waiter password used for tablet login to have a bit-strength of at least 64 bits so that I can ensure the security and privacy of sensitive customer information and transactions.

Work: 
- Verify that the password encryption algorithm supports a minimum of 64-bit strength.
- Implement password policies enforcing at least 64-bit strength requirements for waitstaff passwords.
- Conduct security tests to confirm passwords cannot be easily compromised.
- Provide training to waitstaff on creating strong passwords to meet the required bit-strength.
- Ensure that system logs and alerts are in place for any login attempts with weaker passwords. 

This user story aligns with the principle of Privacy, as it aims to protect sensitive data by ensuring strong password security.

text: A waiter password used for tablet login must be changed every three months.
ethical_us:
Title: Regular Password Update for Secure Access

Description: As a restaurant manager, I want waiters to change their tablet login passwords every three months so that customer and establishment data is protected, ensuring privacy and trust in our system's security measures.

Work:

- Implement a reminder system prompting waiters to change their passwords every three months.
- Ensure the system checks for password updates, disallowing login with an expired password.
- Provide a user-friendly interface for password change procedures.
- Enforce strong password policies to enhance security.
- Log all password change activities for auditing and accountability purposes.

text: A waiter shall only be able to log into one tablet at any given instance of time.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Secure Access for Waitstaff

Description: As a restaurant manager, I want to ensure that a waiter can only log into one tablet at any given time so that the restaurant operations remain secure and employee accountability is maintained.

Work:
- Implement a system check to ensure only one active session per user account at any given time.
- Notify the user with an appropriate message if they attempt to log into a second device.
- Log these attempts for review in case of repeated unauthorized access attempts.
- Conduct regular audits and testing to ensure this security feature is consistently working as expected. 

Related Ethical Principle: Responsibility - By ensuring that a waiter can only log into one tablet at a time, the system promotes accountability and secures sensitive operational data, thus acting with integrity regarding access control and security.

text: A waiter that attempts to log into a second tablet while already logged into another tablet shall be rejected and notified through both tablets.
ethical_us:
The requirement is primarily related to the ethical principle of Trust. The system ensures that user sessions are secure and anomalies or misuse are promptly addressed, maintaining the integrity and reliability of the technology.

Title: Secure Access Management for Waiters

Description: As a restaurant manager, I want to ensure that a waiter cannot be logged into more than one tablet simultaneously so that unauthorized usage or potential misuse of the system is avoided and the system remains trustworthy.

Work:
- Implement a system check to detect when the same waiter attempts to log into a second tablet while logged onto another.
- Design a notification system to alert the waiter on both tablets that the login attempt has been rejected.
- Log the incident for management's audit and review, indicating the time, location, and devices involved.
- Test the feature to ensure that simultaneous login attempts are effectively blocked and both notifications are sent promptly.
- Provide training for staff on the importance of secure access and consequences of unauthorized attempts.

text: A display shall not require a user to log in.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring User Accessibility Without Mandatory Login

Description: As a user, I want to access the display content without needing to log in so that I can freely and easily use the service without compromising my autonomy or privacy.

Work:
1. Verify that the display content is fully accessible without a login process.
2. Ensure that user data is not collected or stored when accessing content without logging in.
3. Test the display functionality to confirm it does not prompt or force a login.
4. Gather user feedback on the accessibility experience without login and make necessary adjustments.
5. Confirm that the design supports user autonomy and respects privacy principles.

text: A surface computer shall not require a user to log in.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring User Freedom and Autonomy with Login-Free Access

Description: As a user, I want to access the surface computer without needing to log in so that I can maintain my autonomy and feel free to use the device without unnecessary constraints.

Work: 
- Verify that the surface computer allows access without requiring a login.
- Ensure that all features and functionalities are accessible without logging in.
- Test to confirm that no personal data is inadvertently collected due to the absence of a login process.
- Validate that the security of the device is not compromised by enabling login-free access.
- Gather and analyze user feedback on the experience of not having to log in to ensure it aligns with user autonomy and satisfaction.

text: A tablet shall require a user to log in using a username and password.
ethical_us:
**Title: Secure Access Through User Authentication**

**Description:** As a user, I want to log in to the tablet using a username and password so that my personal data is protected and privacy is ensured.

**Work:**
- The system must prompt users for a username and password upon startup.
- Passwords must be stored securely using encryption.
- The login mechanism must lock after a set number of failed attempts to prevent unauthorized access.
- The system must provide a way to securely reset passwords.
- Users must be informed about their privacy rights and how their data is protected.
- Regular security audits must be conducted to ensure the integrity of the login mechanism. 

This user story aligns with the principle of Privacy, ensuring that users' data is protected through secure access controls.

text: The system will fully function in major browsers.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Web Accessibility and Compatibility

Description: As a web user, I want the system to fully function on major browsers so that I can access the service without facing browser-related discrimination.

Work:
- Verify the system's compatibility with the latest versions of all major browsers (e.g., Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge).
- Conduct cross-browser testing to ensure consistent performance and appearance.
- Ensure that all functionalities and features are operational across different browsers.
- Address any discrepancies or issues found during browser compatibility testing promptly.
- Update documentation to reflect supported browser versions and any limitations.

text: The system will support mobile users in some way.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Mobile Accessibility for All Users

Description: As a mobile user, I want to access the system seamlessly so that I can use its features and services without being restricted by my choice of device, ensuring fairness and accessibility.

Work: 
- Ensure the system interface is responsive and adapts to different mobile screen sizes and orientations.
- Test the system's performance on common mobile operating systems (iOS, Android) to confirm compatibility.
- Conduct usability testing with a diverse group of mobile users to identify and address any accessibility challenges.
- Implement mobile-friendly navigation and interaction designs to facilitate ease of use.
- Include clear indicators and guidance for mobile-specific actions or gestures required by the system.
- Evaluate and optimize loading times for mobile connections to ensure efficiency and speed.
- Ensure data privacy and security measures are robust and mobile-specific vulnerabilities are addressed.

text: Responses to view information shall take no longer than 5 seconds to appear on the screen.
ethical_us:
**Title:** Ensuring Responsive Access to Information

**Description:** As an everyday user, I want to view information on my screen with a maximum delay of 5 seconds so that I can trust and rely on the system for efficient and timely access to necessary data.

**Work:**
1. The system shall be optimized to deliver information within 5 seconds of a request being made.
2. Implement performance monitoring tools to track response times and identify bottlenecks.
3. Conduct regular testing to ensure response times consistently meet the 5-second requirement.
4. Provide users with feedback (e.g., loading indicators) during retrieval times that exceed the standard.
5. Maintain documentation and transparent communication regarding any known response time issues and the actions planned to resolve them.

(Note: The principle related to this requirement is Trust, as ensuring timely responses builds user trust and reliability in the system's functionality.)

text: The system shall accommodate large data items without fault.
ethical_us:
Title: Reliable Data Handling for System Integrity

Description: As a data engineer, I want the system to accommodate large data items without fault so that we ensure system reliability and maintain trust in our technical capabilities.

Work:
- Implement efficient data handling mechanisms to process large datasets correctly.
- Conduct stress testing to identify any potential bottlenecks or failures when managing large data.
- Create alerts for when data processing approaches system capacity limits.
- Ensure detailed documentation of system capabilities and limitations regarding data size.
- Regularly update system infrastructure to handle increasing data loads efficiently.

text: System will use secured database.
ethical_us:
Title: Secure Data Storage for Privacy Protection

Description: As a data privacy officer, I want the system to use a secured database so that personal data remains protected and compliant with privacy regulations.

Work:
- Ensure the database is encrypted both at rest and in transit.
- Implement access control measures to limit data access to authorized personnel only.
- Conduct regular security audits and vulnerability assessments on the database.
- Implement logging and monitoring mechanisms to detect any unauthorized access attempts.
- Ensure compliance with relevant data protection regulations and standards, such as GDPR or HIPAA.

text: Unauthorised users can only read data without modifying anything.
ethical_us:
**Title: Protecting Data Integrity from Unauthorized Users**

**Description:** As a **system administrator**, I want to ensure that unauthorized users can only read data without modifying anything **so that** data integrity is maintained and system security is upheld.

**Work:**

- Unauthorized users must have read-only access to all data they access.
- Implement robust authentication mechanisms to identify authorized and unauthorized users.
- Log and monitor access attempts by unauthorized users for auditing and security review.
- Ensure that data cannot be altered or deleted by users who have not been granted explicit modification permissions.
- Conduct regular security audits to verify that read-only restrictions are consistently applied for unauthorized users.

The ethical principle related to this requirement is **Trust**. The requirement ensures that unauthorized users cannot alter data, which maintains the integrity and reliability of the system. This builds trust in the system's ability to protect data and function effectively, ensuring that only authorized modifications are made.

text: ABS shall handle all expected and unexpected errors in ways that prevent loss in information and long downtime period.
ethical_us:
**Title: Error Management for System Reliability**

**Description:** As a **system administrator**, I want to ensure that ABS handles all expected and unexpected errors effectively so that there is no loss of information and downtime is minimized.

**Work:**
- [ ] The system must log all errors with detailed information.
- [ ] Implement automatic error recovery procedures to minimize downtime.
- [ ] Ensure data backup processes are triggered during error events to prevent information loss.
- [ ] Notify the system administrator of any critical errors in real-time.
- [ ] Develop a user-friendly interface for viewing and understanding error logs.
- [ ] Conduct regular testing of error handling mechanisms to ensure they perform as expected.
- [ ] Provide comprehensive documentation for handling and troubleshooting errors.

text: Authenticate and Login user to the web app.
ethical_us:
Title: Secure and Privacy-Preserving User Authentication

Description: As a web application user, I want to authenticate and log in to the web app in a secure manner so that my personal information and privacy are protected from unauthorized access and misuse.

Work:
- Ensure the login system encrypts user credentials during transmission and storage.
- Implement multi-factor authentication to enhance security.
- Provide clear information about data usage and privacy policies during the login process.
- Ensure the system logs and audits login attempts for security monitoring while maintaining user confidentiality.
- Conduct regular security assessments and updates to address potential vulnerabilities.

text: Enable new users to register to the tech support system.
ethical_us:
Title: New User Registration with Privacy Assurance

Description: As a tech support user, I want to register for the tech support system without compromising my personal data, so that my privacy is protected while gaining access to support services.

Work: 
- Ensure the registration process collects only necessary information, minimizing data collection.
- Implement data encryption to secure personal information during transmission and storage.
- Provide clear information to users about what personal data is collected, how it is used, and their rights regarding this data.
- Include a privacy policy agreement that users must accept during registration.
- Offer users control over their data, such as the ability to view, edit, or delete their personal information.
- Conduct regular audits to ensure compliance with privacy standards and regulations.

text: Enable a registered user to change his password if he forgets his password.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Secure Password Recovery for Users

**Description**: As a registered user, I want to be able to change my password if I forget it so that I can regain secure access to my account without compromising my personal information.

**Work**:

- Trigger password recovery process through a "Forgot Password?" link on the login page.
- Verify user identity via email or SMS confirmation to ensure security.
- Allow users to securely set a new password after identity verification.
- Ensure the new password meets security guidelines (e.g., minimum length, complexity).
- Provide a confirmation message once the password is successfully changed.
- Log any password change attempts for audit purposes without storing sensitive data.

text: Enable a registered user to view his profile. Additional information viz. questions asked by him and answers posted by him are also displayed.
ethical_us:
Title: User Profile Transparency for Registered Users

Description: As a registered user, I want to view my profile, including the questions I have asked and the answers I have posted, so that I can maintain transparency and keep track of my activities on the platform.

Work: 
- Ensure users can log into their accounts and access their profile page securely.
- Display the user's personal information and activities clearly and concisely.
- Include a section for the questions asked by the user, organized by date or topic.
- Ensure answers posted by the user are displayed, with links to the original questions.
- Validate that the information displayed is accurate and up-to-date.
- Provide an option for the user to update their profile information if necessary.
- Ensure the transparency of operations so that users understand how their data is used and displayed.

text: Enable a user to view questions and their corresponding answers.
ethical_us:
Title: Transparent Question-Answer Visibility

Description: As a user, I want to view questions and their corresponding answers so that I can understand the information provided transparently and verify its completeness and accuracy.

Work: 
- Display a list of questions linked to their corresponding answers.
- Ensure all questions and answers are presented in a clear and understandable manner.
- Allow users to navigate between questions and answers easily.
- Provide information on when and by whom each question was answered.
- Include an option for users to report any discrepancies or unclear answers for further clarification.

text: Enable a logged in user to ask questions.
ethical_us:
Title: Seamless Question Inquiry for Empowered Users

Description: As a logged-in user, I want to ask questions transparently so that I can receive accurate, relevant, and helpful answers without any hidden processes or biases affecting the response.

Work: 
- Ensure that the user interface clearly indicates how to ask a question.
- Provide feedback to the user once a question is submitted, confirming receipt.
- Include an explanation of how questions are processed and how responses are generated.
- Maintain a log of submitted questions and responses visible to the user to ensure accountability.
- Validate the system accuracy and fairness periodically to ensure unbiased answers are provided.
- Collect user feedback on the question-answering process for continuous improvement.

text: Enable a logged in user to post answers.
ethical_us:
**Title: Enable User to Post Answers Transparently**

**Description:** As a community member, I want to post answers to questions transparently so that my contributions are shared honestly and with full clarity to benefit others without misinformation.

**Work:**

- Ensure the user interface provides clear instructions on how answers are displayed and attributed to the user.
- Implement a visibility feature where users can preview how their answer will appear once posted.
- Provide clear guidelines on acceptable content and usage policies before a user submits their answer.
- Develop an easy-to-use edit feature that allows users to modify answers while maintaining a transparent edit history.
- Ensure that all actions related to posting answers are logged and retrievable for accountability.

text: Enable a logged in user to up vote and down vote answers.
ethical_us:
Title: User Feedback System for Equitable Content Ranking

Description: As a community member, I want to upvote and downvote answers so that I can help ensure that high-quality and fair content is surfaced, reducing bias and promoting justice and fairness.

Work:
- Ensure logged-in users can see upvote and downvote buttons next to answers.
- Implement a system where each vote is counted once per user to prevent gaming the system.
- Ensure an explanation is displayed to users about how their votes impact the ranking and visibility of content.
- Maintain a record of votes to monitor potential misuse of the voting system and mitigate unfair voting practices.
- Provide accessibility features to ensure all users, regardless of ability, can participate equally in the voting process.
- Test with a diverse set of users to ensure that the voting system supports equitable content ranking and does not inherently favor any group.

text: Provide an interface for the admin to approve posts so that posts are not visible without admin approval.
ethical_us:
Title: Admin Post Approval Interface for Ethical Content Management

Description: As an Admin, I want to approve posts before they become visible so that the platform ensures responsibility and trustworthiness in published content.

Work: 
- Ensure the admin approval interface is easily accessible and user-friendly.
- Implement clear guidelines and criteria for admins on what constitutes an approvable post.
- Create a notification system that alerts admins of new posts pending approval.
- Develop logging mechanisms to record admin decisions for accountability and transparency.
- Test the system for efficiency to ensure timely approval without unnecessary delays.
- Provide training sessions for admins on ethical content management practices.

text: Enable the admin to generate reports which contains all the posts and their corresponding replies.
ethical_us:
Title: Administrative Transparency in Content Reporting

Description: As an admin, I want to be able to generate reports that contain all posts and their corresponding replies so that I can monitor user activity transparently, ensuring compliance with community standards and guidelines.

Work: 
- The system should allow admins to access a report generation feature.
- The feature must include filtering options to select specific timeframes for the reports.
- The generated reports must include detailed records of each post and its corresponding replies.
- The reports should be presented in a clear, understandable format that allows for comprehensive review.
- The system should ensure that report generation adheres to privacy regulations, protecting sensitive user data.
- Verify that the report contains only necessary information to maintain user confidentiality.

text: Information transmission should be securely transmitted to server without any changes in information.
ethical_us:
**Title:** Secure and Unaltered Information Transmission

**Description:** As a **data user**, I want to **ensure information is transmitted securely to the server without any changes** so that **the integrity of the information is maintained and trust is preserved**.

**Work:**
- Implement end-to-end encryption for data transmission.
- Ensure data validation checks are conducted before and after the transmission.
- Implement integrity verification mechanisms to detect any alterations.
- Conduct regular audits and testing to ensure compliance with security protocols.
- Ensure all team members are trained on secure transmission best practices. 

This user story aligns with the ethical principle of **Trust**, as it focuses on ensuring systems work properly to protect data and maintain the integrity of information, building trust in the system's reliability and security.

text: Be intuitive even to first time users
ethical_us:
Title: Intuitive User Experience for Novice Users

Description: As a first-time user, I want to intuitively understand and navigate the AI system so that I can effectively use its features without unnecessary guidance or frustration.

Work:
- Ensure the user interface is designed with simplicity and clarity in mind, using familiar visual elements.
- Conduct usability testing with first-time users to identify areas of confusion or complexity.
- Implement a step-by-step onboarding process that guides users through key features during their first interaction.
- Provide easily accessible help and support options, including tooltips, FAQs, and contact support, to assist users who may struggle.
- Regularly update design and interface based on user feedback to continually improve intuitiveness.

This requirement aligns with the ethical principle of Transparency, focusing on understandability and communication to ensure users can effectively engage with the AI system.

text: Flea Market system will interface with the web server and RDBMS software using APIs provided by the implementation language
ethical_us:
**Title: Transparent Integration of APIs in Flea Market System**

**Description:** As a developer, I want to ensure that the Flea Market system transparently interfaces with the web server and RDBMS software using APIs provided by the implementation language so that users and stakeholders have clear visibility on data flows and interactions, ensuring transparency and traceability.

**Work:**

- Ensure that the API documentation is comprehensive, detailing the methods, endpoints, and data types being used.
- Implement logging mechanisms to record API interactions to track data exchange and ensure traceability.
- Provide an accessible and understandable report of data flow through the APIs to system maintenance teams.
- Conduct regular reviews of API integration for any updates in the implementation language and adjust documentation and systems accordingly.
- Verify that the stakeholders are informed about any changes or updates in the API integration processes.

text: All transactions at the Flea Market require a valid user ID and password.
ethical_us:
**Title: Secure Access to Transactions at the Flea Market**

**Description:** As a user, I want all transactions at the Flea Market to require a valid user ID and password so that my personal information and transaction data are protected against unauthorized access.

**Work:**

- Verify that users must provide a valid user ID and password before initiating any transaction.
- Implement strong password requirements to enhance security (e.g., minimum length, use of special characters).
- Ensure that the system enforces account lockout after a specified number of failed login attempts.
- Provide users with the option to securely reset their passwords in case of loss or compromise.
- Conduct regular audits to ensure the user authentication process is effective and secure.
- Implement data encryption for all transaction-related information during transmission and storage. 

This user story is most related to the ethical principle of **Privacy**, as it focuses on protecting users' personal information and transaction data.

text: Secure data transfer over the Internet could be provided using SSL encryption that will be configured by the host system administrator.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensure Secure Data Transmission via SSL Encryption

Description: As a system administrator, I want to configure SSL encryption to secure data transfer over the Internet so that I can ensure the privacy and integrity of user data and build trust in the online transactions that occur on our platform.

Work:
- Verify that SSL encryption is configured and activated on the server.
- Ensure that SSL certificates are up-to-date and properly installed.
- Conduct regular audits and tests to ensure the encryption works as intended and does not have any vulnerabilities.
- Document the SSL encryption process to maintain transparency with users about data protection measures.
- Provide clear instructions and training for staff on maintaining SSL security configurations.

text: The IP addresses where the transaction was made from will be logged.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Privacy

Title: Ethical Logging of Transaction IP Addresses

Description: As a responsible data operator, I want to ensure that IP addresses are logged ethically during transactions so that user privacy is respected and protected.

Work:
- Implement IP logging mechanisms that comply with data protection regulations.
- Ensure that logged IP addresses are encrypted and securely stored.
- Provide users with clear and transparent information about the use and storage of their IP addresses.
- Create opt-in/opt-out mechanisms for users where feasible and appropriate according to legal guidelines.
- Regularly audit the system to ensure IP address logs are being handled in accordance with privacy policies and legal requirements.

text: User passwords will be stored in the database in an encrypted format.
ethical_us:
Title: Secure Password Storage for User Protection

Description: As a conscientious developer, I want to store user passwords in the database in an encrypted format so that users' privacy and data security are protected.

Work: 
- Ensure that a strong encryption algorithm is selected and implemented for password storage.
- Validate that encrypted passwords are stored securely in the database.
- Develop a secure method for handling password encryption and decryption without exposing raw passwords.
- Conduct a security audit to confirm that encrypted passwords cannot be easily decrypted or accessed by unauthorized parties.
- Implement automated testing to consistently check the integrity and security of password encryption mechanisms.

text: Most of the system functions will be controlled using the administrative interface.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Responsibility

Title: Ensuring Responsible Access through the Administrative Interface

Description: As a system administrator, I want to control most of the system functions using the administrative interface so that I can manage and account for the system's operations responsibly and securely.

Work: 
- Verify that the administrative interface includes authentication procedures to ensure that only authorized personnel can access it.
- Ensure that the interface provides clear logs and audit trails of all actions taken by administrators for accountability.
- Confirm that the administrative interface has safeguards to prevent unauthorized changes to critical system functions.
- Test the interface usability to ensure that administrators can understand and use it effectively for responsible decision-making.
- Validate that training materials and guides are provided to administrators to promote informed and responsible use of the interface.

text: Detailed documentation of the code and SRS will enable easy maintenance of the Flea Market.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensure Transparent Documentation for Easy Maintenance

Description: As a software maintainer, I want detailed documentation of the code and Software Requirements Specification (SRS) so that I can easily maintain and update the Flea Market system.

Work:
- The codebase must include comprehensive comments explaining complex algorithms and decisions.
- The SRS should be updated to reflect the current design and functional requirements of the Flea Market system.
- Documentation must include a change log detailing all updates and modifications to the code and SRS.
- A README file must provide an overview of the code structure, dependencies, and setup instructions.
- Conduct a peer review of the documentation to ensure clarity and completeness.
- Make documentation accessible to all team members involved in the maintenance and operations of the Flea Market system.

text: Information recorded must include an optional field for context.
ethical_us:
Title: Enhance Data Transparency with Contextual Information

Description: As an end user, I want to have the option to include context when recording information so that I can better understand and interpret the data in the future.

Work:
- Ensure the data entry interface includes an optional field for recording context alongside the primary information.
- Display a tooltip or help text explaining the importance and usage of the context field to users.
- Allow users to leave the context field blank if they do not wish to provide additional information.
- Store the context data securely alongside the primary information in the database.
- Provide a mechanism to retrieve and display context information clearly when data is viewed or processed later.

text: Information should be tagged according to who is entering the data.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensure Data Entry Accountability and Transparency

Description: As a data management officer, I want to have information tagged according to who is entering the data so that we can ensure accountability and maintain transparency within the data entry process.

Work:
- Verify that every data entry field has an associated tag indicating the user's identity or role.
- Ensure the user tag is linked to the system's authentication process to accurately capture and display the user's information.
- Create a log of all data entries, including the user ID and timestamp, for audit and review purposes.
- Provide access controls to ensure only authorized personnel can view or edit user tags.
- Implement a mechanism to notify data management officers of entries missing tags or those that appear without authorization.
- Test the system to confirm that all entered data can be traced back to the responsible individual without any discrepancies.

text: It must be able to download the most recent medical record.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensuring Patient's Access to Recent Medical Records

Description: As a medical professional, I want to download the most recent medical record for a patient so that I can provide timely and accurate care, while respecting the patient's privacy and maintaining their dignity.

Work: 
- Verify user identity and authorization before allowing access to medical records.
- Ensure that downloading the medical record complies with privacy regulations and the patient's consent has been obtained.
- Provide a secure and seamless process for downloading medical records.
- Ensure that the downloaded records are accurate, up-to-date, and complete.
- Maintain a log of access and downloads for auditing and transparency purposes.

text: It must store the most recent copy of information in its application data folder.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensure Accurate Information Storage

Description: As a responsible data maintainer, I want to store the most recent copy of information in the application data folder so that users can trust that they are accessing the most current and accurate data.

Work: 
- Verify that the application automatically updates the data folder with the most recent copy of information whenever changes are made.
- Ensure the system provides a log of updates showing the date and time the information was last stored.
- Test the retrieval process to confirm that only the most recent information is presented to users.
- Implement safeguards to prevent outdated information from being stored in the application data folder. 

This user story is related to the ethical principle of Trust, as it ensures that users can rely on the system to provide current and accurate data, thereby building and maintaining their trust in the application's functionality.

text: It must only update the parts that have changed when connecting to the server.
ethical_us:
Title: Efficient Data Update to Enhance System Sustainability

Description: As a system administrator, I want the application to update only the parts that have changed when connecting to the server so that we can reduce unnecessary data transfer and promote resource efficiency.

Work:
- Ensure that the system identifies and flags only modified data for updates.
- Implement a mechanism that selectively updates the flagged data on the server.
- Reduce network load by optimizing data packets for only changed data sections.
- Test the update process to confirm that it effectively identifies and updates changed data only.
- Monitor server efficiency and resource usage to ensure sustainability targets are met.

text: It must be able to change and update information on the server.
ethical_us:
Ethical Principle: Transparency

Title: Real-Time Update Transparency for Server Information

Description: As a Data Administrator, I want to change and update information on the server in a transparent manner so that all changes can be tracked, explained, and communicated clearly to the stakeholders.

Work: 
- Ensure there is a version control system that logs all updates and changes made to the server information.
- Implement a user-friendly dashboard that displays the history of modifications for easy tracking.
- Create automated notifications for stakeholders about significant updates or changes to server information.
- Provide a detailed explanation or notes section for each update to describe the reason and impact of the change.
- Conduct regular audits to ensure the updating process remains transparent and adheres to internal policies and external regulations.

text: The application must log the user out when it is exited.
ethical_us:
Title: Automatic Logout for Enhanced Privacy

Description: As a privacy-conscious user, I want the application to automatically log me out when it is exited so that my personal data remains secure and inaccessible to others.

Work:
- Ensure the application automatically logs out the user upon exiting.
- Verify that no session data is retained after the application closes.
- Conduct testing to confirm that reopening the application requires user re-authentication.
- Ensure that this functionality complies with privacy laws and guidelines, maintaining user data confidentiality.
- Provide clear communication to the user about this feature and its benefits for their privacy.

text: A correct combination of username and password is required for a user to login.
ethical_us:
Title: Secure User Authentication

Description: As a user, I want to be required to input a correct combination of username and password to log in so that my account and personal information remain private and protected.

Work: 
- Implement a secure login system that requires both username and password for authentication.
- Ensure that passwords are stored securely using strong hashing algorithms.
- Implement account lockouts or CAPTCHA after a number of failed login attempts to prevent unauthorized access.
- Provide notifications to users for any suspicious login activities.
- Conduct regular security audits to ensure that the authentication mechanism remains robust and up-to-date.

text: It should give a drill-down view of all data in the medical record after logging in.
ethical_us:
**Title: Ensuring Transparent Access to Medical Records**  
**Description:** As a healthcare provider, I want to have a drill-down view of all data in the medical record after logging in so that I can make informed and accurate medical decisions for patient care while maintaining transparency in accessing sensitive information.  
**Work:**  
- Verify that the login process is secure and authenticated.
- Ensure that the interface provides a clear and comprehensive view of all data within the medical record.
- Implement audit logs to track access and changes made to the medical records.
- Provide explanations and descriptors for data and attributes used within the records for better understanding.
- Ensure consistency and clarity in the user interface to facilitate easy navigation and understanding of the data.
- Conduct regular reviews and updates based on user feedback to enhance transparency and usability.

text: The user must be able to set an option to hide information based on who has tagged it.
ethical_us:
Title: Privacy Control Based on Tagging

Description: As a privacy-conscious user, I want to set an option to hide information based on who has tagged it so that I can better control who sees my personal information and maintain my privacy.

Work: 
- Acceptance Criteria:
  - Implement a settings option where users can choose to hide information based on taggers.
  - Ensure users can view and modify their privacy settings easily.
  - Provide a clear list of individuals or entities tagging user information for transparency.
  - Create a notification system to alert users when someone new tags their information.
  - Test to confirm that users' settings are correctly applied and information is hidden as per preferences.
  - Ensure user data remains secure and that changes made in settings do not lead to unintended data exposure.

text: The user must be able to add photos from his/her photo library to his/her medical record.
ethical_us:
**Title:** Secure Photo Upload for Medical Records

**Description:** As a patient, I want to securely add photos from my photo library to my medical record so that my healthcare provider can have a comprehensive overview of my condition without compromising my privacy.

**Work:**
- Ensure that the photo upload function is compliant with data protection regulations, such as GDPR or HIPAA.
- Implement end-to-end encryption for photos being uploaded.
- Provide clear information to the user about how their photos will be used and stored.
- Allow users to review and confirm before any photos are uploaded to their medical record.
- Ensure that only authorized healthcare providers have access to the uploaded photos.
- Develop a user-friendly interface for easy and secure photo selection and upload.

*Ethical Principle:* Privacy. This user story focuses on ensuring that a patient's personal data, such as photos added to a medical record, is handled securely and with the utmost respect for the individual's privacy.

text: It must allow a user to login.
ethical_us:
Title: Secure and Transparent User Authentication

Description: As a user, I want to log in securely and transparently so that I can access my account with confidence and ease.

Work:
- Implement secure authentication protocols to protect user credentials during the login process.
- Provide a clear and understandable explanation of the login process to users.
- Ensure that users are informed of any account-related activity and login attempts.
- Make the login process user-friendly without compromising security measures.
- Test and validate the login system to ensure it is free of vulnerabilities and can protect user data.
- Ensure compliance with privacy standards and regulations related to user data handling during login.

text: It must allow a user to logout.
ethical_us:
Title: User Logout Functionality for Privacy Assurance

Description: As a user, I want to have the option to log out of my session so that I can secure my personal information and maintain my privacy.

Work:
- Implement a visible and easily accessible logout button on each page of the user interface.
- Ensure that logging out immediately terminates the user session on the server side.
- Prompt the user with a confirmation message upon clicking the logout button.
- Automatically redirect the user to the login page after a successful logout.
- Clearly inform users about the scope of data that will no longer be accessible upon logging out.
- Conduct usability testing to confirm the logout process is intuitive and reliable for users.

text: All information must be viewable on the website.
ethical_us:
Title: Ensure Transparency of Information on the Website

Description: As a user, I want to view all information on the website so that I can fully understand the services offered and make informed decisions.

Work:
- Ensure that all relevant information about the services, privacy policies, and terms of use are clearly accessible on the website.
- Provide an intuitive navigation structure that allows users to easily locate and access the information they are searching for.
- Implement a search functionality on the website to enable users to find specific information quickly.
- Use straightforward and clear language to present information, avoiding technical jargon and ambiguity.
